Policy: Ley Nº 12/2017 - Ley de de urbanismo de las Illes Balears.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto establecer el régimen jurídico general regulador de la actividad administrativa en materia de urbanismo en las Illes Balears, y definir el régimen jurídico-urbanístico de la propiedad del suelo de acuerdo con su función social. Las políticas públicas relativas a la regulación, la ordenación, la ocupación, la transformación y el uso del suelo tendrán como finalidad común la utilización de este recurso de acuerdo con el interés general y según el principio de desarrollo sostenible, sin perjuicio de los objetivos específicos que les atribuyan las leyes. En virtud del principio de desarrollo sostenible, las políticas a que se refiere el apartado anterior deberán propiciar el uso racional de los recursos naturales y armonizar los requerimientos de la economía, la ocupación, la cohesión social, la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades, la salud y la seguridad de las personas, y la protección del medio ambiente.

Policy: Decreto Nº 2253 - Modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo de Minas y Energía y el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible, en lo relacionado con el incentivo a las inversiones en hidrocarburos y minería.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo de Minas y Energía y el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible, en lo relacionado con el incentivo a las inversiones en hidrocarburos y minería. La presente modificación tiene por objeto establecer los parámetros y lineamientos para el otorgamiento del incentivo al incremento de las inversiones en exploración y explotación de hidrocarburos y minerales a través de Certificados de Reembolso Tributario (CERT). Las inversiones en el sector de hidrocarburos que darán lugar al otorgamiento del CERT serán exclusivamente aquellas que tengan por objeto el descubrimiento de nuevas reservas de hidrocarburos, la adición de reservas probadas o la incorporación de nuevas reservas recuperables, ya sea mediante actividades de exploración o mediante actividades dirigidas al aumento del factor de recobro en proyectos de cuencas en tierra firme, incluidas en este último caso las respectivas pruebas piloto. En el sector de minería, las inversiones que podrán acceder al incentivo son las que tienen como objeto mantener o incrementar la producción de los proyectos actuales, acelerar los proyectos que están en transición (de construcción y montaje a explotación) e incrementar los proyectos de exploración minera.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Law No. 22.805 establishing measures related to accidents in the transport of dangerous products or waste in the State.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes measures to be taken in the occurrence of accidents in the transport of dangerous products or waste in the State, in compliance with federal legislation and other applicable state regulations. In the event of an accident occurring in the transportation of dangerous products or waste, the State, directly or through its concessionaires, shall adopt the following measures: it shall immediately call the competent bodies upon the knowledge of the occurrence of the accident; identify and isolate the accident scenario in accordance with the technical rules for emergency response to hazardous products and waste; implement to ensure signaling and information to road users in suitable places that allow the adoption of alternative routes; with the support of the traffic authority agents shall make appropriate deviations for the vehicles affected by the accident when necessary. A related Regulation will define the preventive measures and list the places with the highest incidence of accidents.

Policy: Decree No. 89/2017 regulating the Law on Protection, Conservation and Sustainable Use of Biodiversity.
Policy_Content: This Decree regulates Law No. 16/2014 on Protection, Conservation and Sustainable Use of Biodiversity. The Regulation is applicable to the set of values ​​and natural resources existing in the national territory and in waters under national jurisdiction, covering all public or private entities that may directly or indirectly influence the national system of the country's conservation areas, competing to the National Administration of Conservation Areas (ANAC). Protection zones are classified to guarantee the representative conservation of ecosystems and species and the coexistence of local communities with other interests and values to conserve. Protection zones are classified into: a) Total conservation areas; b) Conservation areas for sustainable use. In addition, it regulates the creation, modification and extinction of conservation areas, the administration and management of conservation areas, the management plans and closure programme, the permitted and prohibited activities in conservation areas (including hunting activities), the exercise of activities in the conservation areas, including the environmental license, the recovery, restoration or rehabilitation of biodiversity, the mechanisms for compensating the conservation effort, the conservation of the natural habitat, and the protection and inspection of biodiversity, setting the sanctioning regime.

Policy: Regional Law No. 116 “On some issues of regulation of land relations.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law defines the particulars of legal regulation of land relations on the regional territory for the purpose of implementation of the powers of the Republic of Dagestan as a subject of the Russian Federation in the field of land relations established by the Constitution of the Russian Federation, Land Code of the Russian Federation and other federal laws. Priority areas of land policy of the Republic of Dagestan are: (a) ensuring state regulation of land relations with a view of preservation of particularly valuable land, agricultural lands and land of protected natural areas; (b) participation of citizens, public organizations (associations) and religious organizations in dealing with issues related to their land rights; (c) interrelation of interests of the Republic of Dagestan, municipalities of the Republic of Dagestan and other participants in land relations when accepting decisions on the regulation of land relations; (d) preservation of agricultural land as principal production means in the agro-industrial complex; (e) land-use planning of municipal units; and (f) land use exclusively in accordance with authorized specific use. This Regional Law delimits powers of the regional legislative bodies, the regional executive bodies and local government in the field of land relations. It specifies cases of allotment of public and municipal land plots free of charge, cases of lease of public land without tender, including allotment of agricultural land for pastoralism, and fixes maximum land areas of land plots allotted to citizens.

Subprograms (components) of the program include: Assistance sub-program aimed for families with child(ren) in crisis (Annex 1.1); Early childhood development subprogram (Annex 1.2); Child rehabilitation/habilitation subprogram (Annex 1.3); Subprogram for rehabilitation of veterans (Annex 1.4); Day center subprogram (Annex 1.5); Subprogram for supplying support items, including supplying wheelchairs for the persons disabilities and promoting their employment (Annex 1.6); Subprogram for supporting the communication of deaf people (Annex 1.7); Subprogram for providing shelter for mothers and children (Annex 1.8); Subprogram for child foster care (Annex 1.9); Subprogram for small-sized family-type houses (Annex 1.10); Subprogram for providing shelter to homeless children (Annex 1.11); Community organizations’ subprogram (Annex 1.12); Home-based care of children with severe and deep mental developmental retardation (Annex 1.13); and Specialized family-style services subprogram for children with severe and deep disabilities and health problems (Annex 1.14).

Policy: Regulation of the Minister of Environment and Forestry of the R.I No. P.70/MENLHK/SETJEN/KUM.1/12/20171 on the Procedures for Implementing the Reduction of Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation, Role of Conservation, Sustainable Manamenent of Forest and Enhancement of Forest Carbon Stocks.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment and Forestry establishes the Procedures for Implementing the Reduction of Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation, Role of Conservation, Sustainable Manamenent of Forest and Enhancement of Forest Carbon Stocks. It is intended as a guideline for implementing REDD+ for the National responsible party, the National REDD+ management agency and the REDD+ Implementer. This Regulation aims to achieve REDD+ implementation in accordance with the requirements of the UNFCCC COP Decree on REDD+ and be consistent with national policies, and encourage REDD+ implementers to move toward full implementation of REDD+ (result-based payments), to support the achievement of the NDC implementation target in the forestry sector. The scope of this Ministerial Regulation, includes: a) the location, approach and the REDD+ Tool; and b) monitoring, evaluation and coaching. The scope of REDD + implementation covers national areas with implementation in Sub-National. The implementation of REDD+ is carried out through efforts to reduce emissions from deforestation and forest degradation, conservation of forest carbon stocks, sustainable management of forests, and enhancement of forest carbon stocks.

Policy: Regulation on the amount of compensation for the use of non-metallic raw materials for obtaining construction materials for the year 2018.
Policy_Content: This Regulation determines the amount of the compensation fee that shall be paid by all persons that use non-metallic raw materials for obtaining construction materials on the territory of the Republic of Serbia, and here relevant for related construction materials obtained in 2018. Non-metallic mineral raw materials for the production of construction materials within the meaning of this Regulation are: 1) technical-building stone-sedimentary and metamorphic rocks: limestone, dolomite, dolomitized limestone, marbled limestone, marbled dolomite, marble; 2) technical-building stone-igneous rocks: granite, granodiorite, trachyte, dacite, andesite, andesite - basalt, basalt, diabase, amphibolite, gabbro; 3) architectural-building stone: granite, granodiorite, basalt, marble, limestone breccia, marble breccia, travertine, bigar - whitefish, marble onyx, limestone; 4) clays and raw materials for the brick and ceramic industry: ceramic clay, brick clay, wood, refractory clay, kaolinized granite, feldspar; 5) raw materials for the cement industry and the lime industry: marl, marly limestone, limestone, gypsum, all types of tuffs; 6) calcium-carbonate raw material as a filler for the paint and varnish industry, facade thermal insulation materials and in other industries: marble, calcite, dolomite, dolomitized limestone, marbled limestone, limestone; 7) quartz sand and sandstone, construction sand and gravel; 8) raw materials for refractory and other industries: magnesite and bentonite clay.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Code on Subsoil and Subsoil Management (Law No. 125-VI ZRK).
Policy_Content: This Code determines the mode of subsoil use, the procedure for exercising state management and regulation in the field of subsoil use, particulars of the occurrence, exercise and termination of rights to subsoil plots, the legal status of subsoil users and their respective operations, as well as issues of subsoil use and disposal of subsoil use rights and other relations associated with the use of mineral resources. The goal of the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan on subsoil and subsoil management shall be to ensure the sustainable development of the mineral and raw material base of the Republic of Kazakhstan for the economic growth of the state and the welfare of society. The tasks of the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan on subsoil and subsoil management shall be as follows: (a) protection of the state’s ownership of the subsoil; (b) implementation of state policy and regulation of relations in the field of subsoil use; (c) respect for the interests of the state, citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan and the rights of subsoil users; (d) increase in the mineral resource base of the Republic of Kazakhstan; (e) establishing the grounds, conditions and procedure for the emergence, implementation, modification and termination of rights to use subsoil; (f) providing a legal basis for the sustainable development of subsoil use; (g) creation of conditions for attracting investments in the geological study of the subsoil and subsoil use; and (h) strengthening the rule of law in the field of subsoil use. Legal regulation of relations in the field of subsoil use is based on the principles of: (a) rational management of the state fund of mineral resources; (b) ensuring environmental safety when using subsoil; (c) availability of information in the field of subsoil use; (d) payment of subsoil use; (e) honesty of subsoil users; and (f) stability of the conditions of subsoil use. Subsoil management shall be performed in ecofriendly manner with the use of ecofriendly processes. Subsoil management shall require payment of taxes and other mandatory payments to the state budget. Subsoil shall be exclusive state property. Minerals shall be classified as groundwater, hydrocarbons and solid minerals. The right of subsoil management shall be obtained through issuance of license and conclusion of contract on subsoil management. License shall be issued for subsoil management of a single subsoil plot. License shall be issued in Kazakh and the Russian languages. The right of subsoil management can be restricted in certain specific land areas.  This Code contains X Sections divided into 278 Articles. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II regards subsoil management. Section III regards safe subsoil management. Section IV regards public governance in the field of subsoil management. Section V regards disputes concerning subsoil management, establishes liability for the infringement of the national legislation on subsoil and subsoil management, international cooperation in the field of subsoil and subsoil management. Section VI regards geological study and exploration of subsoil. Section VII regards prospecting and extraction of hydrocarbons. Section VIII regards extraction of uranium. Section IX regards prospecting and extraction of solid minerals. Section X regards use of subsoil area, free miners and lays down final and transitional provisions.
Subject: Environment gen., Mineral resources, Water
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Order No. 04 of 2017 of Director of Maritime Transport Agency of Georgia on Rules for Safe Piloting of Ships and Prevention of Pollution
Policy_Content: The Order regulates safe piloting of ships and prevention of pollution in the sea in Georgia. It consists of 18 articles: Purpose (1); Definition of terms (2); Purpose of regulation (3); Scope of regulation (4); Essential terms for the functionality of the safety system (5); Liability and authority of the company (6); Appointed person(s) (7); Liability and authority of the ship captain (8); Safety and environmental protection policy (9); Resources and personnel (10); Developing plans for onboard operations (11); Preparedness for emergencies (12); Reporting inconsistencies, accidents and dangerous situations (13); Maintenance of the ship and the tools (14); Documentation (15); Confirmation, inspection and assessment of a company (16); Issuing certificates, validity and recognition (17); and Liability for violating the rules (18). The purpose of the Order is to enhance the safety standards for ships sailing with the Georgian flag and the ships entering the sea ports of Georgia, as well as prevention of maritime pollution. Under the Order, the responsible business companies have the obligation to develop a safety and environmental protection policy. The companies also must implement such a policy at all levels of its organization onboard or on the coast.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 840 validating the Regulation on setting up public fund “Nature Development Fund”.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree validates the Statute of public fund “Nature Development Fund”, a non-governmental entity pursuing social, charitable, cultural, educational and other socially useful non-commercial objectives. The founder of the Fund is the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic. The Fund performs its activities in close cooperation with government agencies, natural and legal entities of the Kyrgyz Republic and foreign states. The activities of the Fund are based on the principles of voluntariness, self-government, legality, publicity and transparency. The objectives of the Fund shall be as follows: (a) financing environmental projects aimed at improving the state of the environment, which should contain project, estimates, technical documentation with a list of tasks, actions and activities aimed at creating or improving an infrastructure facility with justification of the environmental effect; (b) support of ecological and natural well-being, development of the potential for environmental protection in the territory adjacent to the Kumtor mine and throughout the Kyrgyz Republic, promoting the efficient use of the natural resources at the national level; (c) organization of charitable and humanitarian activities, the provision of grants for purposes that meet the statutory goals of the Fund, as well as funding for research, support and educational activities; (d) work on the restoration of natural objects disturbed by the economic activity, the holding of contests, seminars, conferences and round tables on the issues of environmental protection and ensuring environmental safety; (e) interaction and cooperation with local communities, public organizations, charitable foundations, international, commercial and private organizations, as well as government bodies and local government of the Kyrgyz Republic and other foreign countries to achieve the statutory goals of the Foundation; and (f) implementation of other activities aimed at achieving the statutory goals that do not contradict the legislation of the Kyrgyz Republic.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Law No. 13.576 providing for the National Policy on Biofuels (RenovaBio).
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 30 articles divided into seven Chapters creates the National Policy on Biofuels (RenovaBio), as an integral part of the National energy policy dealt with in art. 1 of Law No. 9.478, of 6 August 1997. The Policy has the following objectives: I - contribute to meeting the country's commitments under the Paris Agreement under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change; II - contribute to the adequate relation of energy efficiency and reduction of emissions of greenhouse gases in the production, commercialization and use of biofuels, including mechanisms of evaluation of life cycle; III - to promote the adequate expansion of the production and use of biofuels in the national energy matrix, with emphasis on the regular supply of fuels; and IV - contribute with predictability to the competitive participation of the various biofuels in the national fuel market.

Policy: Resolution No.2 of 2017 regulating the connection of electricity production units from renewable energy to the electricity distribution system at the Electricity and Water Authority.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 19 articles aims at (i) establishing a clear legislative framework that regulates the linking of renewable energy production units to the electricity distribution system; (ii) encouraging community members and institutions to produce electricity from renewable energy sources; (iii) contributing to the diversification of energy sources by increasing the share of renewable energy within the sources of energy production; (iv) compliance with the national policies and objectives related to renewable energy; (v) contributing to the protection of the environment by reducing the carbon footprint in the Kingdom; (vi) promoting the growth of the green economy for sustainable development; (vii) ensuring the right of every consumer to install renewable energy production equipment and connect it to the electricity distribution system. The Resolution mainly regulates the relationship between the three main subjects, which are (i) Electricity and Water Authority (EWA); (ii) the Unit of electricity production from renewable energy; and (iii) the producer, that is any person who produces electricity from renewable sources for personal use and connects it to the electricity distribution system in accordance with the conditions provided by this resolution.

Policy: Ley Nº 30709 - Ley que prohíbe la discriminación remunerativa entre varones y mujeres.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley tiene por objeto prohibir la discriminación remunerativa entre varones y mujeres, mediante la determinación de categorías, funciones y remuneraciones que permitan la ejecución del principio de igual remuneración por igual trabajo. La presente Ley está en concordancia con el mandato constitucional de igualdad de oportunidades sin discriminación en las relaciones laborales, así como del lineamiento de idéntico ingreso por trabajo de igual valor indicado en la Ley Nº 28983, Ley de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres. Los empleadores están obligados a informar a sus trabajadores la política salarial del centro de trabajo. Se considera práctica discriminatoria brindar un trato salarial distinto a hombres y mujeres que cumplan los mismos requisitos de acceso al empleo y desempeñen las mismas labores.

Policy: Order No. A/368 of the Minister of Nature, Environment and Tourism validating the Methodology of determination of norms for ordinary waste formation.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Methodology shall be to plan urban waste management, to finance the waste management, budgeting, waste dumping fees, site cleaning, service, and the use of equipment and landfill capacity for waste disposal. It establishes the guidelines related to the rates of waste formation for individual entrepreneurs and business entities engaged in waste management. The main indicators of the rates of waste formation shall be the amount of waste, weight, average density, and the different daily and seasonal variations of waste. Waste norms can be set up every three years and, if applicable, beforehand. The rates of waste disposal by business entities and individual entrepreneurs shall be determined by this Methodology, certified by regional authority and local government, and registered in the waste dump database.

Policy: Resolución Nº 037-2017-OEFA ─ Plan Anual de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental (PLANEFA) - 2018 del Organismo de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental (OEFA).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Plan Anual de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental (PLANEFA) del Organismo de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental (OEFA), correspondiente al año 2018, que comporta la aprobación de los instrumentos legales necesarios para el efectivo ejercicio de la función de fiscalización ambiental, y comprende también el Plan Anual de Evaluación Ambiental y el Plan Anual de Supervisión Ambiental. El primero, está orientado a ejecutar acciones de evaluación ambiental en las áreas de influencia de las actividades fiscalizables de competencia del OEFA, en aras de otorgar un soporte efectivo a la función supervisora; mientras que el segundo, se desarrollará de manera estratégica e integral en base a criterios de priorización que comprenden las áreas geográficas en las que exista una problemática ambiental, la identificación de vulnerabilidades en el proceso productivo y la afectación de componentes ambientales, entre otros, correspondientes a los sectores supervisados por el OEFA. De manera complementaria al ejercicio de la función de supervisión, se promoverá la fiscalización ambiental a cargo de las demás EFA competentes para supervisar las actividades que se desarrollan en el referido ámbito geográfico, esperando lograr con ello un mejor diagnóstico de los agentes contaminadores y una adecuada respuesta para la solución de los problemas ambientales.

Policy: Decree No. 56.962 approving the Regulation of the Managing Council of the Innovation Institute for Sustainable Rural Development (CGEMATER).
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation of the Managing Council of the Innovation Institute for Sustainable Rural Development (CGEMATER). It aims to propose guidelines for the formulation and implementation of public policies, constituting a space of articulation between the different levels of government and civil society organizations, for the development of Policies of Research, Technical Assistance and Rural Extension. The Regulation, consisting of 19 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes the composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Council, entitled to perform the following activities: approve the proposals of plans, programmes, projects and budgets of EMATER, to be forwarded to the State Government; establish guidelines and approve EMATER's strategic planning; set guidelines for the preparation of short, medium and long-term planning of the entity; approve proposal of institution and/or change of plans; approve any activity or action that implies an increase of the Institute's expenses; oversee the execution of plans, programmes and projects; comment on the reports and accounts of EMATER; approve the Internal Regulations and other operating norms of the Managing Council; approve proposals for contracting loans and other operations; approve proposals for Acquisition and Disposal of Real Estate; approve and approve the modifications in this Regulation and to submit them to the State Governor; approve EMATER's Internal Regulations and its modifications; propose strategies for monitoring and evaluation, as well as participation in the process of guidelines and procedures of the Policies of Research, Technical Assistance and Rural Extension, as well as suggest and analyze the related State Government action plans.

Policy: Regional Governor’s Decree No. 1010 validating the Regulation on state nature complex reserve “Big Utrish”.
Policy_Content: State nature complex reserve “Big Utrish” shall be classified as complex (landscape) with the purpose of conservation and restoration of natural ecosystems (natural landscapes), components thereof and maintenance of ecological balance, formed for unlimited period of time, without expropriation of land plots from tenants, owners and managers of land, with the status of protected area of regional significance. The scope of creating the reserve is conservation, reproduction and restoration of communities of relict endemic species of wild flora and fauna, relict and picturesque landscapes (landslide landscape of the Bolshoi Utrish tract, relict coastal lakes), maintaining the overall ecological balance and regulated recreational use of natural resources. To achieve this goal, the following tasks are solved: (a) conservation of biological and landscape diversity of unique Mediterranean natural complexes of the Black Sea coast of Krasnodar Territory; (b) conservation, reproduction and restoration of representatives of wild fauna species and their habitat; (c) conservation of reference areas of Mediterranean vegetation, protection, reproduction and restoration of certain plant species due to their unique natural significance; (d) maintaining ecological balance; and (e)  environmental education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of reserve: (a) all types of hunting and destruction or damage of reproductive and protective areas (nests, hollows, burrows and other habitats and shelters) of wild fauna species throughout the year; (b) stay on the territory with firearms, hunting gear and unleashed hunting dogs; (c) use of endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (d) collection of zoological, botanical, mineralogical collections and paleontological objects without the consent of the authorized body; (e) clear cutting; (f) thinning of the undergrowth providing soil protection functions; (g) implementation of aviation pest and disease control measures; (h) introduction of alien species; (i) haymaking, passage and grazing of livestock; (j) construction of roads, pipelines and communication lines; (k) movement and parking of motor vehicles, not related to the functioning of the reserve, off public roads, except for vehicles of employees of authorized bodies, driving livestock off highways; (l) carrying out recreational activities (including the organization of recreation sites and making fires) outside specially designated places; (m) destruction or damage of barriers, notices, stands and other information signs, as well as equipped ecological paths and recreation sites; (n) establishment of solid barriers and structures that do not have special passages on the routes of mass migration of animals; (o) exploration and mining; (p) dredging, blasting, drilling and other work related to changing the bottom and banks of waterbodies; (q) pollution of surface and ground waters by untreated sewage and other substances; (r) creation of facilities for placement, storage of industrial and domestic waste, radioactive, chemical, explosive, toxic and poisonous substances, discharge of untreated wastewater; and (s) allotment of land plots for gardening and peri-urban agriculture.

Policy: Regional Governor’s Decree No. 1011 validating the Regulation on state nature zoological reserve “Psebaysky”.
Policy_Content: State nature zoological reserve “Psebaysky” has a biological (zoological) profile and is intended for the preservation, restoration, reproduction of economically, scientifically and aesthetically valuable wild fauna species, in particular ungulated and fur-bearing wild fauna species, classified as game, as well as rare and endangered wild fauna species included in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the Red Book of the Krasnodar Territory, and the preservation of their habitat. The reserve is formed for an unlimited period of time and without expropriation of land plots from tenants, owners and managers of land plots. The objectives of the reserve are the conservation, restoration, reproduction of valuable wild fauna species, in particular ungulated and fur-bearing wild fauna species classified as game, as well as rare and endangered wild fauna species. The following tasks are set for the reserve: (a) conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species and wild flora species; (b) preservation of the habitat of wild fauna species as a necessary condition for their existence and reproduction; and (c) maintaining the necessary ecological balance and stability of the functioning of ecosystems. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the reserve: (a) all types of hunting except for scientific research, educational and regulation of the number of wild fauna species purposes; (b) stay with firearms, hunting gear and unleashed dogs; (c) the use of poisoned baits; (d) hunting (capture) of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (e) destruction or damage of nests, hollows, burrows and other dwellings, shelters and stable breeding grounds for wild animals, collection of eggs, except for cases of regulation of the number of objects of the animal world in accordance with the established procedure; (f) clear cutting; (g) timber extraction, except for individual personal needs of natural persons; (h) procurement of non-timber alimentary and non-alimentary resources, medicinal plants except for personal needs of natural persons; (i) burning of vegetation; (j) introduction of alien species; (k) aviation pest and disease control measures; (l) placements, storage and burial of domestic and non-domestic waste, including hazardous waste; (m) plowing land; and (n) destruction or damage of barriers, notices, stands and other information signs.

Policy: Nitrate Action Program Regulation NAPV
Policy_Content: The Austrian regulation on Nitrate Action (NAPV) is an implementation of EU Council Directive 91/676/EEC concerning the protection of waters against pollution caused by nitrates from agricultural sources. It regulates restrictions and limitations of the usage of fertilizer and nitrate emissions. The regulation stipulates limitations throughout the year in which nitrogenous fertilizers may not be used on agricultural land. It regulates requirements on the use of fertilizers on agricultural land located on a steep incline, as well as use on water-saturated, flooded, frozen or snow-covered soils. Further specified are the application of nitrogenous fertilizers on agricultural areas near water courses. In addition to restrictions and limitations on the usage of fertilizer are stipulations on the construction and capacity of manure-storage containers processed for agricultural usage. The annexes reflect technical and quantitative restrictions and regulations. Specifically, annex 1 regards manure production quantities for 6 months per barn space in cubic meters with different manure removal systems. Annex 2 regulates ammonium content of manure, other organic fertilizers or sewage sludge. Annex 3 is on the limitation of the quantity of nitrogen that is effective on the agricultural areas and effective for the year. Annex 4 regards Nitrogen generation after deduction of stall and storage losses and annex 5 specifies areas with intensified actions according to Article 5 Paragraph 5 of Council Directive 91/676 / EEC for the protection of waters against pollution by nitrates from agricultural sources.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 042-2017-EM ─ Reglamento de Protección Ambiental para las Actividades de Exploración Minera.
Policy_Content: El presente Reglamento tiene por objeto normar los aspectos ambientales de las actividades de exploración minera de conformidad con el ordenamiento normativo ambiental vigente. El Reglamento tiene como finalidad asegurar el cumplimiento de la legislación ambiental sobre prevención, minimización, mitigación, rehabilitación, remediación y, de corresponder, compensación de los impactos ambientales negativos derivados de las actividades de exploración minera, así como de las actividades de cierre y post cierre que correspondan. El presente reglamento no es de aplicación a las actividades de la pequeña minería y minería artesanal, las cuales se rigen por la normativa específica, salvo en los aspectos que no se encuentren contemplados en dicha regulación; en dichos casos, la presente norma se aplicará de manera supletoria.

Policy_Content: Article 7 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Article 7. Management, use and disposal of state land by trust. Policy: Regulation (2017: 1337) for grants for greener cities.
Policy_Content: This Regulation provides for state incentives to be granted, if funds are available, by the National Board of Housing, Building and Planning for measures promoting urban greenery and ecosystem services in urban environments. For the purposes of this Regulation, urban greenery means: 1. nature land, parks, avenues, trees, shrubs, hedges, plantations, green roofs and walls, surfaces for children's play and outdoor living, eco-decorations, green corridors, green infrastructure and similar green areas in urban environments; and 2. beaches, wetlands, watercourses, ditches, stormwater facilities and similar water surfaces in urban environments. Measures may also aim at improving urban resistance to high temperatures or flooding. The Regulation sets out criteria and procedures for the granting of incentives and provides for control.

Policy: Resolution No.16 of 2017 on the Accreditation System for Environmental Laboratories in the State of Kuwait.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 16 articles applies to all environmental laboratories belonging to public authorities, public and private research bodies, educational institutes, NGOs, and independent laboratories. It states that environmental laboratories applying for accreditation, or for its renewal, must obtain ISO/IEC 17025 (General requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories). The competent authority (he Center for Analytical Laboratories at the Environmental Public Authority), after examining the accreditation requests, replies within 30 days from the application. The accreditation certificate issued by the EPA is valid for 3 years, and is renewable if the conditions set out in this Resolution are met. The EPA concerned department can visit the accrediting institution to verify the validity of the certificates and documents. Article 15 lists the cases in which a laboratory's accreditation certificate can be canceled.

Policy: European Union (Good Agricultural Practice for Protection of Waters) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 605 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations give effect to Ireland's 4th Nitrates Action Programme, and provide statutory support for good agricultural practice to protect waters against pollution from agricultural sources and include measures such as periods when land application of fertilisers is prohibited, limits on the land application of fertilisers, storage requirements for livestock manure, and monitoring of the effectiveness of the measures in terms of agricultural practice and impact on water quality. The set of measures in these regulations provides a basic level of protection against possible adverse impacts to waters arising from the agricultural expansion targets set under a programme called Food Harvest 2020. The Regulations give further effect to several EU Directives including Directives in relation to the protection of waters against pollution from agricultural sources (Nitrates Directive), dangerous substances in water, waste management, protection of groundwater, public participation in policy development and water policy (the Water Framework Directive).

Policy: Decree No. 1004 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On measures for planting and restoration of protection forests and greenery and land improvement around waterworks.
Policy_Content: The Government, in order to plant and restore protection forests and greenery and land improvement around waterworks with a view to combat wind erosion of irrigated lands and sand deposition on waterworks, improvement of territories along the constructed and reconstructed water management facilities within the framework of investment projects involving foreign investments, as well as increasing the efficiency of land and water resources uses, decrees to approve Plan of practical measures for planting and restoration of protection forests and greenery and land improvement around waterworks in accordance with the annex. Policy: Law No. 17.354 creating the Environmental Institute of the State of Santa Catarina (IMA), and repealing the Environmental Foundation (FATMA).
Policy_Content: This Law creates the Environmental Institute of the State of Santa Catarina (IMA), and repeals the Environmental Foundation (FATMA). It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Environmental Institute, as an agency linked to the State Secretariat for Sustainable Economic Development (SDS), entitled to perform the following activities: implement and coordinate the environmental control system, including the environmental licensing of environmental impact assessment and permanent preservation areas uses; prepare instructions related to licensing and environmental authorization activities, with a view to standardizing administrative and technical procedures; licensing, authorizing and auditing public or private activities potentially causing environmental degradation; supervise and monitor compliance with the conditions established in the environmental licensing procedure; develop, execute and control actions, projects, programmes and research related to the protection of ecosystems and the sustainable use of inter-regional or state natural resources; develop programmes on transport of dangerous waste; supervise and guide forestry activities; elaborate international agreements related to ecosystem protection; implement the State System of Conservation Units of Nature (SEUC); and carry out environmental inspection.

Policy: Land Title Registration Amendment Act 2017 (No. 47 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Land Title Registration Act 2011 in various provisions and by inserting various new provisions, which, among other things:  Require an application for registration to be formally made by an attorney; require a judgment register to include an individual register for each judgment that affects land and is registered in accordance with Schedule 10 and define the contents of an individual register; require that a Notice of application for first registration shall be published in Gazette, and the filing of Rules made under the principal Act. Policy: Arrêté relatif au plan d'action cantonal en cas de concentrations excessives d'ozone (AOZONE)
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe les dispositions à prendre par les autorités cantonales en cas de concentrations excessives d'ozone dans l'air. Le Conseil d'Etat définit les seuils d'information et d'intervention en fonction des concentrations moyennes horaires d'ozone dans l'air. Le département en charge de l'environnement identifie des stations de mesure des polluants atmosphériques de référence, situées dans des lieux représentatifs de la qualité de l'air dans le canton. Les stations de référence sont identifiées sur la base d'une coordination régionale. Les seuils seront déclarés atteints lorsque les valeurs fixées ci-dessus sont atteintes aux stations de référence et que les prévisions météorologiques ne laissent pas entrevoir une amélioration de la situation dans les trois jours suivants.

Policy: Agro-Veterinary Shop Permit Guidelines - Guidance on Procedures for Applying for Permit and Operating an Agro-Veterinary Shop, 2017
Policy_Content: These Guidelines provide guidance to a person intending to operate an agro-veterinary shop. A person who intends to operate an agro-veterinary shop shall apply to the Authority for a permit as provided under Statutory Instrument (No. 10) of 2016. A completed application shall be submitted to the nearest Office of the Zambia Medicines Regulatory Authority or its authorised agent. The Guidelines further provide for personnel requirements for an agro-veterinary shop; supply of prescription only veterinary medicines; hygiene within the premises; record keeping facilities; storage of medicines; disposal of waste; and recall of medicines. The Guidelines specify that the prescription only veterinary medicine shall be sold or supplied upon receipt of a prescription issued by an authorized prescriber.

Policy: Water Act 2017.
Policy_Content: The Water Act is organised in 11 Parts and 84 Articles. Part I concerns interpretation, purpose, and application. The purpose of this Act is to support and promote the management, protection and enhancement of the water resources within the jurisdiction of the province. The Government has guardianship role to play in ensuring that the quality, quantity, allocation, conservation and protection of water is managed in the interests of a common good that benefits and accommodates all living things in the province and their supporting ecosystems. The Act also recognises that access for everyone to a sufficient quantity and safe quality of reasonably affordable and accessible water for personal and domestic uses, and to basic sanitation that is safe and hygienic, is essential for an adequate standard of living and that every person in the province has a duty to prevent, minimize and repair harm that the person may cause to water resources or the ecosystems supported by water resources (Art. 2).

Policy: Decree No. 9.244 creating the National Strategy for Investments and Socio-economic Impact and the Impact Investment and Business Committee.
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the National Strategy for Investments and Socio-economic Impact and the Impact Investment and Business Committee. It creates the National Impact Investment and Business Strategy, with the purpose of articulating federal public administration, private sector and civil society bodies and entities, in the promotion of an environment conducive to the development of investments and impact businesses. The National Strategy for Investment and Impact Business has the following objectives: I - mobilization of public and private resources destined to the investment and financing of development activities; II - increase the dissemination of the culture of socio-environmental impact assessment and the support to the involvement of these enterprises; III - strengthening intermediary organizations offering support to the development of businesses that impact and empower entrepreneurs, generate new knowledge on the subject or promote the involvement of impact businesses with investors, donors and other organizations that own capital ; IV - promotion of institutional and normative environment favorable to investments and impact businesses, through the proposition of normative acts referring to the subject; and V - strengthening data generation that gives more visibility to investments and impact businesses.

Policy: Law No. 10.757 creating the State Programme on More Production and Supply.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the State Programme on More Production and Supply. The programme is linked to the actions of the State System of Production and Supply (SEPAB), and has as its main objective the increase and optimization of agricultural production in the State, adding value to local products and generating wealth, employment and income. The activities developed in the Programme are coordinated by the State Secretariat for Agriculture, Livestock and Fisheries (SAGRIMA), which will accompany the implementation of the set of integrated actions in agriculture, livestock, fisheries, aquaculture and supply throughout the country. The Programme prioritizes the following objectives: promote agricultural activities, agricultural production, fishing, aquaculture and beekeeping, through the organization of production centers in local communities; generate work and income; develop techniques of agroecological or organic agriculture, as well as provide technical advice necessary for the organization, production and marketing of food to its beneficiaries; support cooperatives and partnerships; and improve the quality of life of the rural population. These objectives will be reached through the following actions: agricultural planning; agricultural and technological research; technical assistance, rural extension and managerial training; protection of the environment, conservation and recovery of natural resources; defense of agriculture; production, marketing, supply and storage; cooperatives and partnerships; vocational training and rural education; public and private investments; rural credit and tax incentives; irrigation and drainage; rural electrification; and agricultural mechanization.

Policy: Law No. 3.352 creating the Itinerant State Health Programme.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 11 articles, establishes the Itinerant State Health Programme within the State of Acre, being regulated by the State Health Secretariat (SESACRE), with the cooperation of the Municipalities and Union. This Programme is intended to function through health actions developed to the general population from a perspective of holistic and multidisciplinary attention performing actions of prevention, promotion, treatment and recovery of health. The Itinerant State Health Programme consists in offering specialized medical care and health actions to rural populations living in remote areas of the State, as well as in all municipalities, isolated communities that are difficult to reach and places with insufficient assistance, called "care gaps".

Policy: Regulation on good practice requirements in the field of forest management.
Policy_Content: This Regulation of the Minister of Environment, which is composed of two paragraphs, lays down good practice requirements in the field of forest management. These requirements are specified in par. 1 and include in particular: (1) a field vision must be carried out to check the occurrence of protected species before starting work in the field of forest management; (2) the stands where protected species occur are temporarily marked before the works; (3) at watersides of water reservoirs and watercourses, at a distance of 10 meters from the shoreline, fallen trees, understory and large stones must be left to facilitate access to water and animal migration; (4) no trees on which nested nests have been identified may be cut during the breeding season of birds; (5) hollow trees are left for their natural disintegration; (6) dead trees are left in order to ensure the continuity of dead wood, however, its amount may not create a fire hazard or the risk of harmful biotic factors.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Government Decree No. 1088 validating the Regulation on the Agency for Technical Supervision.
Policy_Content: This Government Decree establishes that Agency for Technical Supervision shall be an administrative body subordinated to the Ministry of Economy and Infrastructure responsible for implementation of state policy in the areas pertaining to its competence. The Agency's mission is to ensure the implementation of state policy in the spheres of its competence in the order and in the limits established by the regulatory framework. The Agency shall perform the functions established by this Provision in the following areas: (a) safety of hazardous production facilities; (b) construction and urban development; (c) market supervision in the field of building materials and hazardous production equipment/facilities; (d) fire safety and civil protection; (e) safety of work; (f) geodesy and cartography; (g) protection of consumer rights in the field of industrial safety and construction; and (h) compliance with licensing conditions in the relevant field. In the sphere of geodesy and cartography the Agency participates and provides methodological and technical support in the establishment, mapping and demarcation of the state border of the Republic of Moldova, the change of geographical names of objects, as well as the boundaries of administrative-territorial units, ensures in accordance with the established modalities their complete and correct graphic representation on maps.

Para la madera de bosque de pino pagarán el 7% del precio de compra por metro cúbico de madera en rollo puesta en yarda en el aserradero; para la madera de bosque latifoliado pagarán el 4% del precio de compra por pie tablar de madera aserrada puesta en el plantel del comprador. Se autoriza al Departamento de Manejo y Desarrollo Forestal para que en el mes de noviembre de cada año actualice el precio de tronconaje o canon que deben pagar al ICF.

El propósito del PNC es definir, encauzar y coordinar las responsabilidades para la respuesta operativa ante emergencias marítimas que pudieran tener como resultado derrames de hidrocarburos en el medio marino y potencialmente causar un daño a Costa Rica, a sus habitantes, a sus aguas territoriales, a sus costas y a la vida marina. Los procedimientos del PNC, pretenden establecer y asegurar la cooperación local, nacional y regional en relación con el planeamiento. prevención, control y limpieza en caso de emergencias de este tipo. El PNC integra y respalda los planes locales que las instalaciones portuarias nacionales deberán elaborar.

Policy: Carbon Competitiveness Incentive Regulation (Alta Reg 255/2017).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation, consisting of 41 sections divided into five Parts and completed by two Schedules, provides for the enactment of the Climate Change and Emissions Management Act. Part 2 establishes the output-based allocation for a facility; duty to not exceed output-based allocation; determination of net emissions Assigned Benchmarks; etc. Part 3 specifies the Emission Offsets, Emission Performance Credits and Fund Credits (including: Emission performance credits; Fund credits; Use of emission offsets; No right to emission offsets). This Regulation applies to the following facilities: a) facility that has total regulated emissions of 100,000 tonnes or more in 2003 or a subsequent year; b) an opted-in facility. Notwithstanding subsection (1)(a), if a facility other than an opted-in facility first has total regulated emissions of 100,000 tonnes or more in 2018 or a subsequent year, this Regulation does not begin to apply to the facility until the year after the year in which the facility first has total regulated emissions of 100,000 tonnes or more. Schedule 1 lists Specified Gases and Schedule 2 specifies Established Benchmarks for Products.

El objetivo del Protocolo es establecer un conjunto de reglas, requisitos y procedimientos para garantizar estrategias de abordaje social, habitacional y urbano en los proyectos de relocalización y reurbanización de villas y asentamientos en la Cuenca Matanza Riachuelo(CMR) a fin de contribuir a solucionar la situación de precariedad habitacional de la población afectada, mejorar su calidad de vida y asegurar la efectividad de sus derechos sociales, culturales y económicos. Los principios rectores de los procesos de relocalización y reurbanización contemplan la intervención territorial en función de criterios de riesgo ambiental y la sustentabilidad económica de la vivienda. El derecho a una vivienda adecuada, reconocido por el Protocolo, incluye la disponibilidad de servicios indispensables para la salud y la nutrición, el acceso permanente al agua potable y a servicios de cloaca y pluviales.

El trigésimo noveno Plan de Seguros Agrarios Combinados se establece al amparo de lo previsto en la Ley de Seguros Agrarios Combinados, y contempla las líneas de seguros agrarios cuyo periodo de suscripción se inicia a lo largo del año 2018, así como los porcentajes de subvenciones aplicables a cada una de ellas. Las líneas de actuación que integran el presente Plan de Seguros Agrarios estarán orientadas al logro de los siguientes objetivos: 1) Establecer los criterios de asignación de subvenciones, adecuándolos a la disponibilidad presupuestaria, optimizando los recursos y facilitando su aplicación, gestión y control; 2) Avanzar en el desarrollo del sistema de seguros agrarios para proporcionar a los productores agrarios una herramienta de gestión de riesgos a un coste asequible; 3) Fomentar el diseño de líneas de seguro renovables para mejorar la implantación del seguro y su universalización.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 810 “On the issues of allotment of land plots for subsoil management”.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree establishes that land plots shall be allotted for provisional tenancy covering the period of subsoil management for the following purposes: (a) geological exploration of subsoil; and (b) mining and construction of the infrastructure for subsoil management. Land plots for subsoil management shall be allotted by the authorized body in accordance with the territorial affiliation: (a) land plots administered by the local state administration are allotted by the state executive authority (local state administration); (b) land plots under the jurisdiction of local government, including pastures, are allotted by the executive body of local government; and (c) land plots of the state forest fund are allotted by the territorial state forestry management body. Land plots that are privately owned or in temporary tenancy are allotted by the land owner or land tenants under a contract with a subsoil manager. Geological exploration shall be performed without expropriation of land plot and without legalization of the right of use documentation, but by written consent of the authorized state body and, in case of privately owned land plot, by notarized written consent of the owner or land tenant. Land plots destined for mining and construction of the infrastructure for subsoil management, except for particularly valuable plots of agricultural land and protected areas, shall be allotted without transfer thereof to other land categories.
Subject: Land & soil, Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Asia, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree No. 962 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Doctrine of national food security of the Republic of Belarus until 2030.
Policy_Content: This cross-sectoral nationwide Doctrine of national food security of the Republic of Belarus until 2030 has as its scope the implementation of the State policy on national food security aimed at improving provision of the population with quality food and its availability for adequate nutrition and a healthy lifestyle through the development of competitive agricultural production and the creation of socio-economic conditions for the consumption of foodstuffs at a rational level. At present, the population of Belarus has achieved quantitative consumption norms for almost all foodstuffs, but the diet remains unbalanced in terms of quality. A transition to a new level of development to a safe and quality diet for all social groups is necessary, and the formation of the prerequisites for it in the form of criteria and standards for food supply is an integral part of this Doctrine. Food security is an essential component of national security and a necessary condition for the implementation of the strategic national priority - ensuring high living standards of the population and conditions for the harmonious development of the individual. The level of development of national (domestic) production of agricultural commodities, raw materials and foodstuffs in the Republic of Belarus reached in 2013-2015 allows guaranteeing physical accessibility of foodstuffs for the population in the energy assessment of 3400 kilocalories per person per day. The achieved volumes of agrarian production not only correspond to the optimistic level of food security, but also allow increasing the export of agricultural commodities and foodstuffs, ensuring the flow of foreign currency. At the same time, the results of the annual monitoring of food security testify to the fact that a number of problems persist in the country, primarily in the economic and social spheres. Thus, the current level of labor productivity in agriculture does not allow providing sufficient parameters of its efficiency and competitiveness in the domestic and foreign markets. Insufficient purchasing power of the population and economic affordability of products remain a deterrent to the improvement of the diet of the population. The lack of growth in the real income of the population makes it impossible to maintain a balanced diet. Households with children remain the most vulnerable to risks to food security. Significant differences in the diet of the urban and rural population remain. The reason for this is the insufficient level of rural population's income and efficiency of food supply to the territories. There is a dependence of caloric content of nutrition on the level of income of the population. In this regard, improving the quality of nutrition of the population and increasing the consumption of ecological and organic products in the country are primarily associated with ensuring its economic accessibility for all categories of the population.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Manual de Operaciones del Programa Nacional de Apoyo Directo a los Más Pobres - JUNTOS. El Programa Nacional de Apoyo Directo a los Más Pobres - JUNTOS, adscrito al Ministerio de Desarrollo e Inclusión Social (MIDIS), tiene por finalidad que las gestantes, niñas, niños, adolescentes y jóvenes hasta los 19 años de edad accedan informados a los servicios de salud y educación, por lo que orienta su accionar a romper la transferencia intergeneracional de la pobreza, mediante incentivos económicos, previo cumplimiento de sus corresponsabilidades. En el ámbito de acción del Programa se han restituido los derechos básicos de los hogares, cuyos miembros acceden con pleno ejercicio de su ciudadanía de manera regular a servicios básicos de calidad en salud-nutrición y educación, y se ha mejorado la calidad de vida y el desarrollo de capital humano reduciendo con ello la transferencia intergeneracional de la pobreza.

Se crean el Fondo Estatal de Fomento Minero y el Consejo Técnico de Minería de Durango.

Policy: Order No. 661 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on forest use for hunting and the List of cases of forest use for hunting purposes without allotment of forest plots.
Policy_Content: This Regulation governs relations originating in the process of the use of forests for hunting purposes. It shall be applicable to legal persons, individual entrepreneurs using forests for hunting purposes in accordance with hunting contracts with or without allotment of forest plots. Use of forests for hunting without allotment of forest plots shall be authorized if the aforesaid activity does not imply forest felling or creation of hunting infrastructure. The period of validity of forest lease contract related to forest plots pertaining to state or municipal property shall not exceed the period of validity of the respective hunting management contract. On forest plots allotted for hunting management can be authorized creation of provisional constructions or fencing. Persons who use forests with allotment of forest plots for hunting purpose shall have the following rights: (a)  use the forest plot for its intended purpose in accordance with the Forest Code, other normative legal acts of the Russian Federation, forestry regulations, forest development project and forest lease agreement; (b) pay rent for the use of the forest plot as envisaged by the forest plot lease contract; (c) draft a forest development project in accordance with Part 1 of Article 88 of the Forest Code; (d) submit annually a forest declaration in accordance with Part 2 of Article 26 of the Forest Code; (e) submit information provided for in article 49, paragraph 1, article 60, part 1 of article 60.11, and clause 1 of article 66 of the Forest Code; (f) implement the forest fire prevention measures provided for in paragraph 2 of Article 53 of the Forest Code in the forest area provided for the implementation of activities in the field of hunting; (g) implement the measures provided for in Article 60.7 of the Forest Code for the prevention of the spread of harmful organisms; (h) bring the forest plot allotted for hunting management to the initial state suitable for use for the intended purpose in the event of damage or destruction by the person using the forests for hunting purposes, the upper fertile layer soils, artificial or natural watercourses, rivers, streams; (i) upon the termination of the lease of a forest plot, to transfer the forest plot to the lessor in the condition stipulated by the lease agreement of the forest plot; and (k) perform other duties provided for in forest legislation, legislation in the field of hunting and conservation of hunting resources, a hunting and forestry agreement and a forest plot lease contract. Annex 2 contains the List of cases of forest use for hunting purposes without allotment of forest plots.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Law No. 206 (11) “On conflict of interest.”
Policy_Content: This Law defines the organizational and legal framework for management of conflicts of interest in the activities of persons holding state, municipal and other positions envisaged by this Law, and is aimed at ensuring their activities in public interests excluding personal (private) interest while in execution of their official duties. Conflict of interest management is based on the following principles: (a) priority of public interests; (b) ensuring transparency and control; and (c) personal responsibility and personal example. This Law applies to activities of: (a) persons holding state and municipal positions, contained in the Register of state and municipal positions of the Kyrgyz Republic; (b) heads of institutions, organizations or enterprises, which activities are financed from the state or local budget or in the authorized capital of which there is a state share, as well as trustees of state property; and (c) persons who do not have the status of state or municipal employee, but at the same time carrying out working activities in government agencies. The aforesaid persons, while in execution of their official duties, shall be prohibited to exercise the functions of supervision, control, conclude contracts in which they and family members have a personal (private) interest. Potential conflicts of interest are resolved by identifying and eliminating the possibility of using by public officials of their official position in their personal (private) interests.

Policy: Ionizing radiation protection and nuclear safety Act.
Policy_Content: This Act regulates protection against ionizing radiation in order to minimize damage to human health due to exposure to ionizing radiation and radioactive contamination of the living environment, and at the same time to enable the development, production and use of radiation sources and radiation activities. For a radiation source intended for the production of nuclear energy, this Act regulates the implementation of nuclear and radiation safety measures in case of use of nuclear goods, as well as special protection measures. This Act determines the competences of the body responsible for nuclear safety, the body responsible for radiation protection, the ministry responsible for the interior and the inspectorate responsible for the interior for the implementation of provisions and supervision under this Act, including the powers of inspectors for inspection control over the implementation of such rules. Council Directive 2013/59/Euratom laying down basic safety standards for protection against the dangers arising from exposure to ionising radiation, and its repealing Directives (as listed in article 3) are here transposed. The provisions of this Act relating to the content of radioactive substances shall not apply to foodstuffs and their components, the content of which is determined by regulations on the health suitability of foodstuffs. Chapter 15 sets out related criminal provisions.

Policy_Content: El presente Real Decreto tiene por objeto: 1) Establecer disposiciones específicas para controlar las emisiones a la atmósfera de dióxido de azufre (SO2), óxidos de nitrógeno (NOx), monóxido de carbono (CO) y partículas procedentes de las instalaciones de combustión medianas y, así, reducir las emisiones atmosféricas y los riesgos potenciales de esas emisiones para la salud humana y el medio ambiente; 2) Actualizar la parte del Catálogo de actividades potencialmente contaminadoras de la atmósfera (CAPCA) relacionada con instalaciones de combustión con códigos de actividad 01, 02 y 0301 contenida en el anexo IV de la Ley de calidad del aire y protección de la atmósfera.

Policy: Medium-term National Development Policy Framework, Agenda for Jobs: Creating Prosperity and Equal Opportunity for All 2018 - 2021.
Policy_Content: This Medium-term National Development Policy Framework is a multi-sectoral document aiming at putting into practice the Vision, policies and programs outlined to guide the overall economic and social development of the country, and follows the implementation of the Ghana Shared Growth and Development Agenda (GSGDA II), which was implemented over the period 2014-2017. The government’s medium-term Vision goal is to create an optimistic, self-confident and prosperous nation, through the creative exploitation of our human and natural resources, and operating within a democratic, open and fair society in which mutual trust and economic opportunities exist for all. The four broad goals for the period are (1) create opportunities for all Ghanaians; (2) safeguard the natural environment and ensure a resilient built environment; (3) maintain a stable, united and safe society; and (4) build a prosperous society. Key interventions regard the following areas (i) restoring the economy; (ii) transforming agriculture and industry; (iii) strengthening social protection and inclusion; (iv) revamping economic and social infrastructure; and (v) reforming public service delivery institutions.

Policy: Sustainable Development Goals - Status and Roadmap: 2016-2030.
Policy_Content: The Sustainable Development Goals envisions building a just and prosperous Nepal by 2030. The year 2030 coincides with the end date of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). While all the 17 SDGs and 169 targets are legitimate development objectives seen through a global lens, a resource-strapped country like Nepal needs to prioritize, localize and motivate a bottom-up path towards greater progress. Policy: Bangladesh Country Investment Plan for Environment, Forestry and Climate Change (EFCC CIP) 2016-2021.
Policy_Content: This Bangladesh Country Investment Plan for Environment, Forestry and Climate Change (EFCC CIP) 2016-2021 is a whole-of-government initiative led by the Ministry of Environment and Forests (MoEF). It reflects the priorities of the Government of Bangladesh and a wide range of stakeholders active in the EFCC sectors.  The overall goal of the EFCC CIP is to increase the contribution of the EFCC sectors to national sustainable development through the enhanced provision of ecosystem services, thereby helping to reduce poverty, improve environmental and human health benefits, and increase resilience to climate change. Four investment pillars were identified for achieving the goal of the EFCC CIP: 1 Sustainable development and management of natural resources; 2 Environmental pollution reduction and control; 3 Adaptation and resilience to, and mitigation of, climate change; 4 Environmental governance, gender, and human and institutional capacity development.

Policy: National Nutrition Care, Support, and Treatment (NCST) Operational Plan 2018-2022.
Policy_Content: This National NCST Operational Plan is a 5-year nationwide sectoral document aiming at outlining an overarching implementation framework for improving access and coverage of quality nutrition  services for adolescent (15-18 years) and adult (19 years and older), people living with HIV, and tuberculosis (TB) clients in Malawi. The Plan seeks to (i) guide the Government and its partners to effectively plan and implement activities; (ii) accelerate the institutionalization and integration of service delivery within the health system; and (ii) provide a monitoring and evaluation (M&E) framework for implementation. To achieve the overall goal, the following seven objectives are outlined (i) improve availability and access to NCST supplies and equipment; (ii) increase competence and responsiveness of NCST workforce; (iii) increase the quality and geographical coverage of NCST service delivery; (iv) improve monitoring, evaluation, and information management; (v) strengthen leadership and governance of NCST services; (vi) increase resource mobilization and financing of NCST services; and (vii) intensify NCST services to respond to emergency and humanitarian situations. Main interventions shall be directed to (i) enhance an effective and efficient NCST commodity management system to have a consistent supply of the necessary equipment, supplies, and food commodities; (ii) establish sufficient and safe storage of therapeutic and supplementary food commodities at central, district and facility levels; (iii) improve efficiency of delivery of therapeutic and supplementary food commodities by ensuring last mile delivery to the beneficiary.

Policy: Barbados National Energy Policy 2017-2037.
Policy_Content: Barbados National Energy Policy is a national policy with a cross- sectoral approach. The timeframe of the policy is 20 years between 2017 and 2037. The main purpose of this Policy is to establish and maintain a sustainable energy sector for Barbados by ensuring energy security and affordability. The overall objectives of this Policy are: (I) achieving stability and predictability in energy product prices over the long term, (II) achieving affordability and access to all classes of consumers in energy products and services, (III) establishing a consistent and comprehensive regulatory framework to govern activities in various energy sub-sectors, (IV) increasing the amount of renewable energy sources used in the energy mix, (V) increasing diversity in the types of energy sources used in both the renewable energy and fossil fuel energy sectors, (VI) increasing the extent of energy resources obtained from indigenous sources, (VII) encouraging local investment in energy projects and programmes, (VIII) promoting more local entrepreneurial activities in renewable energy and increasing fossil fuel energy development throughout the energy sub-sectors, (IX) increasing collaboration within the energy subsectors and among the cross-cutting sectors, (X) improving the efficiency in the production and consumption of energy products, (XI) Improving the awareness and understanding of energy production and consumption, its impacts and the associated environmental and socio-economic consequences, (XII) increasing the number of persons locally with qualifications and skills relating to energy production and management of renewable energy and fossil fuel sources, (XIII) reducing the environmental impacts associated with the production and consumption of energy resources locally, (XIV) ensuring reliability and continuity of energy supply in the various local energy subsectors, (XV) attaining the lowest price sustainable by the local economy for various energy sources consumed in Barbados, while maintaining environmental efficiency, and (XVI) establishing effective partnerships between national and international entities for local energy projects.

Policy: Sudan E-Agriculture Strategy and Action Plan (2018-2022).
Policy_Content: This E-agriculture Strategy and Action Plan is a nationwide crosssectoral document built on SUDNAIP 2016-2020, the 5-year investment plan, which maps the investments needed to achieve the Sudan Comprehensive Africa Agriculture Development Programme (CAADP) target of 6% annual growth in Agriculture Domestic Product (GDP). It lays down a roadmap by which ICT developments  can significantly contribute towards achievement of the country’s agricultural Vision of "excellence in adopting e-solutions to transform agriculture for national prosperity capable of rapid and sustainable growth, inclusive of smallholders and with strong linkages to agricultural industrialization". The cross-sectoral nature of ICTs propels growth in other sectors that can be further leveraged by the Agriculture sector. More specifically, e- agriculture has the potential to meet the agricultural goals of Sudan by contributing in the following areas (i) improving national agricultural research and information systems; (ii) facilitating trade and domestic market access; (iii) improving agricultural extension and advisory services; (iv) promoting sustainable farming practices; (v) improving postharvest handling and logistics; (vi) enhancing disaster management and early warning systems; (vii) facilitating financial inclusion, credit, insurance and risk management schemes; (viii) advising policies and monitoring effective implementation; (ix) improving data availability and analysis for food safety and traceability; (x) enhancing linkage between government, researchers and producers which in turn facilitates effective policies; (xi) improving farmers’ incomes and productivity on a sustainable basis; (xii) enhancing knowledge management and access to information; (xiii) improve Forest Governance; (xiv) using ICT for Remote Sensing, Crowdsourcing, and Big Data to Unlock the Potential of Agricultural Data; and (xv) using ICT for Land Administration and Management. The Action Plan is envisioned to be implemented in three phases. A detailed monitoring and evaluation (M&E) plan would need to be developed after adoption of the Strategy for the expected outcomes and the Action Plan for each phase.

Policy: Agricultural Crown Lands Leases and Permits Regulation 152/2017.
Policy_Content: No person shall cultivate Crown lands, or graze livestock or cut hay on Crown lands, except under the authority of an agricultural lease or permit. An individual is eligible to participate in an auction or submit an application for an agricultural lease or permit if the individual is an adult Canadian citizen or permanent resident of Canada within the meaning of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (Canada). A partnership is eligible to participate in an auction or submit an application for an agricultural lease or permit if each partner meets the requirements set out in subsection (1). A band is eligible to participate in an auction or submit an application for an agricultural lease or permit. A forage cooperative is eligible to participate in an auction or submit an application for an agricultural lease or permit if each member of the cooperative meets the requirements of subsection (1). Hutterite colony or other similar organization, and a corporation owned by a Hutterite colony or other similar organization, is eligible to participate in an auction or submit an application for an agricultural lease or permit. A corporation, other than a corporation described in subsection (4) or (5), is eligible to participate in an auction or submit an application for an agricultural lease or permit if (a) the corporation is authorized by law to carry on business in Manitoba; and (b) each shareholder of the corporation meets the requirements of subsection (1). Before participating in an auction, an applicant must submit a registration form to the director that includes (a) a declaration of the applicant's eligibility to participate in the auction; and (b) any other information required by the director. If the director determines that agricultural Crown lands are suitable and available for leasing or permitting, the director may make the lands available by auction (section 4.2) or application (section 4.4). When making agricultural Crown lands available by auction, the director may issue any type of agricultural lease or permit for the lands, including a renewable permit or a casual permit. The successful bidder at an auction must immediately pay, (a) for a cropping lease, (i) the winning bid amount, (ii) the amount fixed by the minister under subsection 7(4) of the Act in lieu of real property taxes, and (iii) any other amount that may be payable under the terms and conditions of the lease; or (b) for any other agricultural lease or permit, the winning bid amount and an amount equal to the annual amount payable under subsection 9(1).
