Policy_Content: This Notification aims at (i) extending the use of modern pressurized irrigation systems by producers, (ii) providing production with better quality and suitable for market demand, and (iii) raising the level of income in rural areas. This Notification shall apply to determined self-irrigation systems between 1 January 2018 and 31 December 2020. This Notification sets forth the duties and responsibilities of the General Directorate, Provincial Directorate and District Directorate under the Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Livestock. Policy: Loi n°2017-026 du 07 décembre 2017 sur la Microfinance.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte refonte de la loi n° 2005-016 du 29 septembre 2005 relative à l’activité et au contrôle des institutions de microfinance. Cette loi nouvelle loi qui comprend 178 articles articulés autour de 10 titres, notamment: les dispositions luminaires; les conditions d’exercice et règlementation de la profession; la supervision et résolution des institutions de microfinance; l’organisation de la profession; la protection des consommateurs; la prévention, redressement et résolution des institutions de microfinance fragiles ; la liquidation des institutions de microfinance; le Fonds de garantie des dépôts; les sanctions disciplinaires et sanctions pénales; et les dispositions transitoires et finales Elle consiste à: moderniser le cadre légal du secteur de la microfinance par rapport à la vision de la finance inclusive et aux évolutions de la technologie ou les innovations en matière de distribution de services financiers numériques; fournir un développement sécurisé du secteur de la microfinance afin d’assurer la consolidation des acquis pour la fonction de supervision et d’accompagner la professionnalisation des institutions de microfinance (IMF); et mettre en place un dispositif de résolution spécifique aux IMF pour combler les lacunes en matière de traitement des IMF en difficulté.

Policy: Conservation and Management Measure on Marine Pollution (CMM 2017–04).
Policy_Content: This Conservation and Management Measure of the Western Central Pacific Fisheries Commission  (WCPFC), adopted in accordance with Article 5 of the WCPFC Convention and recalling MARPOL and the Sustainable Development Goal 14, encourage Commission Members, Cooperating Non-Members and Participating Territories (CCMs) to ratify, accept, approve or accede to the annexes of MARPOL and the London Protocol and require them to prohibit their fishing vessels operating within the WCPFC Convention Area from discharging any plastics. The CCMs are also, among other things, encouraged to prohibit their fishing vessels operating within the WCPFC Convention Area from discharging oil and other waste and requested to ensure adequate port reception facilities are provided to receive waste from fishing vessels. The Conservation Measure also concerns reduction of loss and facilitation of recovery of fishing gear. This Measure will be reviewed by the Commission every three years to consider expanding the scope of measure with respect to the elimination of marine pollution caused by fishing vessels.

Policy: Regulation (2017: 1268) with instructions for Climate Policy Council.
Policy_Content: This Regulation defines the duties of the Climate Change Policy Council. It also concerns its management. The Council shall evaluate how the Government's overall policy is consistent with the climate goals that are established by the Parliament and the Government. Within the framework of this general task, the Climate Policy Council shall in particular 1. evaluate whether the focus in different relevant policy areas contributes to or counteracts the opportunity to reach the climate goals; 2. highlight the effects of decided and proposed instruments from a broad social perspective; 3. identify policy areas where additional measures are needed; 4. analyze how the goals can be achieved in a cost-effective way, both short and long term; and 5. Evaluate the data and models on which the Government builds its policy. The Council shall be managed by a Board and shall report annually to the Government.

Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 29 articles divided into five Chapters, regulates the Programme for the Promotion of Rural Productive Activities. Policy_Content: La presente Resolución crea el Comité de Cartera del Fondo Nacional Ambiental (FONAM), como instancia asesora de las gestiones administrativas para depurar la cartera de imposible recaudo de cada una de las subcuentas que lo componen. El Comité de Cartera del FONAM tendrá las siguientes funciones: 1) Estudiar y evaluar si la cartera se encuentra inmersa en alguna de las causales señaladas para considerar que una acreencia a favor de la entidad constituye cartera de imposible recaudo, de todo lo cual se dejará constancia en acta; 2) Recomendar al representante legal del FONAM que declare mediante acto administrativo una acreencia como cartera de imposible recaudo, el cual será el fundamento para castigar la cartera de la contabilidad y para dar por terminados los procesos de cobro de cartera que se hubieren iniciado.

Policy: Sudan Drinking Water Safety Strategic Framework (SDWSSF).
Policy_Content: This Drinking Water Safety (DWS) Strategic Framework (SDWSSF) is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at providing strategic direction to the scaling up of access to Safe Drinking Water (SDW) across Sudan in order to ensure that, when drinking water is provided, the system will be appropriately designed and the drinking water effectively protected to minimize faecal contamination and elevated levels of toxic chemicals, and guarantee effective and sustainable treatment processes. The purpose is to achieve the Vision for which all people in Sudan have sustainable access to and use safe drinking water, contributing to the upholding of a range of human rights and the longer term prosperity and development of Sudan. This, by (i) providing clear strategic direction, leading to increased harmonisation of approaches by all stakeholders across sectors, including government, non-governmental organisations and the private sector; (ii) increasing understanding of the cross-sectoral responsibilities and the contributions related to the supply, monitoring and sustainability of SDW, including but not limited to: education, health, nutrition, dignity, gender equality and economic development; and (iii) encouraging increased collaboration, partnerships and engagement across sectors. The document includes a number of cross-cutting issues regard gender and equality issues, as well as the consideration of the areas related to the sustainability, seasonality, environment, climate change and Disaster Risk Reduction.

Policy: Arrêté interministériel n° 30062/2017 du 04 decembre 2017 Portant création du Comité Technique d’Orientation du Programme (CTOP) « Promotion de l’Entrepreneuriat ».
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté, en application des dispositions de l’article 2 alinéa 2 du décret n° 2015-089 du 10 février 2015 modifié et complété par le décret n° 2017-915 du 10 octobre 2017 fixant les attributions du Ministre de l’Industrie et du Développement du Secteur Privé ainsi que l’organisation générale de son Ministère, crée le Comité Technique d’Orientation du Programme (CTOP)  Promotion de l’Entrepreneuriat» qui  constitue un cadre général de développement des micros et petites entreprises en milieu rural ainsi qu’en zone périurbaine et urbaine.  Le CTOP « Promotion de l’Entrepreneuriat » a pour mission de favoriser et de développer l'entrepreneuriat, la création de micro et petites entreprises, la promotion de toutes personnes physiques ou morales dont les objectifs concourent à la création de valeur ajoutée. A cet effet, il est chargé notamment de : conduire la mise en place de la stratégie nationale de développement de l’entrepreneuriat ; initier l’élaboration et la mise en œuvre des stratégies de développement des micros et petites entreprises, et en assurer le suivi,  jusqu’à la mise place de la stratégie nationale de développement de l’entrepreneuriat ; participer aux travaux et accompagner les intervenants pour l’analyse des enjeux, l’établissement des perspectives et la proposition d’actions à mener ; coordonner l’exercice des  activités et  la réalisation  des actions  d’appui  pour  la  promotion  de l’entrepreneuriat ; élaborer, adapter et proposer des outils et des pratiques permettant aux acteurs économiques et producteurs d’améliorer la gestion de la qualité de leurs produits ou de leurs services ; contribuer à la facilitation d’accès aux marchés des produits et des services offerts par les entreprises.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries

Policy: Control of Mercury (Enforcement) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 1200 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations supplement Regulation EU 2017/852 of the European Parliament and of the Council on mercury by establishing offences, penalties and enforcement powers relating to that Regulation. They also define the “enforcing authority” as— (a) for England and offshore installations in the English offshore area, the Environment Agency; (b) for Northern Ireland, the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs (“DAERA”); (c) for Scotland and offshore installations in the Scottish offshore area, the Scottish Environment Protection Agency (“SEPA”); (d) for Wales, the Natural Resources Body for Wales (“NRW”). Minor amendments are made to other legislation.

A ce titre, ii est charge, notamment, de: délibérer sur les avis, les conclusions, les résolutions et les recommandations des départements et organismes participant au processus de création des zones économiques spéciales; fixer les orientations stratégiques concernant la nature des secteurs d'activités et le niveau de spécialisation des zones économiques spéciales; approuver le contenu de la convent ion de développement ou d'opération et les conditions particulières applicables à la sélection des développeurs ou opérateurs des zones économiques spéciales sur rapport du ministre charge des zones économiques spéciales.

Policy: Law No. 8.327 providing for the State Policy on Shrimp Farming and the promotion, protection and regulation of shrimp farming, recognizing it as an agroforestry activity, of relevant social and economic interest, establishing the conditions for its sustainable development within the State of Sergipe.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 31 articles divided into five Chapters, provides for the State Policy on Shrimp Farming and the promotion, protection and regulation of shrimp farming, recognizing it as an agroforestry activity, of relevant social and economic interest, establishing a new economic and social reality in rural areas and exploring in a sustainable way and in harmony with the conservation of the environment the vast aquaculture resources of the State of Sergipe. The Law establishes that Shrimp farming activities should comply with the following classification: micro shrimp farming; small-scale shrimp farming; medium-sized shrimp farming; and large size shrimp farming, all carried out in fresh, brackish or salt water environments, using nurseries excavated or constructed on natural land, with specific water surface areas. It prohibits the subdivision of contiguous areas belonging to the same physical or juridical person, for the purpose of classification as of smaller size. Regardless of size, shrimp farming is classified as a medium potential activity, as established in the National Environmental Policy approved by Federal Law No. 6.938 of 31 August 1981.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 806 validating the Regulation on external analysis of corruption risks.
Policy_Content: Regulation on external analysis of corruption risks determines the procedure for conducting an external analysis of corruption risks in activities of state bodies and organizations, subjects of quasi-public sector, with the exception of special state bodies. It shall be applicable to the following fields: (a) the highest supervision carried out by the prosecutor's office; (b) pre-trial criminal proceedings; (c) proceedings on cases of administrative offenses; (d) justice; (e) operational-search activity; (f) criminal-executive activity; and (g) control over compliance with the requirements of the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan related to state secrets. Conducting an external analysis of corruption risks includes the following steps: (a) collection, generalization and analysis of information regarding an external object of analysis of corruption risks; and (b) preparation, approval and signing of an analytical report. External analysis of corruption risks is carried out according to the following directions: (a) identification of corruption risks in regulatory legal acts, affecting the activities of the object of external analysis of corruption risks; and (b) identification of corruption risks in the organizational and management activities of the object of external analysis of corruption risks.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Common Agricultural Policy Basic Payment and Support Schemes (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 1198 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Common Agricultural Policy Basic Payment and Support Schemes (England) Regulations 2014 in regulation 13 on ecological focus areas. They set out the period that land must lie fallow and provides for wooded strips and trees in line to be included within the landscape feature group. It also sets out the minimum width for the newly merged ecological focus area of buffer strips and field margins, and removes the provision excluding buffer strips required under cross compliance rules from the calculation of minimum width. Finally, it extends the time period for which catch crops must be maintained, bringing it in line with the new minimum period under EU law.

Policy: Order No. 443 of the State Inspection of Nuclear Regulation validating the Requirements for risk-informed decision-making related to safety of nuclear plants.
Policy_Content: This Order sets forth the Requirements for risk-informed decision-making related to safety of nuclear plants. These Requirements shall be mandatory for all legal entities and individuals who adopt risk-informed approaches when making decisions on activities related to placement, design, construction, commissioning, operation and decommissioning of nuclear power plants, safety assessment and regulation of nuclear and radiation safety of nuclear power plants. The purpose of risk-informed decision making on nuclear plant security shall be as follows: (a) improving the safety of nuclear plants by identifying and taking into account the factors that have a dominant influence on the safety of the nuclear plants and the implementation of measures to improve the safety of nuclear plants; (b) comprehensive assessment of the impact of decisions on the safety of nuclear plants, taking into account the results of risk assessments, in addition to deterministic assessments and operational experience; (c) optimizing the operation of nuclear plants due to the concentration of resources on the factors, structures, systems and elements of nuclear plants that are dominant over the safety impact; and (d) reasonable reduction of excessive conservatism and constraints that were taken into account in the development of the nuclear plant project and substantiation of security. The substantiation for the observance of deterministic requirements shall be as follows: a balance is maintained between preventing severe damage to the core, preventing the release of radioactive substances in the environment and mitigating the effects.
Subject: Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 012-2017-MINAM ─ Criterios para la Gestión de Sitios Contaminados.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba los Criterios para la Gestión de Sitios Contaminados, con el objeto establecer los criterios para la gestión de sitios contaminados generados por actividades antrópicas, los cuales comprenden aspectos de evaluación y remediación, a ser regulados por las autoridades sectoriales competentes, con la finalidad de proteger la salud de las personas y el ambiente. Los presentes criterios son de aplicación a las autoridades sectoriales que tienen competencias para regular la normatividad de alcance nacional respecto de las actividades productivas, extractivas o de servicios, bajo el ámbito de su competencia, cuyo desarrollo puede generar sitios contaminados. La evaluación de sitios potencialmente contaminados comprende las siguientes fases: a) Fase de identificación; b) Fase de caracterización; c) Fase de elaboración del plan dirigido a la remediación. El plan dirigido a la remediación se elabora cuando la fase de caracterización determine la necesidad de ejecutar medidas de remediación.

Policy: Order No. 316 of the Ministry of Regional Development, Construction, Housing and Municipal Facilities validating the Regulation on acceptance of effluent waste water (sewage) to centralized sewerage systems and calculation of charges for excessive discharge of effluent waste water (sewage) to centralized drainage system.
Policy_Content: This Regulation is  designed for the following purposes: (a) protection of health of the personnel from collection systems, sewage treatment and waste water treatment facilities; (b) prevention of damages to sewage treatment equipment; (c) ensuring uninterrupted maintenance of sewage treatment facilities and treatment of sediments within the limits of the standard rules of operation; (d) ensuring that the discharges of sewage from treatment facilities do not cause hazardous environmental impact; and (e) ensuring that the precipitation can be disposed of in a safe and environmentally acceptable manner. Manufacturers establish a requirement for each individual customer to dispose of waste water to a centralized drainage system based on the requirements of this Regulation, as well as local rules of acceptance. Consumers shall have the following duties: (a) adhere to the requirements for wastewater discharges and established quantitative and qualitative indicators of waste water in sewer pipes of consumers, require subcontractors to comply with the provisions of this Regulation and the requirements of local rules of acceptance; (b) to carry out systematic monitoring of the quantity and quality of wastewater discharged to centralized drainage systems and to provide the manufacturer with information on the volumes and qualitative composition of wastewater discharged to the centralized drainage systems; (c) to carry out, at the request of the manufacturer, a pre-determined period of preliminary purification of polluted wastewater in the local treatment facilities with the obligatory disposal or removal of sediments formed in this case; (d) in case of a change in its water drainage (transfer of buildings and sewage networks to other owners/users, change of technological processes or change of 30% or more of the previous sewage, construction works on the site (if it affects or may affect for the fulfillment by the consumer of the requirements for discharging issued by the manufacturer, the accession of the sub-consumer, etc.) to notify the manufacturer within seven days of the occurrence of such changes, in accordance with the established procedure, receive from the manufacturer the technical conditions for water supply and water maintenance of the facility and make changes to the contract; (e) to conclude a new contract with the manufacturer in case of change of the owner of the object; (f) to provide the manufacturer with the necessary information on their sewage system and free access to it, as well as assistance in sampling waste water consumers, studying their discharging regime, inspection of the drainage system and local wastewater treatment facilities; (g) to nominate at least two representatives who are authorized to represent the consumer during the sampling of sewage, about which within three days to notify the manufacturer in writing and to ensure the presence of the authorized representatives in person during the sampling of sewage water by the producer; (h) to participate in the elimination of accidents and the replacement of emergency sewage networks by proper forces and means, as well as in the reimbursement of capital expenditures for the restoration of the centralized drainage system of the producer in case of deterioration of its technical condition and accidental destruction due to the fault of the consumer; and (i) to check the calculations of the allowable concentrations of polluting substances in wastewater discharged to the centralized drainage systems, performed by the manufacturer, and, in case of disagreement, to apply for their revision.

Policy: Resolution of the Council of Ministers No. 1/2018 approving the Revitalization Programme for Pinhal Interior Region.
Policy_Content: This Resolution of the Council of Ministers approves the Revitalization Programme for Pinhal Interior Region (PRPI). PRPI develops a set of measures and actions of a strong territorial nature, capitalizing on local complementarity and synergies and coordinating the various sectoral policies in favour of a development strategy for this area. PRPI covers the applicable land planning and management and rural development policy instruments, defining operational strategies, plans and actions to be carried out. It defines, based on a specific governance model, the responsibilities and competencies of the various actors, allowing the programming and financing of specific actions in the short or medium term, especially in the dimensions of sustained reordering of forest areas, business dynamization of regions fire prevention and strategic management. PRPI integrates, for different levels of territorial incidence: a) Pilot and experimental measures or priority projects with a strong physical component, applicable to the municipalities of Castanheira de Pêra, Figueiró dos Vinhos, Góis, Pampilhosa da Serra, Pedrógão Grande, Penela and Sertã; b) Regulatory and strategic planning measures to encourage investment and promotion of territorial and social cohesion, taking into account the specific characteristics of Pinhal Interior Region, applicable to the said municipalities, and to the municipalities of Alvaiázere, Ansião, Arganil , Lousã, Mação, Miranda do Corvo, Oleiros, Oliveira do Hospital, Proença-a-Nova, Tábua, Vila de Rei and Vila Nova de Poiares; c) Measures for specific territorial coverage, provided for in instruments of a legal or regulatory nature; and d) Measures at the national level.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Law No. XIII-804 “On protection of rapporteurs.”
Policy_Content: This Law establishes the rights and obligations of persons who have reported violations in institutions, the bases and forms of their legal protection, as well as measures for the protection, promotion and assistance of such persons in order to provide appropriate opportunities to report violations that threaten or violate the public interest, prevention and detection of irregularities. "Infringement information" means information provided by an internal reporting channel, either directly to the competent authority or directly to the public related to a criminal offense, administrative misconduct, misconduct or breach of duty, as well as a serious breach of mandatory professional ethics or any other threat to the public interest which the notifier becomes aware of from his or her possession of information or through employment relationship or contractual relationship with that body. "Notifier" means a person who provides information on a breach in an establishment with which he has or has had an employment or employment relationship or a contractual relationship (consultancy, contracting, traineeships, internships, volunteering, etc.) and who is recognized as a notifier by the competent authority. Notification means an application to the competent authority in accordance with the formal requirements established by this Law, which provides specific information about the violation that complies with the features established by this Law. According to this law, information on violations is provided due to: (a) danger to public safety or health, life or health of a person; (b) danger to the environment; (c) obstruction or unlawful influence on investigations conducted by law enforcement authorities or in the administration of justice; (d) financing of illegal activities; (e) illegal or non-transparent use of public funds or property; (f) illegally acquired property; (g) concealment of the consequences of the committed violation, obstruction of determining the extent of the consequences; and (h) other violations. A person may provide information about the violation: (a) in the institution through the internal channel for providing information on violations; (b) directly to the competent authority; and (c) in public. The competent authority, having determined that the person who submitted the notification and the information on the violation specified by him or her complies with the requirements established by this Law, shall recognize the person as a notifier and notify him or her thereof. The main measures for the protection, promotion and assistance of whistleblowers are: (a) ensuring secure channels for providing information on infringements; (b) ensuring the confidentiality of a person; (c) a prohibition to have an adverse effect on the person who provided the information on the violation; (d) the right to receive remuneration for valuable information; (e) the right to receive compensation; (f) provision of free legal aid; and (g) disclaimer.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This law enters into force on 1 January 2019.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 1230/2018 approving the Code of Agricultural Good Practices.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision establishes the Code of Agricultural Good Practices – Protection of Water against Pollution Caused by Nitrates and phosphates of Agricultural Origin. The evolution of scientific knowledge, related to cultural techniques to be applied in an agriculture that allows to reconcile the increase of the production of food and other goods with the reduction of the environmental impact to which they originate. It imposes that the Code of Good Agricultural Practices (CBPA) for the protection of the water against the pollution with nitrates of agricultural origin should be periodically reviewed, providing the productive sector with basic information that allows the preservation of environmental quality, today constituting a major concern for Humanity, given the different threats that are continually arising, putting at risk its own survival. Crops will only be able to produce fully in quantity and quality if, in addition to other favorable environmental conditions, they have at their disposal, throughout the growing period, the various mineral nutrients (nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium, calcium, magnesium, sulfur, iron , manganese, copper, zinc, nickel, boron, molybdenum and chlorine), in the most appropriate quantities and proportions.

Policy: Decreto Legislativo Nº 838 - Modifica la Ley de fomento, protección y desarrollo para la micro y pequeña empresa.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la que tiene por objeto fomentar la creación, protección, desarrollo y fortalecimiento de las Micro y Pequeñas Empresas (MYPE), respecto al fortalecimiento del rol de los Órganos Rector y Ejecutor establecidos por la Ley, a fin de armonizar las atribuciones de los referidos Órganos y complementarlas para robustecer sus actuaciones. El Órgano Rector para la ejecución del contenido de la Ley es el Ministerio de Economía, el cual en coordinación con la Comisión Nacional de la Micro y Pequeña Empresa (CONAMYPE), diseñará y definirá las Políticas Nacionales Para el Fomento y Desarrollo de la Competitividad de las MYPE, así como las Políticas Sectoriales que incluyan el enfoque de género y los Programas para el desarrollo sostenible de éstas. Policy: Resolución Nº 263-2017-MIDIS ─ Manual de Operaciones del Programa Nacional Plataformas de Acción para la Inclusión Social (PAIS).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba el Manual de Operaciones del Programa Nacional Plataformas de Acción para la Inclusión Social (PAIS), que tiene por finalidad mejorar la calidad de vida de la población pobre y extremadamente pobre, especialmente la asentada en los centros poblados rurales o rural dispersa, coadyuvando a su desarrollo económico, social y productivo que contribuyan a su inclusión social. Policy: Presidential Resolution No. PP-3405 “On State program for the development of irrigation and improvement of the ameliorative state of irrigated land for the period of 2018-2019”.
Policy_Content: The President, in order to create favorable conditions for further sustainable agricultural development, unconditional provision of timely and high-quality implementation of a set of measures for the development of irrigation, improvement of reclamation state of irrigated lands and rational use of water and land resources, decrees to approve elaborated by the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Resources, Ministry of Economy, Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Uzbekistan, State Committee of the Republic of Uzbekistan for Land Resources, Geodesy, Cartography and State Cadastre jointly with the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Karakalpakstan and local self-government the Program of Comprehensive Measures for the Development of Irrigation, Improvement of the Reclamation Status of Irrigated Lands and the Sound Use of Water Resources for the Period 2018-2019 in accordance with Annex No. 1. Main areas of implementation of the Comprehensive Program shall be identified as follows: first, improvement of the regulatory and legal framework for assessing water availability and reclamation of irrigated land, ensuring rational management and use of water resources, timely and high-quality implementation of irrigation and land reclamation; second, improving the quality and efficiency of irrigation and ameliorative measures on the basis of a comprehensive assessment of current indicators of water availability and reclamation status of irrigated lands, rational use of water and land resources, and ensuring safety and reliability of operation of critical water management facilities; third, rational management and efficient use of water resources, active implementation of the drip irrigation system and other progressive water-saving technologies for watering crops, as well as combating wind erosion of irrigated lands; fourth, the improvement of the monitoring and control system for the rational management and use of water resources, as well as the ameliorative state of irrigated lands and the fertility of soils; fifth, the strengthening of the material and technical base of construction organizations that specialize in the implementation of reclamation and other water management operations, operational water management organizations, water users associations and farms, as well as other organizations, improving the quality of modern services and the efficiency of land reclamation and other equipment, machinery, equipment and other means of mechanization; and sixth, the training of managers and specialists in the water sector and other participants in the State Program for the Development of Irrigation, the Improvement of the Reclamation Status of Irrigated Lands and the Sound Management of Water Resources.

Policy: Norm MAPA No. 39 approving the International Agricultural and Livestock Surveillance System (VIGIAGRO) for international trade and transit operations of agricultural products.
Policy_Content: This Norm, consisting of 77 articles divided into seven Chapters and 53 Annexes, approves the International Agricultural and Livestock Surveillance System (VIGIAGRO), its rules and the technical, administrative and operational control and enforcement procedures for international trade and transit operations of agricultural products. Vigiagro implements the actions defined by the Secretariat of Agricultural Protection - SDA regarding the international transit of agricultural products, regulated by the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply - MAPA. Vigiagro has the following principles: I - prevention and mitigation of risks, especially for agricultural production and human health; II - harmonization and simplification of inspection procedures; III - transparency and predictability in their actions; IV - greater use of information technology; V - risk management in supervision operations; VI - facilitation of the international safe trade of agricultural products; VII - efficiency in decision-making and in the completion of inspections; and VIII - coordinated intervention with other organs of the public administration.

Policy: Order No. 1273 on the Danish Agricultural Agency's duties and powers.
Policy_Content: The Danish Agricultural Agency is an Agency under the Ministry of Environment and Food. The Agency implements the Ministry's business policy in agriculture and processing, and is also Denmark's paying organism of funds from the European Agricultural Guarantee Fund (EAGF) and the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD). This Order establishes the Agency's administration duties in relation to EU support schemes in the agricultural sector; funds for research, development and demonstration projects in fisheries, food and veterinary matters; plants and plant products; organic agricultural production and authorization of ecologists; sustainable use of agricultural land, including the operation of agricultural land; commercial fertilizers and soil improvers; conservation of plant and animal genetic resources, etc. It also sets inspection and monitoring duties in relation to certain Danish legislations in the food, environment, and agricultural sector. The Agency also provides technical assistance to the Minister for the Environment and Food and other public authorities. The Order also sets detail provisions on the Powers exercised by the Director of the Danish Agricultural Agency on behalf of the Minister of Environment and Food in relation to certain legislations relevant to the food and agriculture sector. The Agency’s administration duties extend to the Urban and Rural Acts, and to the Fisheries Development Act. Cross-compliance of powers for the protection of animal welfare conferred by an authority under the Ministry of Environment and Food shall be exercised by the director of the Danish Agricultural Agency in accordance to article  24a, sections 2-3, 6.

Policy: Law “On state land cadastre”.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes legal, economic and organizational bases of activity in the field of state land cadastre, a unified state geoinformation system of documented information on the natural, economic and legal regime, categories, quantitative and qualitative characteristics and economic assessment of land, location thereof and size of land parcels, as well as on land distribution by land owners, land users and land tenants. State land cadastre is aimed at: (a) ensuring sustainable land management; (b) implementation of state control over rational use and protection, as well as monitoring of changes in the state of land resources; (c) performance of activities aimed at preserving and increasing soil fertility; (d) supply of information to the state authorities and Gengesh, other legal entities, as well as natural persons; and (e) performance of other activities in the field of the state land cadastre. The main principles of administering state land cadastre are: (a) unification of the system of state land cadastre in the territory of Turkmenistan; (b) completeness of coverage of all lands in the territory of Turkmenistan; (c) reliability and availability of information of the State Land Cadastre on land plots for interested parties; (d) continuity of updated information contained in state land cadastre about the changing properties of land; (e) obligation to submit information on the sites pertaining to the land fund (public land) of Turkmenistan to the state land cadastre; (f) comparability and compatibility of the data of state land cadastre with the data of inventories, registers and information sources on state (public) and industrial natural resources, as well as information about other immovable property connected with land; and (g) documentation of the information contained in state land cadastre. Object of state land cadastre is the land fund of Turkmenistan, regardless of where the land is located. The subjects of the state land cadastre are landowners, land users and land tenants. This Law consists of VII Chapters divided into 35 Articles. Chapter I lays down general provisions. Chapter II regards state regulation in the field of state land cadastre. Chapter III establishes the content of state land cadastre. Chapter IV lists documentation of state land cadastre. Chapter V specifies land cadastre administering and establishes the modalities for correcting errors in land cadastre documentation. Chapter VI specifies information contained in state land cadastre. Chapter VII lays down final provisions.

Policy: Law amending Land Code.
Policy_Content: Article 94 shall be amended to add the following wording: “The state land cadastre is a unified state geoinformation system of documented data on natural, economic and legal regime, categories, quantitative and qualitative characteristics and economic assessment of land plots, location and size thereof, as well as their distribution among landowners, land users and lessees. The state land cadastre includes: (a) comprehensive information on state registration of rights to land plots; (b) quantitative and qualitative characteristics of land plots; (c) information on appraisal of soils; (d) economic assessment of land plots; (e) other information related to rational use and protection of land resources established by the legislation of Turkmenistan. The state land cadastre is intended for land information support of state authorities and local self-government bodies, other legal entities and also natural persons with a view of exercising state control over the rational use and protection of land resources, taking measures aimed at preserving and enhancing the soil fertility, establishing a reasonable payment for land and the procedure for its collection. The state land cadastre forms the basis of other state registers included in the unified system of state registers of Turkmenistan.”

Policy: Law No. 1.211 creating the State Programme for the Development of the Family Aquaculture Production Chain, as well as use resources to promote activities to support and encourage the activity.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 12 articles, creates the State Programme for the Development of the Family Aquaculture Production Chain, as well as use resources to promote activities to support and encourage the activity. This State Programme, under the State Executive Branch using resources from the State Secretariat of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply, promotes actions to support and encourage the activity of fish farming in the implantation phase (construction of tanks), aiming to increase production and generate incomes to rural families through specific projects. The beneficiaries of the Programme must be producers or land tenants of rural holdings, settlements and fisher-folks, located in the municipalities of the State. Farmers who wish to participate in the programme must comply with the requirements of the National Programme on Family Agriculture (PRONAF) of the Federal Government.

Policy: Law No. 1.210 establishing procedures for environmental licensing to extract mineral substances and defining the criteria for the exemption of Environmental Impact Studies and Environmental Impact Report (EIA/RIMA).
Policy_Content: This Law establishes procedures for environmental licensing to extract mineral substances and defines the criteria for the exemption of Environmental Impact Assessment and Environmental Impact Report (EIA/RIMA). FEMARH, due to its nature, characteristics and other peculiarities of the activity of extraction of mineral substances for immediate use in civil construction (as described in Annex I) will exempt the presentation of the Environmental Impact Assessment and the Environmental Impact Report (EIA/RIMA), granting the environmental licensing of these projects, based on the analysis of their Environmental Control Reports (RCA's) to be carried out according to the references described in Annex III. Policy: Decreto Ley Nº 351 - Ley del régimen especial de seguridad social de los cooperativistas de las Unidades Básicas de Producción Cooperativa.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Ley, que consta de 46 artículos divididos en nueve Capítulos, establece un Régimen Especial de Seguridad Social dirigido a la protección de las personas asociadas en las unidades básicas de producción cooperativa, llamados cooperativistas. Este Régimen Especial protege a los cooperativistas en los casos de enfermedad o accidente de origen común o profesional, maternidad, invalidez total, vejez, y en caso de muerte, protege a su familia. La afiliación al régimen especial de los cooperativistas es obligatoria y constituye un  requisito indispensable para recibir los beneficios de la seguridad social regulados en este  Decreto Ley. Se excluyen de la expresada obligación                                     los cooperativistas que son sujetos del régimen general o cualquier otro régimen especial.

Este Decreto es aplicable a: 1) Planes y programas de inversión sectoriales y nacionales; 2) Proyectos sujetos a realizar Estudios de Impacto Ambiental; 3) Proyectos sujetos a realizar Valoración Ambiental y Programa de Gestión Ambiental; 4) Actividades, proyectos, obras e industrias sujetos a realizar Declaración Notarial de Compromiso Ambiental; 5) Actividades, proyectos, obras e industrias experimentales sujetos a Valoración Ambiental provisional por ser novedosos, de los cuales no existe conocimientos ni experiencias sobre sus potenciales impactos al ambiente; 6) Permisos para planes de manejo conservacionistas en áreas protegidas; 7) Permisos para planes de saneamiento forestal en áreas protegidas; 8) Licencia de exportador de especies de fauna y flora silvestres; 9) Permisos para el comercio internacional de especies de fauna silvestre; 10) Permisos para el comercio internacional de especies marinas; 11) Permisos para el comercio internacional de especies forestales; 12) Permisos para exportación de productos elaborados de especies de fauna silvestre; 13) Autorización de investigación científica; 14) Autorización de manejo ambiental del material vegetativo seco como una herramienta para la producción sostenible; 15) Autorización ambiental en la protección y uso de los suelos agropecuarios y forestales; 16) Autorización ambiental para la declaración de las reservas silvestres privadas en Nicaragua; 17) Autorizaciones para manejo y eliminación de residuos y desechos peligrosos y no peligrosos para todas aquellas actividades que no fueron evaluadas en su momento en la respectiva evaluación ambiental o valoración ambiental; 18) Planes de saneamiento forestal en áreas protegidas; 19) Autorización para el movimiento transfronterizo de desechos peligrosos.

Policy: Ozone Layer Protection Act (No. 25 of 2017).
Policy_Content: The objectives of the Act are (I) prevention and minimization of the release of ozone depleting substances into the environment to protect human health and the environment; (II) control and reduction of the import, export, use, sale and storage of ozone depleting substances with a precautionary approach; (III) management and control of the phasing out of ozone depleting substances except for essential uses pursuant to the obligations under the Vienna Convention for the Protection of Ozone Layer and Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer; and (IV) fulfillment of the obligations under the Vienna Convention and Montreal Protocol. To this end, this Act lays down provisions on the duties of the Department of Commerce, Industry and Environment; application criteria and procedures for import, export, sales, handling, and premises licenses; conditions for and duration, renewal or denial of license; establishment and maintenance of a register of licenses; prohibitions for importing, exporting, handling, sale or purchase of controlled substance in bulk or refrigerant, and premises without license; re-export of items seized by authorized officers; disposal, handling, and testing of controlled substances, prescribed goods, refrigeration or air-conditioning equipment; obligation of license holders for record keeping; and offences and penalties. The Minister may by notice in the Gazette authorize an officer of the Department, a Police officer or a Customs officer to be an authorized officer for the purposes of this Act. Controlled substances and a list of products containing controlled substances are listed in Schedule 1 and prescribed goods are listed in Schedule 2.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Marine Pollution (Amendment) Act No. 16 of 2017.
Policy_Content: This Act makes amendments in the Principal Act in accordance with the implementation of the International Convention on the Control of Harmful Anti-fouling Systems on Ships (2001), International Convention for the Control and Management of Ships' Ballast Water and Sediments (2004), International Convention on Liability and Compensation for Damage in connection with the Carriage of Hazardous and Noxious Substances by Sea (1996), International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships (1973) as modified by the Protocol of 1978, and the Nairobi International Convention on the Removal of Wrecks (2007). This Act inserts Part-IA Administrative and Planning Provisions concerning the provisions on the responsibilities of the Ministry, the establishment of a National Marine Pollution Committee, and the development and implementation of the National Marine Spill Contingency Plan. Section 5 of the Principal Act is replaced by the requirements related to garbage on ships and new Section 5A about the controls on the discharge of sewage from ships, new Section 5B about the harmful substances in packaged form, new Section 5C about the controls over air pollution from ships, new Section 5D about the controls over ballast water, new Section 5E about the hull cleaning and scraping, and new Section 5F about the anti-fouling paints and systems are inserted in compliance with the international conventions above mentioned. Section 10 is amended by updating provisions on the waste reception facilities at ports. Finally, the amounts of administrative fines are updated in several sections.

Policy: Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 1177 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations amend the Environmental Damage (Prevention and Remediation) (England) Regulations 2015 to require operators to identify potential remedial measures for damage caused by marine pollution and submit them to the enforcement authority (regulation 20) and to provide for proper transposition of Directive 2004/35/EC (Schedule 1). The latter amendment addresses damage to a site of scientific interest which is also a European site (as defined in S.I. 2017/1012). It provides that damage caused by an act expressly authorised by the relevant authorities in accordance with Part 2 of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 is not automatically excluded from the scope of the 2015 Regulations. Such damage will continue to be excluded if the authorisation under the 1981 Act was granted in accordance with legislation transposing Council Directive 92/43/EEC on the conservation of natural habitats and of wild fauna and flora.

Policy: Law No. XIII-801 “On purchase of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be to prevent speculation in agricultural land and preserve traditional forms of farming; to create conditions for the formation of rational land holdings and land consolidation; and to promote the rational use of agricultural land. It shall not be applicable to agricultural land of subsistence farming, land used for horticulture and gardening, and inherited land and land owned by the way of restoration of legal rights of ownership. Persons who have acquired agricultural land pursuant to this Act, must for a period of at least 5 years after the acquisition of this land ensure its use for agricultural activity, whose minimum annual production output per hectare of land is determined by the Minister of Agriculture of the Republic of Lithuania. The main purpose of land use of agricultural land purchased from the state pursuant to this law may be changed not earlier than 5 years after the date of acquisition of the agricultural parcel. Total land area of agricultural land purchased from the state by a single legal or natural person shall not exceed 500 hectares. This Law consists of 8 Articles. Article 1 establishes the scope of the Law. Article 2 specifies obligation on purchased agricultural land. Article 3 establishes maximum agricultural land area that can be purchased in ownership. Article 4 regards acquisition of public agricultural land. Article 5 establishes preferential right of purchase of private agricultural land. Article 6 establishes liability of legal persons for non-performance of agricultural activities on agricultural land. Article 7 regards offences and penalties. Article 8 establishes the modalities of entry into force of this Law.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Environmental Planning and Assessment Amendment Act 2017.
Policy_Content: This Act amends the Environmental Planning and Assessment Act 1979 No. 203. The objects of this Act are as follows: a) to promote the social and economic welfare of the community and a better environment by the proper management, development and conservation of the State’s natural and other resources; b) to facilitate ecologically sustainable development by integrating relevant economic, environmental and social considerations in decision-making about environmental planning and assessment; c) to promote the orderly and economic use and development of land; d) to promote the delivery and maintenance of affordable housing; e) to protect the environment, including the conservation of threatened and other species of native animals and plants, ecological communities and their habitats; f) to promote the sustainable management of built and cultural heritage (including Aboriginal cultural heritage); g) to promote good design and amenity of the built environment; h) to promote the proper construction and maintenance of buildings, including the protection of the health and safety of their occupants; i) to promote the sharing of the responsibility for environmental planning and assessment between the different levels of government in the State; j) to provide increased opportunity for community participation in environmental planning and assessment.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Order No. 626 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on care of forests.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that care of forests shall be performed with the consideration of legislation on environmental protection, forest management, sanitary and safety regulations related to forest management. In forests located in protected areas shall be considered legislation on protected areas. Care of forests shall be performed by persons managing forests in accordance with forest plot lease contracts or permanent (open-ended) forest management, or state bodies and local government within their plenary powers. In commercial forests arrangements for care of forests shall be aimed at improvement of forest productivity, obtaining high quality timber and non-timber products. In protection forests and in forests located in protected areas arrangements for care of forests shall be aimed at conservation and restoration of environment-forming, water-protective, protective, sanitary-hygienic, healthcare and beneficial functions of forests. Sanitary felling for the care of forest stands should be carried out to achieve the following results: (a) improvement of age structure and species composition of forest plantations; (b) improving the quality and sustainability of forest plantations; (c) preservation and strengthening of protective, water-protective, sanitary-hygienic properties of forest plantations; (d) maintenance and restoration of forest biological diversity; (e) increasing the productivity of forest plantations; (f) reduction of the terms of growing of technically mature stands; and (g) rational use of timber resources. This Regulation consists of V Sections. Section I lays down general provisions. Section II regards felling and timber extraction of forest species. Section III deals with care of forests by means of agro-forestry and other arrangements. Section IV regards allocation of forest plots, organization and technology of forest management, monitoring, assessment of the quality and effectiveness of measures for care of forests. Section V establishes the particular care of forests for the Dvina-Vychegda taiga forest area, the Baltic-Belozersky taiga forest area, the Middle Angara taiga forest area.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 765-pp validating the Regulation on the nature monument of regional significance “Lake Heart”.
Policy_Content: Nature monument of regional significance “Lake Heart” is formed for the purpose of conservation and maintenance in an unchanged state a unique hydrological object, which is important in nature conservation, aesthetic, educational and recreational terms. Nature monument is formed for an unlimited period of time. The objectives of the formation of nature monument shall be as follows: (a) preservation of a unique hydrological object; (b) study of the natural monument and ecological education of the population. The tasks of nature monument shall be as follows: (a) decrease in the level of anthropogenic impact; (b) maintaining the state of the natural environment, prevailing at the time of its organization; (c) assistance in carrying out research work in the field of hydrology, zoology and botany without violating the established regime of special protection of the nature monument; and (d) implementation of state monitoring of the environment. On the territory of the nature monument, any activity that entails a violation of the preservation of the nature monument is prohibited, including: (a) expropriation and allotment of land plots for types of economic activities not related to the implementation of measures to comply with the special protection regime and ensuring the functioning of the natural monument; (b) violation, change of the landscape and soil cover of the nature monument; (c) performance of recreational activities (including the organization of recreation sites, making fires, arranging ecological paths) outside the specially designated places; (d) activities entailing violation of the living conditions of flora and fauna objects; (e) collection of geological, botanical and zoological collections; (f) destruction and damage of notices, barriers, stands; (g) carrying out all types of felling, except for: cutting during the direct extinguishing of forest fires on the territory of the nature monument; felling authorized by the authorized body, carried out within the framework of sanitary and restoration arrangements, as well as in the process of application of fire safety measures in forests located on the territory of a nature monument; (h) blasting operations, performing work on geological exploration of subsoil for the development of mineral deposits; and (i) storage of fuels and lubricants, explosive substances, domestic and non-domestic waste.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Law No. 2.246 providing for production, trade, transport, storage and use of pesticides, their components and related stuff in the State of Amapá.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 28 articles, provides for production, trade, transport, storage and use of pesticides, their components and related stuff in the State of Amapá. The State Agricultural and Livestock Protection and Inspection Agency (DIAGRO) and the State Secretariat of Environment and Health are responsible for supervising the compliance with state legislation regarding pesticides, household sanitizer products, disinfectants, waste, their components and the similar stuff within the State of Amapá. The Law establishes that only pesticides and related products already registered with the competent federal agency will be accepted in state territory for storage, commercialization and use. The commercialization, use, consumption and storage in the territory of the State, of any agrochemicals or related products, is conditioned to the registration of the product in the DIAGRO. Registration with DIAGRO will be valid for one year, and will be automatically canceled upon expiration at the equivalent federal agency, and may be revalidated for equal and successive periods. Household sanitizer products should be governed by rules established by the State Department of Health. The importer, producer or applicator of pesticides, must submit to the President of DIAGRA specific documents.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring (ROSHYDROMET) and the Government of Nizhni Novgorod region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Nizhni Novgorod region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Nizhni Novgorod region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Nizhni Novgorod region.

Policy: Land (Conversion of Land) Rules, 2017 (S.I. No. 282 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Rules of the National Land Commission implement provisions of the Land Registration Act in respect of conversion of public land into private land. The national or county government may, on its own motion or upon a request, identify the land and notify the Commission, in Form LA I set out in the Schedule, of its intention to convert the land from one category to another pursuant to section 9 of the Act. The Commission shall consider the notification on specified criteria. For example, the land must not be part of an ecologically sensitive area. In the case of a substantial transaction, the Commission shall refer the matter to the National Assembly or County Assembly for approval as the case may be. Public land may also be converted to community land. The Commission shall satisfy itself that the land shall be used for the benefit of the community as provided under Article 63 of the Constitution.

Policy: Land (Allocation of Public Land) Regulations, 2017 (L.N. No. 284 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations of the National Land Commission implement provisions of the Land Act, 2012 in respect of allocation of public land under the Act. The National land Commission shall upon the request of the national or a county government, where necessary, allocate the whole or part of a specific public land by (a) public auction; (b) application confined to a targeted group of persons or groups; (c) public notice of tenders; (d) public drawing of lots; (e) public request for proposals; and (f) public land exchange of equal value. Each of these methods of allocation are regulate in detail. Allocation of land to a targeted group in order to ameliorate the group's disadvantaged position pursuant to section 12(l)(b) of the Act, requires vetting of such group and preparation of a report on the disadvantaged nature of the group and recommend allocation of the identified land to ameliorate the group's disadvantaged position. The Commission may, at the request of the National or County Government and after giving notice in accordance with the Act, invite the public for proposals for utilization or development of the land. The Commission shall - (a) satisfy itself that the land does not fall within any of the categories set out in section 12(2) of the Act; (b) where the allottee is a non-citizen' ensure that the approval of the Cabinet Secretary is obtained where the land is controlled land as defined in section 12A(1) of the Act; and (c) require that the land is planned, surveyed, geo-referenced and serviced

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el que aprueba la implementación y articulación de la Estrategia de Atención a la Pobreza en Costa Rica denominada “Puente al Desarrollo”, que implementa una metodología de atención integral basada en tres dimensiones que se interrelacionan entre sí: Protección social, Generación y desarrollo de capacidades, e Independencia económica. Habiéndose identificado brechas existentes entre la oferta educativa y laboral disponible en el mercado, y la demanda social que debería acceder a ella, por cuanto no todas las familias pertenecientes a la Estrategia poseen la formación mínima requerida según estándares de mercado para diversos puestos, se dispone que la dimensión sociolaboral constituya una prioridad en la intervención de las familias de la Estrategia y consecuentemente la correspondabilidad de las instituciones que atienden esta materia lideradas por el Ministerio de Trabajo y Seguridad Social.

Policy: Regulation on conditions and manner of leasing water land.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Water Law (Republika Srpska), prescribes the conditions, manner and procedure of leasing water land as part of public water resources aimed for use (also related fees and charges, see articles 11 and 12). Water land as a part of a public water resource may be subject of use through lease and only if such water land use will not have a negative impact on the resent water regime. Water land can be used by leasing for: 1) installation of temporary facilities; 2) construction of water facilities; 3) needs of agricultural production; 4) performing sports, cultural, recreational and tourist activities; 5) installation of advertising devices and objects; 6) laying of installation lines; 7) needs of seasonal tourism; 8) plantation cultivation of forest tree species.

Policy: Multi-sector Nutrition Plan 2018-2022.
Policy_Content: The Vision of the Multi-Sector Nutrition Plan-II (MSNP-II 2018–2022) is to reduce malnutrition so that it no longer impedes people’s potential and performance towards enhanced human capital and overall socioeconomic development. Its goal is to improve maternal, adolescent and child nutrition by scaling up essential nutrition-specific and sensitive interventions and creating an enabling environment for nutrition. The three objectives of the MSNP-II’s are: increase the number of service delivery institutions to improve access to and the use of nutrition-specific services; increase access to and the use of nutrition sensitive services including improving health-related behaviour; and improve policies, plans and multi-sectoral coordination at federal, provincial and local government levels to create an enabling environment to improve nutrition. Improving the nutritional status of its citizens is a major priority of the government. Improving nutrition involves interventions in health and other sectors; thus policies, strategies and plans of the health, agriculture, livestock, water and sanitation sectors emphasize good nutrition and food security. The government is addressing the complex causes of malnutrition through a multi-sectoral approach (pag. 3).

Policy: Law No. 236 amending Land Code of the Republic of Moldova.
Policy_Content: Article 38 (1) shall be amended to add the following wording: “Article 38 (1). The use of agricultural land for rural tourism (agro-tourism). Owners of agricultural land can place on these lands structures for the reception of tourists of the category of agrotouristic boarding house without changing the designation of the respective land. The aforesaid right can be realized if the owner of agricultural land is engaged in agricultural activities for at least five years". Article 99 shall be amended to add the following wording: “Article 99. Compensation of losses of agriculture and forestry. The losses of agriculture and forestry caused by withdrawal from agricultural and forestry production or allotment for temporary tenancy of agricultural and forest land for purposes not related to agriculture and forestry, as well as restriction of the rights of land owners, the deterioration of soil quality as a result of the negative impact of enterprises, institutions and organizations or their use not for their intended purpose, are reimbursed to the state budget or, as the case may be, to the budget of the corresponding administrative-territorial unit and shall be spent on restoration and development of lands or increase of their fertility. Compensation of these losses shall be performed along with compensation of claims. The specified losses are compensated in full according to the tariffs, established by the Law on the Normative Price and the Procedure for the Purchase of Land No. 1308/1997. Compensation of losses caused by withdrawal of land from categories of agricultural land and forest fund land, in all cases shall be performed by individuals and legal entities concerned regardless of the purpose of the withdrawal of land and the type of ownership thereof, with the exception of cases established by this law”.

Policy: Decision No. 1819/QD-TTg approving the Agriculture Restructuring Plan for the 2017-2020 period.
Policy_Content: The General objectives of this Plan aim to achieve the following goals: sustainable agricultural and rural development, raising added value, efficiency and competitiveness; improve farmers' life, contribute to poverty reduction, protect the environment and ecology and contribute to ensuring national security and defense. The Specific objectives till 2020 Agricultural aim to reach the following: GDP growth rate about 3%/year; the average growth rate of labour productivity 3.5%/year; the proportion of agricultural labour less than 40%; trained agricultural labour about 22%. Income of rural residents increased at least 1.8 times compared to 2015; 50% of communes will reach the new rural standard; 15,000 agricultural cooperatives and unions operate effectively; Most rural population has access to hygienic water. In addition, the Plan aims at effectively responding to climate change, protecting the ecological environment and reducing emissions in agricultural production at forest cover rates reaching 42%.

Policy: Decree No. 909 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On improvement of the functioning of the State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates the Statute of the State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes, defining its tasks, functions, rights, liability and organizational basis. State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes is the body that traces formation and development, as well as forecasting of natural and arising from the economic activities of dangerous exogenous geological processes (landslides, avalanches, subsidence, suffusion, karst erosion) on the territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan in order to alert state and economic management bodies, local administration and other organizations, as well as legal entities and individuals, of their possible disastrous manifestations for the purpose of decision-making and implementing measures for early warning of the population, protect inhabited areas and other sites from the impact of these processes. The State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes is integral part of the system of the State Committee for Geology and Mineral Resources (Goskomgeology) and is directly subordinated thereto. The orders of the State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes and its territorial subdivisions, issued within the limits of their competence, are binding for all state bodies and economic management bodies, local administration, legal entities and individuals. In case of failure to comply with the requirements of the State Monitoring Service of Dangerous Geological Processes and its territorial subdivisions, officials of the aforesaid bodies and legal entities, as well as individuals, shall be liable in accordance with the legislation.

Policy: Law No. 36/NA on Meteorology and Hydrology.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 69 articles divided into eleven Chapters, defines principles, rules, and measures on the management, monitoring and evaluation of meteorological and hydrological activities in order to ensure that the work in this field is expanded, modernized, effective and efficient. It aims to prevent and reduce the impacts of natural disasters on lives and properties of the state, public and individuals. Its purpose is also to ensure a timely and accurate data provision that can be integrated at a regional and international level, which will contribute to the national socio-economic growth in line with the green and sustainable development and national security. This law applies to domestic and international individuals, entities and organizations that reside in, and are actively involved in meteorological and hydrological activities in Lao PDR. The meteorological and hydrological strategy is the basic policy for the management, application, maintenance, development and evaluation of the forecasting and early warning activities. The meteorological and hydrological strategy consists of plans, programmes, projects and activities related to this work.

Policy: Cadre de Gestion Environnementale et Sociale (CGES).
Policy_Content: Le Cadre de Gestion Environnementale et Sociale (CGES) est un document élaboré par le Ministère de l’Agriculture, des Ressources Naturelles et du Développement rural (MARNDR) et le Ministère de l’Environnement (MDE) dans le cadre de l’exécution du projet Territoires Productifs Résilients (TPR). Son objectif principal est d’identifier les impacts associés aux différentes interventions du projet et de définir les mesures d’atténuation qui devront être mises en œuvre au cours de l’exécution de ses activités. Le CGES a donc pour objectifs spécifiques: a)  identifier l’ensemble des impacts potentiels au plan environnemental et social au regard des interventions envisagées dans le cadre du projet; b) produire un plan de gestion environnementale et social (PGES) pour chaque activité ayant un impact comprenant les activités pour supprimer ou atténuer les impacts environnementaux et sociaux; c) définir des dispositions de formation et accompagnement pour les agences d’exécution, autorités locales, intervenants, et autres parties prenantes; d)  définir en outre les dispositions institutionnelles de suivi et de surveillance à prendre avant, pendant et après la mise en œuvre du projet;  e) réaliser des séances de consultation et divulgation publique du CGES.

Policy: National Implementation Plan for the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants.
Policy_Content: This National Implementation Plan is a nationwide sectoral document developed by the National Environmental Protection Agency as partial fulfillment of its obligations under the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs) signed by Afghanistan in 2013. Main goal of the NIP is to protect human health and the environment from persistent organic pollutants. Main proposed measures are (i) eliminate or reduce the production and use of the chemicals listed in Stockholm Convention; (ii) draw attention to the range of risks which exposure to POPs poses and their impact on the health of the local population; (iii) take measures to prevent the release of POPs from waste and unintentional production from combustion; and (iv) increase the media involvement in public education about chemical pollution, health, and the environment to raise greater awareness about sustainable development and environmental management.

Policy: 5-year & 20-year National Development Plan 2017.
Policy_Content: The 20-Year Development Plan provides the forward-looking vision for “Transforming Fiji” towards an even more progressive, vibrant and inclusive society. It outlines a framework that encompasses strategic policy manoeuvres, new approaches to development and the aspirations of all Fijians. The Plan consists of two prongs or approaches, which are designated as: “Inclusive Socio-economic Development” and “Transformational Strategic Thrusts”. Inclusive Socio-economic Development will ensure that all socio-economic rights in the Constitution are realised. Inclusivity will be at the centre of growth and development, and the benefits of prosperity will be spread as widely as possible to improve the social well-being of all Fijians. No one will be left behind regardless of geographical location, gender, ethnicity, physical and intellectual capability and social and economic status. Transformational Strategic Thrusts are game changing forward-looking policy shifts to expand development frontier and support the vision of transforming Fiji. New and emerging growth sectors will be nurtured, connectivity within and to the outside world will be improved, new technologies will be embraced, productivity will be maximised, human capital development will be accelerated and green growth will be a key guiding principle in the implementation of this Plan.

Policy: National Irrigation Policy.
Policy_Content: This Irrigation Policy of Uganda is an elaboration of the National Adaptation Plan on Climate Change with a specific program designed to implement these plans for the agriculture sector. It will serve as the overarching instrument for regulation of irrigation development in the country and is part of the broader implementation of the National Climate Change Policy of 2015. Impact of climate change as a serious challenge as evidenced by prolonged droughts and severe flooding in most parts of the country requires a policy framework on irrigation as core public investment to mitigate these effects and prevent the agriculture sector from further loss. It is against this background that Government of Uganda through the Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Industry and Fisheries and the Ministry of Water and Environment and in consultation with other key stakeholders have jointly developed the National Irrigation Policy. This Policy is aimed at increasing efficient water use in irrigation and contributes to agricultural production and productivity. It is complementary to the National Water Policy and shall be implemented accordingly. It takes into consideration the objectives of, amongst others, the National Agricultural Policy, National Environment Management Policy, Wetland Management Policy, National Climate Change Policy, National Land Use Policy and National Cooperative Policy.

Policy_Content: En el marco del Sistema de la Integración Centroamericana (SICA) fue adoptada la presente Política de Agricultura Familiar campesina, indígena y afrodescendiente (PAFCIA), que constituye un instrumento estratégico para la toma de decisiones y para dar marco a los procesos de diálogo e incidencia política y técnica, así como para desarrollar y consolidar un modelo productivo diversificado, incluyente y territorializado. La PAFCIA, relativa al período 2018-2030, busca transitar hacia dicho modelo y fortalecer las organizaciones de la agricultura familiar a escala nacional y regional. La visión global de la política es que, al año 2030, la Agricultura Familiar Campesina, Indígena y Afrodescendiente esté posicionada en la región centroamericana como un modelo productivo diversificado, inclusivo y territorializado, así como con una sólida identidad gremial y territorial. Para alcanzar su visión y objetivos, la PACFIA se estructura en torno los siguientes ocho Ejes dinamizadores: 1) Integración de la gestión productiva y ambiental; 2) Gestión de conocimiento; 3) Soberanía y seguridad alimentaria y nutricional; 4) Servicios de soporte a la producción; 5) Mercados y comercialización; 6) Valor agregado a la producción; 7) Institucionalidad; 8) Economía social y solidaria.
