Policy: Order No. 352 of the State Committee of Industry, Energy and Subsoil Management validating the Regulation on registration of mineral reserves within the state balance and write-off thereof from the state balance.
Policy_Content: This Order sets forth terms and conditions for registration of mineral reserves within the state balance and write-off thereof from the state balance. Keeping state balance of mineral reserves shall be performed by the authorized state body in the sphere of subsoil management, which registers within and writes-off mineral reserves from the state balance. Registration of mineral reserves, modification and write-off thereof from the state balance shall be performed in accordance with geological exploration and mining outcome, the results of revaluation due to changes in the parameters of reserves calculation and assessment (standard limits, dimensions, capacity, and average mineral content). The state balance takes into account mineral reserves, including groundwater, therapeutic mud, brine, as well as minerals contained in mining wastes and related processing industries. The basis for registration mineral reserves within the state balance sheet is the positive conclusion of the state examination of mineral reserves, performed by the State Commission on Stocks. Mineral reserves are written off from the State balance sheet on the basis of the conclusions of the state expert examination of mineral reserves, based on the annual state reporting of subsoil users performing mining operations.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring (ROSHYDROMET) and the Government of Orel region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Orel region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Orel region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Orel region.

Policy: Presidential Resolution No. PP-3238 “On measures for further improvement of modern energy efficient and energy saving technologies”.
Policy_Content: In accordance with this Presidential Resolution, the joint-stock company "National Energy Saving Company" (JSC "NEC") shall be established and the following tasks shall be assigned thereto: (a) monitoring the effectiveness of energy consumption in government agencies and organizations; (b) elaboration of proposals related to the  introduction of modern energy-efficient and energy-saving technologies in state bodies and organizations; (c) introduction of modern energy-efficient and energy-saving technologies in state bodies and organizations; (d) optimization of expenses of state bodies and organizations, reduction of the cost of commodities (works, services), saving of budgetary and own funds due to introduction of energy saving technologies and reduction of energy costs; and (e) implementation of technical, technological, economic and other measures aimed at reducing the volume of consumed energy resources. JSC "NEC" shall be appointed the only supplier of commodities (works, services) related to the introduction of energy-efficient and energy-saving technologies on the basis of energy service agreements (contracts) in state bodies and organizations, the cost of which will be covered by the savings obtained as a result of introduction of such technologies. At the same time public authorities and organizations shall be prohibited to purchase commodities (works, services) that have a low level of energy efficiency, provided that similar goods with high energy efficiency are available.

Policy: National Cultural Heritage Preservation Act, 2017 (No. 40 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act sets forth the responsibilities and duties of the National Institute of Culture and History, National Heritage Advisory Council, the establishment of the National Heritage Fund, the preparation of the National Heritage Protection Plan, procedures and criteria for the designation and deaccession of heritage assets, and the establishment of the National Heritage Asset Register. The general functions of NICH under this Act shall be to promote and encourage the designation, protection, preservation, promotion and maintenance of heritage assets for the benefit and enjoyment of the present and future generations of the people of Belize and to ensure that the character of such assets is protected. The NICH shall take measures against the circumstances of misuse, lack of conservation, or application of wrong conservation methods. An inventory of heritage assets shall be established, updated, managed and published by the NICH. The National Heritage Advisory Council shall advise NICH generally on matters relating to heritage assets and shall exercise and discharge the functions conferred upon it by this Act. Furthermore, this Act sets forth provisions on procedures of registration of heritage assets, interim protection orders, acquisition for the promotion of cultural heritage or the preservation of the national or historical identity, compensation, as well as offences and penalties for damage to and destruction of heritage assets. The Minister responsible for culture may make regulations for the implementation of the provisions of this Act.

El EDUSS es el conjunto de lineamientos que orientan las intervenciones territoriales vinculadas a las acciones de rehabilitación y reconstrucción necesarias para atender a las zonas afectadas por la ocurrencia de lluvias y peligros asociados ocasionados por el Fenómeno El Niño Costero, así como en las áreas determinadas en el Plan Integral previsto en la Ley N° 30556, con el fin de promover la ocupación segura, ordenada, articulada y sostenible del territorio. A efectos de la aplicación del EDUSS, las acciones de reconstrucción involucran también las de construcción, en los casos en que así corresponda.

Policy: Resolution No. 605-r of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine validating Energy Strategy of Ukraine up to 2035 “Security, energy efficiency, competitiveness”.
Policy_Content: Energy Strategy of Ukraine (ESU) up to 2035 “Security, energy efficiency, competitiveness” is a policy document outlining strategic guidelines for the development of Ukraine's fuel and energy complex for the period up to 2035. Ukraine is and in the long term aims to remain one of the largest hydrocarbon producers in continental Europe and a reliable transit of energy resources (primarily natural gas and oil), ensuring safe and reliable supply of energy to its customers and consumers of related markets to be extracted and delivered with high level of environmental and social responsibility, with the efforts to comply with commitments to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Traditionally, the most requested in Ukraine are currently fossil fuels: natural gas and coal, which in total make up more than 60% of the domestic energy balance. The Energy Strategy envisages the completion of energy sector reform by 2025 to allow its integration with the energy sector of EU. Reducing the energy intensity of the economy, as well as diversifying sources and routes of energy supply, and increasing domestic production, will increase the economic, energy and environmental security, which will lead to optimization of the energy balance and will create a solid foundation for the country's sustainable energy future. The key quantitative and qualitative characteristic of the ESU is the overall primary energy supply structure. ESU shall be structured in three stages: (a) 1st stage regards reform of energy sector (completion by 2020); (b) 2nd stage regards optimization and innovation of energy sector infrastructure (completion by 2025); and (c) 3rd stage must ensure sustainable development (completion by 2035). The scope of ESU shall be to meet the demand of the society and economy in fuel and energy resources in a technically reliable, safe, cost-effective and ecofriendly was so as to guarantee the living conditions of the population. Strategic objective shall be to put a solid basis for the sustainable development of a competitive economy and an integral part of the European energy sector. Energy security, reliability and stability of fuel and energy sector envisages application of best practices in the sphere of environmental protection. The main directions of energy efficiency improvement of the Ukrainian economy should be as follows: (a) raising awareness of citizens related to energy saving, encouraging the use of household appliances and lighting with high energy efficiency indicators; (b) reduction of energy consumption of households, commercial and communal sectors for heating needs by increasing energy efficiency of residential and public buildings, as well as increasing energy efficiency of heating devices; (c) completeness and transparency of accounting for all forms of energy and energy resources; (d) increase of energy efficiency in the sector of production and transformation of energy, especially in heat power and district heating by optimizing the use of capacities, technical and technological modernization; (e) reduction of energy consumption in the systems of transportation and distribution of electric and thermal energy by technical, technological modernization and conceptual revision of power supply schemes, taking into account the achievements in the field of decentralized energy supply, in particular through the use of renewable energy sources (RES) and energy management; (f) assessment of the potential for optimization of the central heating system by switching to individual heating in the regions and at sites where it is economically feasible; (g) implementation at the national, city, budget and administrative buildings and enterprises of the energy management system. The implementation of structural changes will have a decisive impact on the energy efficiency of the economy as a whole. However, there is also a need for measures of general economic impact that require separate analysis within the framework of the economic strategy of the state.

Policy: Loi nº 39/2017 du 16/08/2017 portant création du Fonds National de l’Environnement et déterminant sa mission, son organisation et son fonctionnement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte création d’un Fonds National de l’Environnement (FONERWA), et détermine également sa mission, son organisation et son fonctionnement. FONERWA est chargée: mobiliser et gérer des fonds pour le financement des activités visant la protection et la préservation de l’environnement et des ressources naturelles; mobiliser des fonds à utiliser dans la lutte contre les changements climatiques et leurs effets; collecter et gérer les financements provenant des contributions publiques, privées, dans le cadre d’un partenariat bilatéral et multilatéral en vue d’atteindre les objectifs du pays visant à faire avancer les priorités nationales en matière d'environnement et des changements climatiques; appuyer les organes publics, les associations et les individus dans le but de la protection et la conservation de l’environnement ainsi que la recherche et la lutte contre les changements climatiques; coordonner et veiller à ce que les différents accords de partenariat de financement en rapport avec la prévention et à la lutte contre les changements climatiques soient clairement préparés et gérés efficacement entre les différents acteurs nationaux; collaborer avec d’autres institutions tant nationales, régionales qu’internationales ayant les mêmes objectifs.

Policy: Monitoring and Inspection of Economic Activities Law No.33/2017.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 19 articles aims at (i) organizing the system of monitoring and inspection of economic activities covering industrial, commercial, agricultural, tourism, craft, service, health and information technology activities; (ii) ensuring the effectiveness, efficiency and transparency of inspections by reducing the overlap and duplication of powers of the official authorities; and (iii) ensuring that best practices are followed in respect of all inspection procedures. At this end, a Higher Committee to develop the Inspection of Businesses is formed under the presidency of the Minister of Industry, Trade and Supply and the membership of relevant institutions (Ministry of Labour, Minsitry of Agriculture, Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Municipality Affairs, Ministry of Information and Communications Technology, Social Security Corporation, Jordan Food and Drug Administration, Jordan Standards and Metrology Organization, and Energy and Mineral Regulatory Commission) and representatives of the private sector. Main task of the Committee is to design inspection policies and to coordinate inspection efforts among concerned institutions. Article 6 clarifies for each individual Ministry and institution which control and monitoring tasks it will have. Controls consist of the following procedures (i) field visits; (ii) audit; (iii) evaluation; and (iv) taking samples and conducting tests.

Policy: Order No. 458 of the Ministry of Agrarian Policy and Food validating the Regulation on fishery seaport captain.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the modalities of operation of fishery seaport captain in relation to supervision over and ensuring of safe navigation within the boundaries of fishery seaport and adjacent defined water areas. Fishery seaport captain shall be responsible also for enforcement of legislation related to prevention of sea pollution from ships. Orders issued by fishery seaport captain shall be mandatory for all vessels, legal persons and natural persons-entrepreneurs staying within defined water area and on the territory of fishery seaport. Fishery seaport captain shall perform the following functions: (a) supervision over enforcement of legislation, regulations and international agreements of Ukraine; (b) control of vessel documents; (c) supervision over compliance with the arrangements of entry to and exit from fishery seaport of vessels; (d) supervision over compliance with rules and regulations for the prevention of environmental pollution; (e) regulation of navigation of vessels within the territory of fishery seaport; (f) registration of vessels; (g) supervision over vessel piloting and regulation of movement of vessels; and (h) registration and investigation of accidents at sea within the territory of fishery seaport.

Policy: Ley Nº 30645 - Modifica la Ley Nº 29869, Ley de reasentamiento poblacional para zonas de muy alto riesgo no mitigable.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley modifica la Ley de reasentamiento poblacional para zonas de muy alto riesgo no mitigable, en lo relacionado con el reasentamiento oportuno de titulares y ocupantes de predios que se encuentren ubicados en “zona de riesgo recurrente por deslizamientos, huaicos y desbordes de ríos”. Donde por zona de riesgo recurrente, se entiende aquella donde existe la probabilidad de que la población o sus medios de vida sufran daños en forma recurrente, como consecuencia de los constantes deslizamientos, huaicos y desbordes de ríos, entre otros. Dicha zona aunque es mitigable en el corto plazo, debido a la recurrencia del desastre natural, resulta de mayor costo y complejidad que llevar a cabo solamente la reubicación de las viviendas y equipamiento urbano respectivo. El riesgo se evalúa en función del peligro, la vulnerabilidad y recurrencia.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 022-2017-EM - Medidas para reglamentar la Ley Nº 30543, que elimina el cobro de afianzamiento de seguridad energética que viene afectando el costo del servicio eléctrico y ordena la devolución de dicho importe a los usuarios del servicio energético.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba medidas para reglamentar la Ley que elimina el cobro de afianzamiento de seguridad energética que viene afectando el costo del servicio eléctrico y ordena la devolución de dicho importe a los usuarios del servicio energético. El cargo tarifario del Cargo por Afianzamiento de la Seguridad Energética (CASE), del Cargo Tarifario al Sistema de Seguridad Energética en Hidrocarburos (Cargo Tarifario SISE) y de la Tarifa Regulada de Seguridad (TRS), que fueron recaudados por las empresas de electricidad e hidrocarburos son devueltos a los usuarios finales. Para efectos de dicha devolución, se considerará cualquier comprobante de pago por los servicios de electricidad o hidrocarburos, en el cual se haya consignado o cargado alguno de los conceptos señalados en el párrafo precedente. Los montos pagados por los generadores eléctricos por concepto del cargo TRS, los cuales les fueron compensados a través de la recaudación del CASEge, son devueltos a los usuarios finales que pagaron el CASEge, empleándose para ello los fondos de la recaudación de la TRS.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 303-a constituting protected area of regional significance state nature reserves “Spas” and “Shunga”.
Policy_Content: Protected area of regional significance state nature reserves “Spas” is constituted with a view of conservation of water-protecting ecosystems Gorky reservoir, which are the habitat of waterfowl and semi-aquatic avifauna, hare, rare and protected wild fauna and wild flora species, maintaining biological diversity. Nature reserve “Spas” performs the following tasks: (a) conservation of habitats and ensuring the reproduction of the brown hare; (b) conservation of habitats for aquatic and semi-aquatic bird species; (c) protection of forest, meadow and marsh ecosystems that perform a water protection function for Gorky reservoir; (d) conservation of old-growth oak forests as rare for the area of ecosystems located in the northern boundary of the range; (e) protection of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (f) maintaining a high resource potential in terms of the attractiveness of the territory for recreation; and (g) preservation of the polygon of scientific research on the processes of change and the dynamics of the development of plant cover in conditions of artificial flooding of the territory, the impact of reclamation on landscape condition. Nature reserve “Spas” is classified as complex (landscape). The following activities are authorized on the territory of nature reserve “Spas”: (a) hunting (with the exception of hare hunting) in compliance with the established rules and modalities of hunting; (b) selective felling; (c) reforestation; (d) scientific research; (e) ecological tourism; (f) educational activities; (g) picking mushrooms and berries; (h) recreational fishing without the use of nets; and (i) conducting agricultural work on agricultural land. Protected area of regional significance state nature reserves “Shunga” is constituted with a view of conservation with a view of conservation of water-protecting ecosystems Gorky reservoir, which are the habitat of waterfowl and semi-aquatic avifauna, hare, rare and protected wild fauna and wild flora species, maintaining biological diversity. Nature reserve “Shunga” performs the following tasks: (a) conservation of important bird areas; (b) conservation of rare and endangered aquatic and semi-aquatic bird species listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the regional Red Book; (c) protection of mass stopping of migratory species; and (d) landscape of the lacustrine-glacial-alluvial plain in the flood zone. Nature reserve “Shunga” is classified as biological (ornithological). The following activities are authorized on the territory of nature reserve “Shunga”: (a) carrying out agricultural work; (b) reconstruction and repair of the existing drainage system, including clearing and dredging of river beds in accordance with the approved project documentation; (c) recreation (except for the period from April 15 to June 1); and (d) scientific activities and environmental education activities that do not lead to the application of damage to objects of special protection.

Policy: Rangitāne Tū Mai Rā (Wairarapa Tamaki nui-ā-Rua) Claims Settlement Act 2017 (No. 38 of 2017).

Part 1 sets out a summary of the historical account, and records the text of the acknowledgements and apology given by the Crown to Rangitāne o Wairarapa and Rangitāne o Tamaki nui-ā-Rua, as recorded in the deed of settlement; defines terms used in this Act, including key terms such as Rangitāne o Wairarapa and Rangitāne o Tamaki nui-ā-Rua and historical claims; provides that the settlement of the historical claims is final; provides for the effect of the settlement of the historical claims on the jurisdiction of a court, tribunal, or other judicial body in respect of the historical claims; and a consequential amendment to the Treaty of Waitangi Act 1975, etc.

Policy: Order No. 447 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the national park “Zyuratkul”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the national park “Zyuratkul” is constituted with a view of conservation of the unique natural complex of the South Urals, creating conditions for the development of organized recreation of citizens and improving the environmental situation in the Chelyabinsk region. The national park "Zyuratkul" is located in the Satkinsky municipal district of the Chelyabinsk region and the managing body shall be Federal state budgetary institution the national park “Zyuratkul”. The national park shall perform the following main tasks: (a) preservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) preservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (e) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (f) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of the national park: 1) commercial; 2) industrial fisheries; 3) effluent waste water discharge; 4) stay with hunting gear; 5) exploration and extraction of minerals; 6) disturbance of the soil cover; 7) modification of hydrological regime; 8) collection of soft resin; 9) felling of forest plantations; 10) timber extraction and harvesting of edible non-timber products; 11) passage and grazing of domestic animals; 12) organization of mass sport and recreational events; 13) ploughing of land; 14) washing of motor vehicles on the banks of watercourses; 15) construction, reconstruction and overhaul of capital construction facilities; 16) blasting operations; 17) making fires and burning of vegetation, except for cases coordinated with the administration of the national park; 18) water logging; 19) allotment of land for individual housing construction and gardening; 20) introduction of alien species for acclimatization; 21) use and storage of pesticides, mineral fertilizers and chemical plant protection means and growth stimulants; 22) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; 23) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical collections, except for performance of scientific research activities by the staff of the national park; 24) stay with dogs (except for patrol dogs used to protect natural complexes and objects), keeping dogs without leashes, outside dog kennels or other structures that limit their movement zone, training of dogs; 25) the flight of aircraft at the altitude less than 500 meters above the territory of the national park without prior authorization by the administration of the national park “Zyuratkul”; 26) destruction and damage to the name plates, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs and indications, organized ecological paths and resting places; and 27) disturbance of wild animals, as well as their feeding by visitors.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Order No. 312 of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources validating the Regulation on State ecological inspection and Marine ecological inspections.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that State ecological inspection shall perform state supervision (control) over compliance by territorial bodies of central executive authorities, local executive authorities, local self-government bodies in terms of exercising the powers delegated to them by executive authorities, enterprises, institutions and organizations irrespective of the form of ownership and management, citizens of Ukraine, foreigners and stateless persons, as well as legal entities - non-residents with the legislative requirements in the following fields: (a) environmental security and radiation safety; (b) land and subsoil protection; (c) protection, rational management and reproduction of water resources; (d) protection of atmospheric air; (e) protection of forests; and (f) protection and rational management of wild fauna, including fishery management and hunting. Marine ecological inspection shall be public competent authority for the Sea of Azov and the Black Sea and it shall perform control of: (a) all national and foreign vessels, marine facilities and infrastructure irrespectively of the form of ownership, located in internal sea, territorial sea and EEZ of Ukraine; and (b) seaports and harbour facilities. The scope of control shall be prevention of negative impact on marine environment.

Policy: Estrategia Nacional para REDD+ 2017-2030 (ENAREDD+).
Policy_Content: La Estrategia Nacional para REDD+ 2017-2030 (ENAREDD+), Estrategia Nacional de Reducción de Emisiones por Deforestación y Degradación de los Bosques, que tiene como objetivos lograr disminuir la emisión de gases de efecto invernadero ocasionada por la deforestación y degradación, así como el manejo forestal sustentable y la conservación e incremento de los acervos de carbono forestal, a través del manejo integral del territorio con un enfoque de desarrollo rural sustentable. Para este propósito la ENAREDD+ establece líneas de acción y promueve actividades productivas y de conservación y el manejo de los recursos forestales, que se sustentan en el Programa Nacional Forestal (PRONAFOR). Por lo tanto, La ENAREDD+ debe entenderse como un conjunto de líneas estratégicas que promueven, de manera simultánea, acciones de mitigación y adaptación al cambio climático a través de un manejo integral del territorio que propicie el desarrollo rural sustentable bajo en carbono y, por tanto, apunte a una convergencia de la agenda ambiental y de desarrollo, siendo su campo de aplicación en los paisajes rurales con actividades forestales.

Policy: Report on Nationally Defined Contributions (NDC) to climate change.
Policy_Content: In order to combat the impacts of climate change, with their severe implications for the economy, the State of Palestine developed its Nationally Defined Contributions (NDC) in accordance with the UNFCCC’s commitments. Main interventions included in this nationwide sectoral document are directed to improvements in the State’s energy security, with a reduced dependence on imported electricity and increased energy reserves through development and exploitation of the Gaza Strip’s gas field. The NDC proposes two kinds of actions (i) mitigation contribution; and (ii) adaptation. As for the mitigation contribution, the Government provides for two possible scenarios: an independence and a status quo scenario. Furthermore these measures are divided according to two different interventions by the international community: they can be either conditional on the receiving of international support or actions to be implemented unconditionally. The latter are (i) sustainable urban demonstration projects, including mostly public buildings; (ii) afforestation projects; (iii) greening projects; and (iv) interventions for range land development, improvement and rehabilitation. While the interventions conditioned by international support are (i) solar photo-voltaic; (ii) energy efficiency in buildings; (iii) use of waste for cement production; (iv) use of waste for electricity generation; (v) reduction of methane from landfill; (vi) energy efficient lighting; (vii) hybrid electric vehicles and compressed natural gas powered vehicles; and (viii) afforestation.

Policy: Nationally Determined Contributions.
Policy_Content: This Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) is a nationwide multi-sectoral document aiming at achieving a number of national development and policy objectives as well reflecting the country's vision for climate action. These include (i) improvements in the State’s energy security, with a reduced dependence on imported electricity from Israel; (ii) increased energy reserves through development and exploitation of the Gaza Strip’s gas field; (iii) improvements in the Palestinians' living conditions, health and environment, through better air quality, less unmanaged waste, increased food production and increased water resources are also important co-benefits. Palestine intends to reduce its CO2eq emissions by 2040 according to two possible scenarios (1) independence scenario and (2) status quo scenario. In the first case, the reduction will reach 24.4% relative to business-as-usual, in the second, instead, 12.8% relative to BAU. The document includes both mitigation and adaptation actions. As for the mitigation measures they regard the following sectors (i) Energy; (ii) Waste; (iii) Transport; (iv) Forestry. As for the adaptation measures, they are provided for the following sectors (i) Agriculture; (ii) Coastal and Marine; (iii) Energy; (iv) Food; (v) Gender; (vi) Health; (vii) Industry; (viii) Terrestrial ecosystem; (ix) Tourism; (x) Urban and Infrastructure; (xi) Waste and wastewater; (xii) Water.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 182/17 approving the Regulation of Agricultural Cooperatives.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree approves the Regulation of Agricultural Cooperatives. This Regulation, consisting of 36 articles divided into seven Chapters, regulates agricultural cooperatives, in particular as regards their constitution, services provided, criteria for access to subsidies, tax and financial benefits, dispute settlement and procedures in the application of penalties. This Presidential Decree applies to first-degree and higher-level agricultural cooperatives. Cooperatives in the agricultural sector are guided by the following objectives: a) Promote the rational use and valorization of the agricultural exploitation; b) Contribute to the technical and economic development of agricultural exploitation; e) Contribute to the interests protection of its members; d) Promote education, technical and professional training of its members; e) Contribute to the economic, social and cultural development of the communities; j) Promote and support the marketing of agricultural products of its members; g) Stimulate products processing industries; h) Disseminate technical, economic, juridical and environmental information; i) Encourage safety control on the quality of agricultural products; etc.

Policy: Arrêté conjoint n°2017-144/MAAH/MINEFID portant fixation des taxes sur les produits soumis à l’inspection phytosanitaire et autres services susceptibles d'être dispensés par la Direction de la Protection des Végétaux et du Conditionnement
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté porte fixation des taxes sur les produits soumis à l’inspection phytosanitaire et autres services susceptibles d'être dispensés par la Direction de la Protection des Végétaux et du Conditionnement. Il sera perçu des taxes d'inspection pour tous les végétaux, produits végétaux et autres articles réglementés destinés à l'exportation ou à l'importation et au transit et à 1' intérieur du territoire national après établissement des Certificats Phytosanitaires, certificat phytosanitaire de réexportation. Permis d'importation, Procès-Verbal d'Inspection phytosanitaire, certificats divers. Les frais d'inspection phytosanitaire concernent les tranches sont énumérées par l’arrêté. Les autres services susceptibles d'être dispensés par la Direction de la Protection des Végétaux et du Conditionnement s'établissent comme suit : Traitements phytosanitaires - désinfection / désinfestation de denrées agricoles, des semences, de végétaux ou parties de végétaux; désinfection des sols, désinsectisation de magasins ou locaux de stockage ; travaux de laboratoire - identification d'insectes, recherche de pathogènes ; et exécution des travaux rendus obligatoires par la législation et effectués par la Direction de la Protection des Végétaux et du Conditionnement : destruction de végétaux ou produits végétaux et matières végétales parasites impropre à la consommation.

Policy: Ley Nº 5875 – Ley Nacional de Cambio Climático.
Policy_Content: Esta Ley establece el marco normativo para planificar y responder de manera urgente, adecuada, coordinada y sostenida a los impactos del cambio climático. El objetivo primordial es reducir la vulnerabilidad y mejorar las capacidades de adaptación y mitigación de los efectos del cambio climático producido por las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero La Ley prevé la elaboracin de un Plan Nacional de Cambio Climático y su vinculación con el Plan Nacional de Desarrollo. Asimismo, se establecen la Comisión Nacional de Cambio Climático y la Dirección Nacional de Cambio Climático.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Americas, Landlocked Developing Countries, Latin America and the Caribbean, LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO, South America

Policy: Presidential Resolution No. PP-3190 “On measures for improvement of scientific research in the field of seismology, seismic resistant construction and seismic safety of the population and territory.
Policy_Content: The President, in order to improve the effectiveness of the system for preventing and eliminating the consequences of emergencies, implementing targeted measures to protect the population and territories from seismic risks, creating conditions for conducting research in the field of seismology and earthquake-proof construction in line with modern requirements, strengthening the material and technical base of the network of stations tracking the stress-strain state of the earth's crust, assessing the seismic hazard and the forecast of earthquakes, decrees to validate a set of arrangements for further improvement of effectiveness of scientific research in the field of seismology, seismic resistant construction and seismic safety of the population and territory (Annex 1).  Interdepartmental Scientific and Technical Council on seismology, earthquake-proof construction and seismic safety of the population and territory shall be set up for the performance of the following tasks: (a) formation and coordination of the main directions of scientific research in the field of seismology, seismic construction and seismic safety; (b) organization of scientific and technical expertise of scientific projects and their results in the field of seismology and earthquake-proof construction; (c) creation of favorable conditions for effective integration of science, education and production; (d) assistance in the introduction into practice of the results of new scientific research and innovative developments on the basis of contracts with the national organizations; (e) support of scientists, including young scientists, who have achieved high scientific results and made a worthy contribution to the development of science; (f) assistance in attracting charitable donations for the material and technical support of research institutions dealing with issues of seismology, seismic resistant construction and seismic safety of the population and the territory.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Disasters,Research,Early warning system/emergency intervention system,Risk assessment/management
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Decree No. 606 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Emergency Situations, the Regulation on Center of Hydrometeorological Service subordinated to the Ministry of Emergency Situations and the Regulation on the State Inspectorate for Control and Supervision of technical condition and safety of large and strategically important waterworks subordinated to the Ministry of Emergency Situations.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the Ministry of Emergency Situations (Annex 1) determines its status, main tasks, functions, rights and liability. The Ministry is a public administration body in the field of prevention and liquidation of emergency situations of natural and man-made nature, civil protection, hydrometeorology, sustainable operation of waterworks, seismic observations, and safe operation of small vessels, protection of life and health of citizens in waterbodies. The Ministry shall be responsible for timely risk assessment of natural disasters and emergencies, early prevention thereof, complex assistance to the population and early warning of the existing risks, complex monitoring and forecast of risks of hydrometeorological and seismic disasters. Regulation on Center of Hydrometeorological Service determines its status, main tasks, functions, rights and liability. It is a body of public administration authorized to perform tasks in the sphere of hydrometeorology and, in particular: (a) development and improvement of the state system of hydrometeorological observations; (b) provision of public bodies and population with information related to hydrometeorological conditions, climate change and environmental pollution levels; and (c) fundamental and applied research. Regulation on the State Inspectorate for Control and Supervision of technical condition and safety of large and strategically important waterworks determines its status, main tasks, functions, rights and liability. It is public body authorized to perform supervision over safety of waterworks, performing the following tasks: (a) implementation of state control and supervision over the reliability of the technical state of operation and ensuring the safety of large and particularly important waterworks; (b) design, construction, commissioning, operation, reconstruction, repair, conservation and liquidation of large and particularly important waterworks, including the organization of project evaluation, quality control of construction, reconstruction, commissioning, conservation and liquidation; and (c) organization of reliable protection of large and particularly important waterworks.

Policy: Decree on technical requirements for constructions which fulfill forest functions.
Policy_Content: This Decree of the Ministry of Agriculture, which is composed of ten articles, lays down technical requirements for constructions which fulfill forest functions such as the construction of forest roads, construction of other routes for forest transport, and structures for water treatment of forest soils. The route of the forest road is designed in particular to: (a) make access to the largest possible area of the forest; b) meet requirements of proper forest management and forest protection; (c) minimize disruption of the spatial arrangement and stability of forest stands; (d) ensure uniform, smooth and safe driving. Construction requirements for the modification of the water regime of forest soil are set out in art. 5.

Policy: Regional Law No. 157-KZ “On protection of the atmospheric air”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the field of protection of the atmospheric air and is aimed at ensuring the constitutional rights of citizens to a favorable environment and access to reliable information on its condition. Additional environmental requirements for atmospheric air shall be intended mandatory conditions, restrictions or a combination of these, established by the regional regulatory legal acts to ensure protection of the atmospheric air applicable to legal entities and individual entrepreneurs, performing economic and other activities and owning sources of emissions of hazardous (polluting) substances in atmospheric air. Regional administration has the right to apply additional environmental requirements for protection of the atmospheric air, taking into account the results of the state monitoring of atmospheric air. In periods of adverse weather conditions authorized regional executive bodies in the field of atmospheric air protection and local government shall organizing emission control work. In order to monitor air pollution, integrated assessment and forecast of its condition, as well as the provision of state authorities, local government, organizations and the population with the current and emergency information on air pollution, authorized regional state body in the field of atmospheric air protection participates in the organization of state monitoring atmospheric air and within its competence ensures its implementation on the regional territory.

Policy: Resolución 190-E/2017 - Créase el Programa de Fomento de la Bioeconomía.
Policy_Content: Por la presente Resolución se crea el Programa de Fomento de la Bioeconomía. Se entiende por bioeconomía el conjunto de actividades económicas que utilizan recursos, procesos y principios biológicos para la producción sostenible de todo tipo de bienes y servicios. El objetivo del Programa es fomentar el desarrollo de la bioeconomía como estrategia para la agregación de valor, una mayor eficiencia en el uso de los recursos y el desarrollo territorial en forma sustentable y sostenible. Entre las acciones a ejecutar se contempla brindar apoyo para el desarrollo competitivo a productores agropecuarios y a la agroindustria en general, para la producción y uso de biomasa (bioinsumos, biomateriales, bioproductos), por intermedio de Asociaciones de Productores Agropecuarios, Cooperativas Agropecuarias, Organizaciones No Gubernamentales, Ministerios de Agricultura Provinciales o sus equivalentes, Municipalidades y todo organismo e Institución vinculado con la agroindustria.

Policy: Law No. 15/17 on Local Government establishing the bases of the organization system, functioning and implementation of local authorities, and institutions of traditional rights and other specific modalities of participation.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 44 articles divided into three Chapters, regulates the Local Government and establishes the bases of the organization system, functioning and implementation of local authorities, institutions of traditional power and other specific modalities of participation, according to art. 164 of the Constitution of the Republic of Angola. It establishes autonomous organs of the Local Government, representation of the State and specifies the gradual and transitory principles between the Local State Administration and the Local Authorities. The powers of the local authorities, of traditional rights and the other specific modalities of participation of the citizens established by law, uphold the following principles: a) Unitary State; b) Local Autonomy; c) Political-Administrative Decentralization; d) Administrative Delegation; e) Constitutionality and Legality; f) Recognition of Habits; g) Subsidiarity; h) Complementarity; i) Pursuit of Public Interest and Protection of the Rights and Interests of Individuals; j) Solidarity and Cooperation; k) Intangibility of Tasks of General Interest; l) Equality; m) Proportionality; n) Previous Hearing; o) Citizen participation; p) Specialty; q) Financial and Patrimonial Autonomy; r) Administrative Care. Chapter II specifies Organizational Forms and Nature of Local Government.

Policy: Ethiopia Commodity Exchange Establishment (Amendment) Proclamation No. 1050/2017.
Policy_Content: This Proclamation amends the Ethiopia Commodity Exchange Establishment Proclamation of 2007 so as to strengthen the way the Commodity Exchange receives and trades agricultural products and to make those products competitive to foreign market. The Ministry of Trade shall be the supervising authority of the Exchange. Mandatory criteria for condition of transport of exchange-traded commodities shall be established. Detailed conditions under which non-members of the Exchange may buy or sell their own commodities at the Exchange platform without intermediary shall be determined in the rules of the Exchange. It shall be prohibited to trade a commodity on the Exchange without the issuance of an exchange product certificate as to the product quality or grade and of an Exchange warehouse receipt as to the product origin, quantity, condition, and location of warehouse or bonded yard . The Exchange may establish a trading system that ensures the identity of the owner or supplier and traceability of commodities.

Policy: Environment Protection (Compounding of Offences) Regulations, 2017 (S.I. No. 45 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under the Environment Protection, 2016 by the Minister responsible for Environment, Energy and Climate Change, allows the  Minister, in consultation with the Attorney General, to compound an offence punishable with fine, except an offence under section 36 or 37 under the Act. The Minister shall, on receiving advice from the Attorney General, fix the penalty and notify to the concerned person. A person who receives the notice under regulation 3 may either pay the penalty fixed for the offence or inform the Minister of his or her refusal to accept the penalty. In the event of non-acceptance of the penalty or non-payment of the penalty within two months, prosecution proceedings shall be initiated against the person.

Policy: Decreto Nº 48-2017-PCM ─ Crea la Secretaría de Estado en el Despacho de Energía (SEN).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea la Secretaría de Estado en el Despacho de Energía (SEN), adscrita al Gabinete Sectorial de Desarrollo Económico. La SEN es la Institución Rectora del sector energético nacional y de la integración energética regional e internacional, y está encargada de proponer al Consejo Nacional de Energía la Estrategia Energética Nacional y las políticas relacionadas con el desarrollo integral y sostenible del sector energético. Asimismo está a cargo de la formulación, planificación, coordinación, ejecución, seguimiento y evaluación de las estrategias y políticas del sector energético, el cual, entre otras materias, comprende pero no se limita a los siguientes aspectos: 1) El aprovechamiento racional de los recursos naturales para la explotación y desarrollo sostenible de las fuentes renovables de energía; 2) Los sistemas de transformación, producción, transmisión, distribución y abastecimiento de energía eléctrica para la prestación de servicio público, y demás aspectos que promuevan la eficiencia económica, competitividad, modernización y desarrollo del subsector electricidad; 3) La exploración y explotación de los yacimientos de hidrocarburos sólidos, líquidos y gaseosos; 4) La regulación, control y supervisión de las actividades detransformación,almacenamiento,transporte, distribución, comercialización y abastecimiento de combustibles derivados de petróleo, biocombustibles o portadores energéticos; 5) La planificación energética de corto, mediano y largo plazo del país alineada a la política energética nacional en el marco de un Plan de Nación y Visión de País; 6) Las estrategias para incrementar y garantizar el acceso a las fuentes o servicios de energía a toda la población como un habilitador del desarrollo socioeconómico; 7) El procesamiento de los datos estadísticos y elaboración de indicadores energéticos del país; 8) Las políticas relacionadas con el uso racional y eficiente de los recursos energéticos; 9) Las concesiones, autorizaciones, permisos en materia energética conforme a normas técnicas, legales aplicables; 10) El cumplimiento de la normativa sobre aspectos sociales y ambientales relacionados con la protección de los recursos naturales y del ambiente en las actividades energéticas, indicados por la autoridad ambiental competente; 11) La promoción de estudios de investigación científica y desarrollo tecnológico en materia de energía en colaboración con instituciones educativas u otros organismos nacionales o extranjeros; 12) La promoción y establecimiento de convenios o tratados internacionales en materia de energía y la representación oficial en organismos, conferencias y eventos nacionales e internacionales sobre la materia energética; 13) La promoción y administración de la legislación sobre exploración, explotación, distribución, protección, manejo y procesamiento de los recursos naturales relacionados con el área de su competencia, así como velar por su cumplimiento; 14) La emisión, administración y seguimiento de un marco normativo para un sistema energético eficiente y moderno; 15) La colaboración en forma consultiva con todos los actores del sector energético nacional; 16) Participar en el Consejo Nacional de Energía y en otros organismos nacionales sobre la materia; 17) La regulación, control y supervisión de la actividad nuclear, manejo de fuentes radioactivas, energía nuclear, la seguridad de instalaciones y la protección radiológica.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decreto Nº 40616-MINAE ─ Crea el Consejo Consultivo Ciudadano de Cambio Climático (5C).
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Consejo Consultivo Ciudadano de Cambio Climático (5C), como una plataforma de participación ciudadana que se enmarca en la política nacional de gobierno abierto, con la que se procura reforzar los mecanismos de rendición de cuentas, de disposición y acceso a la información. Policy: Merchant Shipping (Monitoring, Reporting and Verification of Carbon Dioxide Emissions) and the Port State Control (Amendment) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 825 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Regulation (EU) No. 2015/757 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the monitoring, reporting and verification of carbon dioxide emissions from maritime transport and amending Directive 2009/16/EC. The EU Regulation creates a mechanism for monitoring and reporting carbon dioxide emissions from ships and for reporting other information at national and European Union level. Compliance with the Regulation is to be demonstrated by a document of compliance which must be carried on board the ship. These Regulations create a requirement for a ship entering or leaving a UK port to carry a valid document of compliance, the failure to produce the document of compliance is a criminal offence and the ship may be detained. The Regulations also amend the Merchant Shipping (Port State Control Regulations) 2011 to make it a requirement for an inspection under those regulations to include a check that the ship is carrying a document of compliance; this will apply to inspections carried out on and after 30th June 2019.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-5134 “On measures to radically improve activities of the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Resources”.
Policy_Content: The President, in order to ensure integrated modernization and sustainable development of agriculture, the introduction of the organizational structure of managing agricultural production in accordance with modern requirements, and the radical improvement of the activities of the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Resources of the Republic of Uzbekistan, decrees to assign the following tasks to the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Resources: (a) implementation of the unified agrotechnical and water management policy through introduction of the advanced resource- and water-saving technologies; (b) development of integrated targeted, sectoral and territorial programs, aimed at ensuring a dynamic and balanced development of rural economy, food security of the country, increasing employment and income of the rural population, maintaining a stable level of prices for food products on the domestic market; and (c) improvement of water management principles and systems, ensuring their careful and rational use, improvement of land reclamation state of irrigated lands, reconstruction and modernization of waterworks.

Policy: Presidential Resolution No. PP-3172 “On measures for further improvement of the operation of the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Management”.
Policy_Content: The President, for the purpose of ensuring more efficient functioning of the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Management, decrees to validate organizational structure of the Ministry (Annex 1), structure of the central office of the Ministry (Annex 2), structure of the regional Ministry of Karakalpakstan (Annex 3); model structure of the territorial bodies of the Ministry (Annex 4); model structure of the district body of the Ministry (Annexes 5 and 5a); the list of organizations that are part of public water management institution (Annex 6); the list of organizations that are the part of basin irrigation institutions (Annex 7); the list of reorganized or abolished organizations of the Ministry (Annex 8) and the list of construction and reconstruction organizations operating on waterbodies (Annex 9). The President establishes that decisions of the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Management adopted within the limits of its authority shall be mandatory for execution by state and economic management bodies, local administration, and economic entities, regardless of ownership and departmental subordination, and citizens. The regional Ministry of Agriculture and Water Management of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, the regional departments of agriculture and water management, the district departments of agriculture and water management shall be accountable, respectively, to the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, regional executive bodies, districts and the Ministry of Agriculture and Water Resources of the Republic of Uzbekistan.

Policy: Order No. 71 of the Agency of Land Relations and Cadastre validating the Regulation on the content and elaboration of the documentation for the formation of real estate objects.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the content and elaboration of the documentation for the formation of real estate objects regulates the content and method of developing cadastral documentation for the formation of land plots irrespective of their specific uses, the absence or presence of constructions thereon, the formation of buildings and isolated premises, regardless of the type of property, as well as the formation of land plots of public property. It shall be mandatory for persons performing cadastral work and for professionals who have the authority to approve, accept and register in the register of real estate. As a result of the formation of land plots, a working report is prepared, which must be submitted to the Public Services Agency. The content of cadastral documentation when performing work on the formation of real estate shall be as follows: (a) statement about the formation of the object; (b) research on the possibility of forming an object; (c) project of formation; (d) geometrical plan of the formed objects; and (e) decision on the formation.

Policy: Order No. 70 of the Agency of Land Relations and Cadastre validating the Regulation on the performance of cadastral work at the ground level.
Policy_Content: Regulation on the performance of cadastral work at the ground level determines the content and order of cadastral work for primary registration/renovation of land boundaries, as well as other types of work. It is mandatory for persons performing cadastral work, and for persons who are competent to receive, approve, and register real estate objects. Cadastral work shall be performed for the following purposes: (a) primary registration of land plots; (b) for updating cadastral plans of land (by changing the boundary of the site); (c) representation on the cadastral plan of a part of the land plot; (d) preparation of cadastral documentation for perennial plantations; (e) restoration/transfer of boundaries of land plots; and (f) the final systematization of land management projects. The execution of cadastral work includes the following stages: (a) preparatory work; (b) the establishment of boundaries and the performance of ground-based measurements; (c) data processing, compilation and approval of a geometric plan; (d) compilation of a cadastral work report; (e) acceptance of cadastral work; and (f) issuance of cadastral documentation to the owner. The applicant is given one copy of the report of works and/or special documentation, depending on the purpose of cadastral work.

Policy: Wildlife Conservation and Management (Protection of Endangered and Threatened Ecosystems, Habitats and Species) Regulations, 2017 (L.N. No. 242 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Cabinet Secretary for Environment and Natural Resources under section 116 (2) (f) of the Wildlife Conservation and Management Act, 2013, concern  the protection of endangered and threatened ecosystems, habitats and species in Kenya. They, among other things: divide ecosystems, habitats and species into categories (critically endangered, endangered, vulnerable, protected; and threatened); provide for protection of ecosystems that are threatened or endangered so as to maintain their ecological integrity; provide for the protection of species that are threatened, endangered, vulnerable, or protected to ensure their survival in the wild; implement Kenya's obligations under international agreements regulating international trade in endangered species; and ensure sustainable management and utilisation of biodiversity. The Regulations specify measures to be implemented and prohibited or restricted activities for each category. The Kenya Wildlife Service shall, within twelve months of the commencement of these Regulations, identify and prepare an inventory of the listed ecosystems, habitats and species in Kenya.

Policy: Wildlife Conservation and Management (Implementation of Treaties) Regulations, 2017 (L.N. No. 241 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Cabinet Secretary for Environment and Natural Resources under section 109 of the Wildlife Conservation and Management Act, 2013, requires the Kenya Wildlife  Service, as the lead agency, in consultation with Service to stakeholders administer, to co-ordinate and implement international treaties regarding wildlife to which Kenya is Party. The Service shall, among other things, comply with and monitor compliance with international treaties and monitor and prevent trade that is inconsistent with international treaties in accordance with the Act and the Regulations made under it. The Regulations also require each county to ensure that its legislation conforms with wildlife international treaties to which Kenya is a party. The Service may delegate any function to the County Wildlife Conservation and Compensation Committee.

Policy: Guma Valley Water Company Act (No. 6 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act continues in existence the Guma Valley Water Company, defines its functions and powers and provides with respect to its administration and operations. The Company shall be governed by a Board, which may make Regulations as are necessary for the implementation of this Act. The Company shall produce, distribute and conserve water within the limits of supply and other areas as may be determined by the National Commission for Privatization. The Company shall provide, in its mains, a supply of sufficient water for the domestic purposes of its consumers and in compliance with the water quality standards prescribed by the Sierra Leone Standards Bureau. It shall carry out waterworks and perform other duties as specified. It may, by agreement or compulsorily, aquire land. The limits of supply by the Company shall be the area delineated as the “Limits of supply of the Guma Valley Water Company” and set out in the Third Schedule.

Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Ley se establece el Plan Provincial Agroforestal con el objeto de: a) promover el desarrollo sostenible y mejorar la situación social, ecológica, paisajística y de producción de las diversas áreas de la Provincia; b) promover y complementar la producción en el marco de las Buenas Prácticas Agropecuarias, ayudando a prevenir y evitar los procesos de erosión eólica o hídrica, favoreciendo la infiltración,reducción y consumo de excesos hídricos; c) incentivar la protección de los suelos; d) mejorar la calidad del aire y del agua; e) mejorar el entorno rural, urbano y la calidad de vida de la población cordobesa mediante la implantación o enriquecimiento con especies forestales que pueden ser aprovechadas con el concepto de uso múltiple, asegurando la persistencia del recurso con un criterio de conservación y manejo forestal sostenible, de acuerdo a las Buenas Prácticas Forestales y de la producción con conservación de los recursos naturales; f) contribuir a la conservación y restauración de la biodiversidad a los fines de preservar los beneficios ecosistémicos, tales como hábitat de polinizadores naturales y refugio de fauna nativa.

Policy: Law No. 14/2017 establishing the General Forestry Regime.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 48 articles divided into four Chapters, defines the fundamental principles and standards for the management, protection, conservation and sustainable use of forestry and river basin resources, within the framework of a rational and integrated administration. It aims to respond to the needs of the communities that use the forests to their livelihood and prosperity, as well as promoting sustainable development. The Law applies throughout the national territory to all persons governed by public or private law, whether natural or legal entities. The main objectives of the definition of fundamental principles and norms related to the management, protection, conservation and sustainable use of forestry and river basin resources are: a) Forest protection and nature conservation; b) Conservation of river basins; c) afforestation and reclamation of soils; d) Community participation for forestry development; e) Institutional development of the forestry sector; f) Creation of favorable conditions for the development of the private sector.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 45/2017 on the Regulation concerning the Statute and Rules of Procedure for the Evaluation Committee for the Management of the Environmental Assessment Process for Category A Projects.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision, consisting of 15 articles divided into five Chapters and five Annexes, establishes the Evaluation Committee for the Management of the Environmental Assessment Process for Category A Projects, under the Decree-Law No. 5/2011 on the Environmental Licensing System and by the Environmental Decree-Law No. 26/2012. This Regulation applies to all Evaluation Committees established to manage the environmental assessment process for any proposed Category A project. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned Evaluation Committee, entitled to carry out a detailed technical Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) and an Environmental Management Plan (EMP) as soon as the initial verification is completed successfully. Committee members must have significant experience of at least five years in one or more of the following areas: Environmental engineering; Environmental sciences; Biology, Chemistry or Physics; Ecology; Human health; Economy; Social Sciences; Pollution control; Specific experience in the proposed project sector.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Indian Ocean, Least Developed Countries, Small Island Developing States, South-Eastern Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 47/2017 on the Regulation on Procedures for Public Consultation and Requirements during the Process of Environmental Assessment.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision, consisting of 20 articles divided into seven Chapters, establishes the Regulation on Procedures for Public Consultation and Requirements during the Process of Environmental Assessment. This Regulation applies to all projects proposed in accordance with the Environmental Licensing Law, approved by Decree-Law No. 5/2011. It applies: to the public consultation during the study phase for the collection of information for the elaboration of the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) and the Environmental Management Plan (EMP) in a proposed Category A project; and the public consultation during the study phase for the collection of information for the preparation of the EIA and the EMP in a proposed Category B project. Purpose of the public consultation during the study phase is to provide information to potentially affected people by the project and to obtain information of people in the study area of the proposed project and who may be affected by the proposed project. The purpose of the public consultation on the EIA proposal and the proposal of the EMP is to obtain feedback and comments from the public that should be taken into account by the project proponent before finalizing and submitting the documents to the Environmental Authority.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No. 46/2017 on the Regulation on Detailed Requirements for Screening, Definition of Scope and Terms of Reference of Environmental Impact Assessment and Environmental Management Plans for Environmental Evaluation.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decision, consisting of 10 articles divided into six Chapters and six Annexes, establishes the Regulation on Detailed Requirements for Screening, Definition of Scope and Terms of Reference of Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) and Environmental Management Plans (EMP) for Environmental Evaluation. This Regulation applies to all projects proposed in accordance with the Environmental Licensing Act. EIA has as general objectives to provide: Information about the proposed project; Basic information on the environmental, social and economic conditions of the proposed project area; Information on the potential impacts of the project; Information on proposed measures to avoid, reduce or offset any significant negative impacts; Information on the main alternatives considered by the project proponent; Public consultations results. The overall objective of the EMP is to ensure that the mitigation of negative impacts and the valuation of positive impacts are executed effectively through the project life cycle. The EMP should address mitigation and management measures in the different phases of the proposed project with relevance and especially in the pre-construction, construction, development and deactivation phases. The EMP shall be consistent with the results of the EIA (the minimum content is set out in Annex VI).
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Décret n° 2017-664/PRN du 02 aout 2017 portant création d'un Système National de Conseil Agricole (SNCA) au Niger.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret met en place un Système National de Conseil Agricole (SNCA) au Niger.  Le Système National de Conseil Agricole est l’ensemble des dispositifs de conseil de terrain gérés et mis en œuvre par différents acteurs publics et privés auquel s’ajoutent les dispositifs transversaux chargés de coordonner les activités, de faire le lien recherche développement, d'élaborer les messages techniques et les méthodes d'intervention et de réaliser des études de capitalisation. Basé sur les principes institutionnels (pluralité, co-pilotage, progressivité, coordination multisectorielle légère, déconcentration, prise en compte de la décentralisation, et accès équitable), les principes techniques (offre de conseil complète et diversifiée, genre, et complémentarité), et les principes économiques et financiers, le Système National de Conseil Agricole est l'ensemble des dispositifs de conseil de terrain gérés et mis en œuvre par différents acteurs publics et prives auquel s’ajoutent les dispositifs transversaux charges de coordonner les activités, de faire le lien recherche développement, d'élaborer les messages techniques et les méthodes d'intervention et de réaliser des études de capitalisation.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Décret n° 2017-666/PRN du 02 aout 2017 portant création, attributions, composition, organisation et modalités de fonctionnement d'un organe d'orientation stratégique du Conseil Agricole, dénommé Comité d'Orientation Stratégique du Conseil Agricole (COS/CA).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée un organe d'orientation stratégique du Conseil Agricole, dénommé Comité d'Orientation Stratégique du Conseil Agricole (COS/CA, et fixe ses attributions, sa composition et ses modalités de fonctionnement. Le COS/CA a pour attribution d'assurer le pilotage stratégique du Système National du Conseil Agricole (SNCA). A ce titre, il est chargé de: proposer les orientations stratégiques du SNCA; veiller à la mise en œuvre du SNCA en adéquation avec la Stratégie nationale de Sécurité Alimentaire et Nutritionnelle et du Développement Agricole durables (SAN/DAD); promouvoir l’établissement de liens entre la recherche et le développement ; promouvoir des stratégies innovantes en matière de Conseil Agricole; veiller à la cohérence des dispositifs publics et prives de Conseil Agricole; veiller à la couverture spatiale équilibrée de l'accès au Conseil Agricole; piloter l'évolution progressive du SNCA; apprécier la pertinence, la qualité et les résultats des dispositifs de Conseil Agricole; capitaliser les progrès réalisés.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Africa, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Décret n° 2017-669/PRN/MAG/EL du 02 aout 2017 portant approbation des Statuts de l’Agence de Promotion du Conseil Agricole (APCA).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret approuve les Statuts de l’Agence de Promotion du Conseil Agricole (APCA) créée par le Décret n° 2017-667/PRN/MAG/EL du 02 aout 2017 portant création de l’Agence de Promotion du Conseil Agricole (APCA).  L’Agence de Promotion du Conseil Agricole (APCA) a pour mission la Coordination opérationnelle du Conseil Agricole. A ce titre elle est chargée de: planifier et programmer la mise en œuvre de la stratégie du Conseil Agricole sur l’ensemble du territoire national; coordonner et animer le Système National de Conseil Agricole, en relation avec toutes les structures concernées; mobiliser les compétences nationales pour assurer les fonctions transversales du système National de Conseil Agricole; créer une synergie entre les équipes des organismes publics et prives de Conseil Agricole; assurer la cohérence entre les activités menées par le Système National de Conseil ; Agricole et celles relevant des autres programmes de développement rural; faciliter le renforcement des dispositifs des ministères sectoriels et de l’Office National des Aménagements Hydro-Agricoles (ONAHA), en cohérence avec le processus de transfert de compétences aux Collectivités Territoriales; définir les conditions et modalités d'agrément des dispositifs prives de Conseil Agricole; mettre en place un mécanisme d'analyse et d'approbation des programmes de conseil des dispositifs agréés; veiller à l’adaptation du Conseil Agricole sur la base de diagnostics régionaux; proposer des méthodes de conseil innovantes adaptées à la réalité du Niger; financer et/ou cofinancer les dispositifs publics et prives du Conseil Agricole, notamment à travers la Facilite 3 du Fonds d'Investissement pour la Sécurité Alimentaire et Nutritionnelle (FISAN); mettre en place un mécanisme d'identification des besoins de renforcement de compétences des dispositifs publics et prives de Conseil Agricole; mettre en œuvre ou financer des mesures de renforcement des capacités appropriées; veiller à la qualité du Conseil Agricole, à travers des missions de suivi; s'assurer de l'utilisation des fonds mobilises selon des principes, des pratiques et des règles communes; capitaliser les avancées en matière de Conseil Agricole; et fournir les informations nécessaires au Comité d'Orientation Stratégique du Conseil Agricole (COS/CA) pour lui permettre d'assurer le pilotage stratégique du Système National de Conseil Agricole.

Policy: Environment and Climate Adaptation Levy (Plastic Bags) Regulations 2017 (L.N. No. 61 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made under section 17 of the Environment and Climate Adaptation Levy Act 2015, introduces an Environment and Climate Adaptation Levy charged on plastic bags. This Charge must be collected by a cashier at the point at which a plastic bag is provided by the business to a consumer. It shall then be paid to the Chief Executive Officer and Commissioner of Inland Revenue (CEO). The CEO may, in any particular case, require that the Environment and Climate Adaptation Levy be paid within a period of less than one month. A business must display a notice informing consumers of the Environment and Climate Adaptation Levy charged on plastic bags.

Policy: Order No. 279 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate validating the Regulation on safety arrangements for management and disposal of radioactive waste.
Policy_Content: This Order lays down general provisions, specifying the purpose, criteria, principles and basic requirements for ensuring nuclear and radiation safety at all stages of radioactive waste management and disposal thereof. It shall be mandatory business entities operating in the sphere of radioactive waste management at all stages of life cycle of nuclear power plants. The scope of security in the process of management of radioactive waste until its disposal shall be protection staff and population, including protection of the present and the future generations, and environment, from negative radiation impact. The basic principles of safety in the process of radioactive waste management until disposal thereof shall be as follows: (a) minimization of radioactive waste; (b) interdependence of the stages of radioactive waste management; (c) reducing the burden on future generations; (d) providing a culture of safety; (e) security commitment; (f) implementation of the strategy of in depth protection; (g) application of proven engineering practice; (h) introduction of management system; (i) consideration of human factor; (j) consideration of experience of radioactive waste management; (k) ensuring protection against radiation; (l) security; and (m) assessment of the safety of objects intended for the management of radioactive waste before disposal thereof.

Policy: Plan Stratégique Multisectoriel de la Nutrition du Sénégal, 2017-2021 .
Policy_Content: Le présent Plan est une politique multisectoriel pour la nutrition du Sénégal pour le période 2017-2021. Il s'inscrit dans la vision 2025. Les objectifs stratégiques et spécifiques définis pour l’horizon 2021 se présentent comme suit: réduire d’au moins 20% la prévalence du retard de croissance d’ici 2021 au niveau national; réduire de 15% la proportion d’enfants ayant un faible poids de naissance, d’ici 2021; réduire à moins de 5% la prévalence de la malnutrition aigüe des enfants de 0 à 5 ans; porter à 43% au moins le taux de l’Allaitement Maternel Exclusif durant les 6 premiers mois; réduire de 25% la prévalence de l’anémie chez les groupes vulnérables;  réduire d’au moins 20% la prévalence des carences pour les autres micronutriments (iode, zinc et vitamine A); réduire de 10% la prévalence de l’obésité chez les groupes vulnérables; réduire d’au moins 20% la prévalence des carences pour les autres micronutriments (iode, zinc et vitamine A); et réduire de 10% la prévalence de l’obésité chez les groupes vulnérables. Par ailleurs, les axes d'intervention sont: prévention de la malnutrition et des MNT d'origine alimentaire; lutte contre les carences en micronutriments (fer/acide folique iode, zinc, vitamine A); renforcement de la disponibilité et de l’accessibilité des aliments diversifiés, sains et à haute valeur nutritive; formation, recherche et innovation; et gouvernance de la nutrition.

Policy: Resource Management (National Environmental Standards for Plantation Forestry) Regulations 2017.
Policy_Content: This Regulations, consisting of 106 sections divided into three Parts and four Schedules,  are made under the Resource Management Act 1991 and prescribe national environmental standards for plantation forestry. Purpose of regulations Part 1 provides for matters of interpretation, application of the regulations, provision for plan rules, etc. Part 2 provides for 8 main plantation forestry activities to be permitted when carried out in accordance with specified conditions that require to manage the adverse environmental effects of the activities. The regulated activities are: afforestation (regulations 8 to 17); pruning and thinning to waste (regulations 18 to 21); earthworks (regulations 22 to 35); river crossings (regulations 36 to 49); forestry quarrying (regulations 50 to 61); harvesting (regulations 62 to 71); mechanical land preparation (regulations 72 to 75); replanting (regulations 76 to 81).
