Policy: Floodplain Management Plan for the Barwon-darling Valley Floodplain 2017.
Policy_Content: This Regulation approves the Floodplain Management Plan for the Barwon-darling Valley Floodplain. The Plan, consisting of 58 sections and completed by two Schedules and seven Appendixes, is made under section 50 of the Water Management Act 2000. This Plan is a plan for floodplain management and generally deals with the matters set out in sections 29 and 30 of the Act, as well as other sections of the Act. The vision of this Plan is to contribute to a sustainable, healthy and working floodplain by managing the development of new flood works and amendments to existing flood works to protect the passage of floodwater through the floodplain, whilst recognising the need to minimise the risk to life and property.

Policy: Decree No. 13 of the Ministry of Forestry validating the Regulation on organization and scope of forest management works, composition of forest management documentation and supervision over the implementation of forest management projects.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth unified requirements for organization and scope of forest management works, composition of forest management documentation and supervision over the implementation of forest management projects. Supervision shall be intended arrangement by forest management organization performed with a view of analysis of execution of forest management project by legal entity performing forest management. Forest management of public forest shall be performed in accordance with the current and perspective forest management plans approved by the national forest management body. The forest management project shall contain the following data: (a) definition of the boundaries of the forest plot, its division (forest areas, logging camps, ranger districts, forest districts); (b) performance of topographic-geodetic, forest biological, design and survey works and other assessments in the forest fund; (c) forest inventory; (d) assessment of forest growth, forest stand and economic conditions of the forest management; (e) identification of forest fund sites in need of forestry measures, main use felling, determination of felling methods and amount of these felling; (f) identification of forest fund sites designated for reforestation and afforestation, and the definition of reforestation methods; (g) specification of the boundaries of forest fund sites assigned to certain categories of forest, which are indicated in the forest management project, including cartographic materials, and preparation of proposals for their modification; (h) development of a forest management project; (i) supervision of the implementation of the forest management project; and (j) keeping of information database on forest resources of the Republic of Belarus.

Policy: Strata Titles (Amendment) Act No. 4 of 2017.
Policy_Content: The title of the Principal Act is amended as Strata and Community Titles Act. In Section 1, the definitions of consent authority, lessee, lot, parcel and special resolution are amended. Sections 1A, 1B, 1C and 1D are repealed. Wherever it occurs, "strata" is deleted in the Sections 2, 3, 11, 13, 14, 19, 20, 25 and 27.  This Act amends Subsections 2(1A) and 2(1B) regarding land valuation. Policy: Loi 2017-442 du 30 juin 2017 portant Code maritime.
Policy_Content: La présente loi qui a trait au code marine comprend  1115 articles repartis en 12 livres déclinés en titres, chapitres et sections. Cette loi est applicable à toutes les activités maritimes civiles et marchandes se déroulant dans les eaux maritimes, les lagunes, fleuves et plans d ’eau en communication avec la mer et dans les ports sous réserve des textes spécifiques et des conventions réglementant les activités portuaires. Par ailleurs, ce code s'applique aux navires immatriculés en Côte d ’ivoire ainsi qu’aux gens de mer ivoiriens ou étrangers, travailleurs assimilés et passagers qui y embarquent. Les navires et les marins étrangers se trouvant dans les limites des eaux sous juridiction nationale sont assujettis à toutes les dispositions d’ordre public contenues dans la présente loi. Le Titre II du livre preliminaire fixe l’organisation de l'administration maritime dont les missions sont, entre autres: administration des navires, engins flottants, iles artificielles, ouvrages de mer et de lagunes, épaves et hypothèques maritimes; participation à l’administration des plates-formes de forage et de production  de participer à la gestion des plates-formes de forage en ce qui concerne la police, la sécurité, la sûreté et la protection du milieu marin ; de participer à l’administration des domaines publics maritime, lagunaire et fluvial ; de gérer les professions maritimes et la santé des gens de mer ; de participer à la protection et à la préservation des milieux marin, lagunaire et fluvial ; d ’appliquer la réglementation du travail maritime ; de régler les conflits individuels ou collectifs ; de suivre et de coordonner les règles de sûreté maritime et portuaires ; de participer au contrôle et à la surveillance des pêches maritimes et lagunaires.

Policy: Loi n°2017-008 du 29/06/2017 portant création de communes.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée dans les régions et préfectures du Togo les communes.  Le ressort territorial et le chef-lieu des communes ainsi créées sont fixés par décret en conseil des ministres. Toutes les dispositions antérieures relatives à la création des communes au Togo sont abrogées. Toutefois, les communes existantes avant l’adoption de la présente loi, ne disparaîtront qu’à l’issue des élections municipales dans les communes nouvelles ci-dessus créées.

Policy: Resolution No. 63/2017 creating the National Pesticide Management Committee (CNGP) responsible for the control of pesticides throughout the national territory.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 10 articles, creates the National Pesticide Management Committee (CNGP) as an advisory body, to coordinate, articulate and enforce decisions related to pesticides in all domains within the national territory in order to comply with the ECOWAS regulation C/REG.3/05/2008 of 18 May on the harmonization of rules governing the approval, marketing and control of pesticides in all Member States. CNGP is responsible for: a) Identify legislative needs and regulations on pesticides and propose competent authorities to regulate them; b) Analyze and issue technical opinions on the health problems caused by pesticides; c) Analyze and issue technical opinions on the problem of environmental degradation caused by pesticides; d) Apply, follow and evaluate the resolutions and recommendations of the Sahelian Committee on Pesticides (CSP), and other legal instruments adhered to and ratified by the country, within the subregion; e) implement, monitor and evaluate pesticide regulations in the various domains within the country; f) Analyze dossiers of application for authorization or license to carry out activities in the pesticides sector in all areas; g) Implement, monitor and evaluate international conventions on pesticides in all areas; h) Verify on a regular basis the records of authorized, strictly regulated, prohibited, obsolete and used pesticides. i) Analyze and issue opinions on the problem of pollution caused by the pesticide in all areas. j) Analyze and issue technical advice on the destruction of obsolete pesticides and empty packaging; k) Analyze, monitor and evaluate toxicity; l) Discuss and propose the national list of pesticides, using a global list previously established by the CSP; and m) Prepare and approve the internal regulations of the CNGP.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Cultivated plants

Policy: Order No. 330 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on methodological guidelines for the quantitative determination of the volume of indirect energy emissions of greenhouse gases.
Policy_Content: Methodical instructions shall be destined for organizations engaged in economic and other activities in the territory of the Russian Federation and establish the procedure for quantifying the amount of indirect energy emissions generated as a result of consumption by organizations of electric and thermal energy received from external generating facilities, for monitoring, reporting and verifying greenhouse gas emissions. The volume of emissions is determined for a calendar year separately for each branch and a separate subdivision of an organization, or in general for the whole organization, with the distribution for each branch or separate subdivision. This is performed in accordance with regional and market methods. The regional method reflects the average intensity of greenhouse gas emissions at facilities generating electricity and heat that is consumed by the organization. The market method is used when the organization consumes electricity received through bilateral electricity purchase and sale contracts. Information (report) on emissions is stored in the organization in electronic and paper form no less than 5 years after the end of the reporting period.

Policy: Order No. 331 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology of the Russian Federation validating the Regulation on the state nature biosphere reserve I.I.Sprygin.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the state nature biosphere reserve I.I.Sprygin shall be located in the Samara province. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) the protection of natural areas in order to conserve biological diversity and maintain in a natural state protected natural complexes and objects; (b) the organization and performance of scientific research, including keeping and updating of the Annals of Nature; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) environmental education and development of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in the training of scientific personnel and specialists in the field of environmental protection. On the territory of the state nature biosphere reserve I.I.Sprygin shall be prohibited the following activities: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (b) commercial fisheries, and artisanal and sport fishing except for some exceptional cases; (c) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, and hunting gear; (d) exploration of minerals and mining; (e) soil disturbance; (f) activities that entail changes in the hydrological regime of land; (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) clear cutting of forests; (i) timber extraction and harvesting of non-timber products; (j) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (k) plowing of land, with the exception of measures for forest firefighting; (l) haymaking, except for ensuring fire safety; (m) explosive works; (n) burning of vegetation and grassland fires, except for case of extinguishing forest fires; (o) water logging; (p) introduction of alien species; (q) transit and stay of motor vehicles; (r) stay with dogs, except for service dogs; (s) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; and (t) disturbance and feeding of wild fauna species by the visitors. Annex 1 contains the mapping of the territory and the boundaries of the state nature biosphere reserve I.I.Sprygin. Annex 2 contains the list and the map of forest plots allotted for sanitary felling in accordance with forest management projects. Annex 3 contains the list of forest districts.

Policy: Decree No. 9/2017 approving the Regulation on the Environmental Auditing.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the on the Environmental Auditing. This Regulation, consisting of 32 articles divided into five Chapters, regulates types, procedures and conditions to be observed in the performance of environmental audits. It applies to public or private activities, policies, plans, and projects that, during the designing phase, execution and deactivation may directly or indirectly influence one of the environmental and social components. In addition, it assesses the compliance of activities with standards and parameters defined and applicable, namely: Impacts on the environment and the public health; Accident risks and contingency plans for the evacuation and protection of workers and local communities located in the area of ​​influence of the activity; Levels and potential pollution or environmental degradation resulting from the activity carried out; Operation and maintenance of pollution control equipment and systems; Effectiveness of the measures contained in the Environmental and Social Management Plan and other relevant plans and their implementation; Compliance with the protected area management plan; Reuse, recycling, reduction, transport and disposal of waste; Noises and vibrations inside and outside the buildings; Measures to prevent and limit environmental accidents; Failures or deficiencies of the previous environmental audit process.

Policy: Law No. ZR-96 “On the Commission for the prevention of corruption.”
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the procedure for the formation and activities, guarantees of independence, functions and powers of the Commission for the prevention of corruption, the requirements for its members, as well as relations regarding analysis of declarations and the conduct of proceedings thereon. The Commission, within the limits of its powers, may, on behalf of the Republic of Armenia, acquire and exercise property and personal material and non-material rights, bear obligations, act in court as a plaintiff or the defendant, as well as to dispose and use the property in accordance with the goals of its activities and the purpose of the assigned property. The Commission shall publish on its official website the decisions and opinions, as well as proposals submitted by it and information on the consideration of their results. The Commission, in the exercise of its powers, shall cooperate with state bodies and local self-government bodies, international and other organizations, as well as representatives of  civil society. The functions of the Commission shall be as follows: (a) monitoring of compliance with requirements for incompatibility and other restrictions for high-ranking officials, as well as compliance with regulation of ethics rules, conflict of situational interests high-ranking officials, with the exception of deputies, judges and prosecutors; (b) regulation of the declaration process, verification and analysis of declarations; (c) ensuring the uniformity of application of the requirements established by law for incompatibilities and other restrictions; and (d) participation in the development of policies related to the fight against corruption. The Commission shall perform: (a) verification of compliance with the requirements for filling and submission of declarations; (b) verification of the accuracy and completeness of the declared data; (c) mathematical analysis of the declared data; and (d) analysis of declarations based on risk indicators.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Law shall come into force after the National Assembly appoints by the National Assembly at least three members of the Commission.

Policy: Decree No. 13/2017 approving the Classification of Dulombi National Park.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 31 articles divided into six Chapters and three Annexes, approves the Classification of Dulombi National Park. Without prejudice to the provisions of the Framework Law on Protected Areas, the objectives of the Park are, namely: a) Ensure the preservation, conservation and protection of the environmental assets in the Park; b) Protect and conserve outstanding and exceptional natural resouces and their peculiarities, the landscape and its natural heritage, ecosystems, species and genetic resources; c) Preserve, conserve, protect and recover the most representative ecosystems and main habitats, especially those used by rare and threatened species as breeding, feeding, growing sites, corridors or places of access to water; d) Promote the orderly use of the territory and the rational use of natural resources in order to guarantee the management of essential ecological processes and reduce and/or eliminate sources of pressure on natural resources; e) Protect rare and endangered animal and plant species and their habitats; f) Promote the sustainable management of the area's resources in collaboration with local communities; g) Ensure the preservation of wetlands, especially rivers and “Wendos” and their ecological functions, and monitor human activities related to their use; h) Valuing and promoting knowledge, sociocultural practices and local traditional cultural heritage compatible with conservation; i) Provide the socio-economic and cultural development of the populations in these areas, with their participation, respecting the environment and traditions of populations; j) Promote a place for study and scientific exchanges, focused on the conservation of biodiversity and ecosystems; k) Establish a participatory system for monitoring, following up and managing natural resources; and l) Promote ecotourism.

Policy: Decree No. 12/2017 approving the Wildlife Corridor Classification of Salifo-Xitole.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 28 articles divided into five Chapters and one Annex, approves the Wildlife Corridor Classification of Salifo-Xitole. Without prejudice to the provisions of the Framework Law on Protected Areas, the Wildlife Corridor main objective is to carry out an active intervention in terms of management, to ensure the conservation of ecological processes in the connection areas between the Protected Areas, adjust the environmental liabilities and provide integration between local communities and Protected Areas, reconciling the presence of biodiversity, valuing socio-biodiversity and sustainable development practices in the local, national and international context. The Wildlife Corridor also has the following functions: a) Provide connectivity in landscapes, ecosystems and natural and/or modified habitats by human action; b) Mitigate and reverse the effects caused by the fragmentation of landscape and habitats; c) Maintain and restore native and original ecosystems; d) Serve as a connector between other protected areas; e) Encourage the flow of individuals and genetic exchange between landscape fragments, habitats and other conservation units; f) Contribute to the protection and conservation of migration routes for the large terrestrial fauna; g) Ensuring the permanent and/or seasonal flow of species for food, mating period, reproduction, refuge and growth; h) Block harmful processes for populations of certain organisms; i) Manage the occupation of territory and regulating the use of natural resources through norms; and j) Promote sustainable economic and human development from a sociocultural and ecological point of view.

Policy: Decree No. 15/2017 approving the Classification of Boé National Park.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 31 articles divided into six Chapters and three Annexes, approves the Classification of Boé National Park. Without prejudice to the provisions of the Framework Law on Protected Areas, the Park's main objectives are to ensure the conservation of habitats and the great biological diversity in the upper basin of the Corubal River and its effluents, safeguarding endangered animal and plant species, rare or threatened, promote ecotourism and other compatible ways of valuing and using biodiversity in order to ensure better living conditions for the resident populations. The specific attributions of the Park are namely: a) Protect and conserve outstanding and exceptional natural resources and their peculiarities, the landscape and its natural heritage, ecosystems, species and genetic resources; b) Preserve, conserve, protect and recover the most representative ecosystems and main habitats, especially those used by rare and threatened species as breeding, feeding, growing sites, corridors or places of access to water; c) Protect, preserve and restore biological heritage, namely populations of rare, threatened and/or endangered animal and plant species and their respective habitats; d) Promote the orderly use of the territory and natural resources in order to guarantee the maintenance of essential ecological processes and reduce and/or eliminate sources of pressure on natural resources; e) Establish a participatory system for monitoring, following up and managing natural resources; f) Ensure the preservation of wetlands, especially rivers and “Wendos” and their ecological functions, and monitor human activities related to their use; g) Value and promote knowledge, sociocultural practices and traditional cultural heritage, compatible with conservation. h) Support the conservation of sacred forests and the maintenance of their ecological and sociocultural functions; i) Provide the socio-economic and cultural development of the populations involved, with their active participation, based on the introduction of biodiversity into production systems, the extension and dissemination of good practices and the enhancement of their respective cultural heritage; j) Promote and organize ecotourism, recreation and leisure activities on solidary, sustainable bases and with equitable sharing of benefits for local populations; k) Order, promote, carry out and guide scientific research, education and environmental interpretation; Policy: Decree No. 14/2017 approving the Wildlife Corridor Classification of Cuntabane-Queboe.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 28 articles divided into five Chapters and one Annex, approves the Wildlife Corridor Classification of Cuntabane-Quebo. Without prejudice to the provisions of articles 7-10 and in accordance with articles 25-29 of the Framework Law on Protected Areas, the Wildlife Corridor consists of a single sustainable development or solidarity zone, which extends from the boundary of the transition zone to the park boundary and aimed at the development of sustainable and compatible socio-economic and cultural models with the natural heritage values ​​and the Corridor's conservation objectives. The sustainable development zone may comprise the following sub-zones, classified according to the priority actions for which they are intended: a) Sacred areas identified for their ecological, socio-cultural and religious importance to local communities, having as a consequence the restrictions defined by local culture and traditions; b) Priority controlled research areas, exclusively intended for research, observation and monitoring of the dynamics of natural ecosystems, flora and fauna resources and their ecological value; c) Recovery zones where the level of degradation recommends temporary actions to restore the potential and original ecosystems and natural, landscape, architectural and other heritage, comprising the zone referred to in the previous paragraph of this article; d) Priority areas to support sustainable development, destined to controlled exploitation activities, with the development of alternative actions to activities at risk of environmental degradation and/or reinforcement of traditional management capacity. These activities are carried out within the framework of integrated planning and management and the environmental impact studies.

Policy: Presidential Resolution No. PP-3096 “On the organization of special Fund for financing of public purchase of agricultural commodities and supply of equipment to agriculture.
Policy_Content: The President, with a view of introduction of fundamentally new mechanism for targeted financing of agricultural production and supply of modern high-performance agricultural machinery and equipment, decrees to set up managing body of the Fund and to establish the following purposes for financing by the Fund: (a) timely financing of settlements for the cotton and grain crops grown for public procurement; (b) financing of supplies on preferential leasing conditions of modern high-performance agricultural machinery and equipment to farms and other agricultural organizations involved in the cultivation of agricultural crops for public procurement; (c) covering, if necessary, the negative difference between world prices and wholesale prices for cotton fiber, grain and cereals, in accordance with the approved price list for the current period; (d) covering the costs of payment of allowances allocated to cotton seed growing, scientific institutions that are originators of varieties, as well as other entities involved in production of cotton seeds; (e) financing procurement costs of supplies required for cotton production for farms; (f) repayment of loans attracted and interest accrued on them; (g) studying of the experience of developing and developed countries in financing the agricultural sector with a view to subsequent introduction of positive results at the national level; and (h) financing the maintenance costs of the managing body of the Fund.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Cultivated plants

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 5095 “On the establishment of a Special Fund for financing of public purchase of agricultural commodities and supply of equipment to agriculture”.
Policy_Content: The President, in order to ensure stable development of agricultural sector, increase of agricultural production, crop yields, formation of the unified system of financing agricultural production for public procurement, as well as radical renewal of agricultural machinery and equipment and supply thereof to the agricultural producers, decrees to set up a Special Fund for financing of public purchase of agricultural commodities and supply of equipment to agriculture subordinated to the Cabinet of Ministers. The Fund shall perform the following tasks: (a) timely financing of settlements for the cotton and grain crops grown for public procurement; (b) allocation, on a returnable basis, of a loan to stimulate the supply on preferential leasing terms of modern high-performance agricultural machinery to farmers and other agricultural organizations involved in the cultivation of agricultural crops for public procurement; (c) ensuring systemic control over the correct and effective use of funds allocated for specific purpose; (d) coordination of the activities of all the units involved in the financing system that provide settlements for the purchased products - the Ministry of Finance, banks, procurement, servicing, leasing organizations, suppliers, and agricultural producers; (e) financing of implementation and further improvement of the settlement system based on the use of modern information and computer technologies; (f) studying of the experience of developing and developed countries in financing the agricultural sector with a view to subsequent introduction of positive results at the national level. The Fund shall be exempted from paying all types of taxes, except corporate income tax at the source of payment.

Policy: Order No. 321 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on national park “Smolny”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Smolny” shall be Mordovia region of the Russian Federation. National park “Smolny” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sports and artisanal hunting, commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park); (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; and (y) keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs; (z) ploughing up of the territory, haymaking (except for forest fire fighting purposes); and application of chemicals, fertilizers, nutrients and plant protection means, flight of aircraft less than 500 meters above the territory of the national park without prior authorization by the Institution.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Radiation Protection Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the protection of the people against radiation. Article 1 of the present Act establishes that in order to protect the population the: 1) radioactivity in the environment shall have to be monitored; 2) the exposure of people to radiation and radioactive contamination of the environment shall be kept as low as possible. The text consists of 218 articles divided into 8 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Radiation protection for planned exposure situations (2); Radiation protection in emergency situations (3); Radiation protection in existing exposure situations (4); Overarching provisions on exposure situations (5); Radiation protection supervision, administrative procedures (6); Administrative bodies (7); Final provisions (8).

Policy: Decreto Nº 1102 - Modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo de Minas y Energía, en lo relacionado con la adopción de medidas para la comercialización de minerales.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Administrativo de Minas y Energía y el Decreto Único Reglamentario del Sector Ambiente y Desarrollo Sostenible, en lo relacionado con la adopción de medidas para la comercialización de minerales. Entre otras, se adopta la definición de Minería de Subsistencia, que es la actividad minera desarrollada por personas naturales o grupo de personas que se dedican a la extracción y recolección a cielo abierto de arenas y gravas de río destinadas a la industria de la construcción, arcillas, metales preciosos, piedras preciosas y semipreciosas, por medios y herramientas manuales, sin la utilización de ningún tipo de equipo mecanizado o maquinaria para su arranque. En la minería de subsistencia se entienden incluidas las labores de barequeo y las de recolección de los minerales mencionados en este artículo que se encuentren presentes en los desechos de explotaciones mineras, independientemente del calificativo que estas últimas asuman en las diferentes zonas del territorio nacional. Por razones de seguridad minera y en atención a que su ejecución requiere la utilización de maquinaria o medios mecanizados prohibidos en la minería sin título minero, la minería de subsistencia no comprenderá las actividades mineras que se desarrollen de manera subterránea.

Policy: Law No. XIII-530 amending Environmental Protection Law (No.I-2223 of 1992).
Policy_Content: Article 7 shall be amended to add the following wording: “"One or more natural or legal persons, the public concerned have the right to: (a) receive information about the environment in accordance with the established procedure; (b) participate in the process of selection of proposed economic activity for environmental impact assessment and environmental impact assessment and submit proposals; (c) demand the termination of the harmful environmental impact of economic activity; (d) organize and participate in public environmental control; (e) require that the state public authorities organize the environmental education and training, as well as the free dissemination of ideas of environmental protection; (f) file a complaint (request), demanding the authorities to take appropriate action to prevent or reduce damage to the environment or restored to the original state of the environment, and to demand the punishment of persons guilty of endangering the environment, and the officials who will decide whether actions (inaction) violated the rights of citizens, the public concerned, other legal and natural persons or interests protected by law; (g) visit natural territories (protected areas), except for those whose attendance is prohibited or restricted; and (h) apply to the court in accordance with the procedure established by the laws of the Republic of Lithuania if the right to receive information about the environment was unlawfully refused, answered in part or in whole inappropriately, or the request has not been duly taken into account in accordance with the legislation governing the right of access to information on the environment.” Article 15 establishes the procedure for mandatory environmental impact assessment for activities that may cause negative environmental impact prior to the beginning of the aforesaid projected activities.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy: Decree No. 7/2017 approving the Regulation on the Environmental and Social Impact Assessment.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation on the Environmental and Social Impact Assessment. This Regulation, consisting of 23 articles divided into four Chapters, aims at regulating the Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA) procedures for projects likely to cause significant impacts on the environment and human health under the Environmental Law, approved by Law No. 1/2011 of 2 March and without prejudice to the provisions of the Law on Environmental Assessment, approved by Law No. 10/2010 of 24 September providing for the types and stages of ESIA. The implementation of the ESIA should observe, in particular the following basic principles: ESIAs should produce information of technical and scientific nature; The process of elaboration of the ESIAs should apply the best methodologies and scientific techniques that are suitable and appropriate to the treatment of the problems in question; ESIAs should contain objective information and provide results that aid in problem solving and are acceptable and usable by the developer; The process should follow the following steps: Provide sufficient and reliable information in environmental assessment and decision processes; Achieve the objectives of the environmental assessment within the limits of information, time, resources and methodologies available; Impose a minimum of financial and time costs on the workforce and the various stakeholders; Focus on the key factors and significant environmental effects that have to be considered in the decision; Adjust to the circumstances of the proposals under consideration, without compromising the integrity of the process, being interactive and incorporate the lessons learned throughout the process; Promote appropriate opportunities to inform and involve affected and affected parties, their contributions and concerns being explicitly considered, etc. Offences and penalties are appended to the text.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on the day after its publication.

Policy: Decree No. 6/2017 approving the Regulation on the Environmental Fund.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation on the Environmental Fund. This Regulation, consisting of 27 articles divided into five Chapters, aims at regulating the activities of the above mentioned Fund, as a legal entity governed by public law, whose mission includes the collection, management and application of financial resources to support the implementation and promotion of policies, plans, programmes, projects and other activities aimed at the protection, conservation and preservation of natural and environmental resources. This Fund also includes those activities aimed at preventing or rehabilitating damages produced in the environment, and contributing to National sustainable development. Composition, duties and structure of the Environmental Fund as well as, revenues and expenses, accounting and reporting procedures are specified in the text.

Policy: Decree No. 5/2017 approving the Regulation of Public Participation in the Environmental Assessment Process.
Policy_Content: This Decree approves the Regulation of Public Participation in the Environmental Assessment Process. This Regulation, consisting of 16 articles divided into four Chapters, aims at regulating procedures, forms and conditions for the public participation in the decision-making process during the Environmental and Social Assessment, pursuant to article 14 of Law No. 10/2010. The public participation process is governed, in particular by the following basic principles: a) Principle of the availability and accessibility of information, under which it shall be ensured that the information is made available in a timely manner to the decision-making process and on a medium that can be understood by stakeholders and concerned parties; b) Principle of representation, under which the representation of all segments of stakeholders and concerned parties must be ensured; e) Principle of independence, under which conditions must be created so that the outcome reflects the main worries of the concerned parties and is not dominated by any particular interest out of the process.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 49 - Crea la Mesa de Trabajo REDD+ Bosques para el Buen Vivir y los lineamientos generales para su funcionamiento.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo crea la Mesa de Trabajo REDD+ Bosques para el Buen Vivir (MdT REDD+), y los lineamientos generales para su funcionamiento, con el objeto de establecer una plataforma formal de diálogo, participación, discusión, consulta, seguimiento e involucramiento de los actores clave, en los procesos que lleva adelante el Ministerio del Ambiente para la implementación de REDD+ a nivel nacional, en el marco del Plan de Acción REDD+ Bosques para el Buen Vivir 2016-2025. Policy: Minerals Development Act 2017 (No. 23 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for the development of Minerals in Ireland and related matters. The main purposes of the Act are: (a) to provide a modern regulatory regime for exploration and development of state minerals, (b) to provide for regulating in accordance with the principles of social justice the exercise of private rights in respect of minerals and ancillary rights with a view to reconciling their exercise with the exigencies of the common good, (c) to provide for the continued vesting in the Minister for Communications, Energy and Natural Resources the exclusive right of working, selling or otherwise disposing of private minerals which are not in course of development, subject to payment of fair compensation, (d) to provide for preparation and implementation of rehabilitation plans for abandoned mine sites, and (e) to provide for consequential amendments. This Act applies to all minerals within the State or on or within the seabed and subsoil of— (a) the territorial seas (within the meaning of the Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006), or (b) any area standing designated for the time being by order under section 2 of the Continental Shelf Act 1968.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 974 of 2017 concerning Registration, Handling and Use of Agricultural Pesticides in Egypt Minister of Agriculture & Land Reclamation.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 53 articles, focuses on the pesticide value assessment to ensure that only those products that make positive contributions to pest management are registered, eliminating unnecessarily high use-rates; ensuring that even products of acceptable risk are approved for use only if their positive contribution to pest management is clear and significant; and ensuring that proposed risk-mitigation methods are simple, cheap and practical. The Agricultural Pesticide Committee (APC) is the sole statutory agency fully responsible to run the agricultural pesticide regulatory system through detailed pre-market assessment and post registration monitoring activities. The APC determines the permissible amounts for handling and use of such pesticides, regulates their mode of handling and application, and their trading, in line with the FAO Code of Conduct.The APC must refuse to register or amend the registration of any pest control product if the applicant fails to establish that the product has merit or value for the purposes claimed when the product is used in accordance with its label directions. The applicant must provide APC with the results of scientific investigations regarding the effectiveness of the control product for the intended purposes and its safety to the host plant, animal or article in relation to which it is to be used. Non-compliance with conditions of registration could lead to suspension, cancellation, use restriction or phasing out of a pest control product. The registration certificate of the technical grade or formulated pesticide is valid for a period of six renewable years from its issuing date. After issuing of the registration certificate, the stakeholder may apply for getting the pesticide label (two-year) after payment of the prescribed fees.

Policy: Decree No. 25/2017 creating the Forum of Tourism (FORTUR), as a consultation organ of the Government in matters related to tourism.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 10 articles, creates the Forum of Tourism (FORTUR), as a consultation body of the Government in the process of implementing policies and regulatory framework related to the development of the tourism industry in the national territory. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of FORTUR which is an inclusive discussion platform, integrating representatives of government institutions, the private sector and institutions with interests in the tourism sector in Mozambique. The FORTUR follows the principles of: a) Participation, reflecting the concerns of the main players in the tourism sector; b) Representation, considering that the members of FORTUR represent specific segments of society with interests in the tourism sector; c) Diversity, taking into account that it generally reflects the composition of the various segments with interests in tourism and tourism-related activities; d) Responsibility, FORTUR should faithfully represent the concerns of the main stakeholders in the tourism sector and ensure that the issues discussed and proposed adequately reflect its objectives and preferences; e) Integration and coordination, on the basis of which FORTUR functions as a coordination platform between the various stakeholders in the development process of the tourism sector.

Policy: Decreto Supremo Nº 018-2017-VIVIENDA ─ Plan Nacional de Saneamiento 2017 - 2021.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto Supremo aprueba el Plan Nacional de Saneamiento 2017 - 2021, que que implementa la Política Nacional de Saneamiento, es de obligatorio cumplimiento para los tres niveles de gobierno, los prestadores de servicios de saneamiento y los sectores y entidades involucradas con la gestión y prestación de los servicios de saneamiento. Su seguimiento, monitoreo y evaluación está a cargo del Ministerio de Vivienda, Construcción y Saneamiento (VCS) en su calidad de Ente Rector del sector saneamiento, en coordinación con los gobiernos regionales, gobiernos locales y otras entidades del Estado con competencias reconocidas en materia de saneamiento. El MVCS tiene competencias en materia de saneamiento, y como tal le corresponde planificar, normar y ejecutar las políticas nacionales y sectoriales conducentes para lograr como objetivo el acceso universal, sostenible y de calidad a los servicios de saneamiento. La estrategia diseñada para cumplir con el objetivo propuesto se sustenta en el desarrollo e implementación de los siguientes instrumentos: 1) Política Nacional de Saneamiento; 2) Plan Nacional de Saneamiento; 3) Ley Marco de los Servicios de Saneamiento y su Reglamento. La estructura del Plan Nacional de Saneamiento sigue la lógica de las operaciones de previsión y provisión de los servicios de saneamiento, las cuales tienen concordancia con los Ejes de Política aprobados en la Política Nacional de Saneamiento. La provisión de los servicios se encuentra a cargo de los prestadores de servicio de saneamiento en el ámbito urbano y rural, los cuales pueden ser empresas prestadoras de servicio de saneamiento público, privado o mixto, municipalidades, organizaciones comunales, operadores especializados.

Policy: Industry agreement on food waste.
Policy_Content: This Agreement between, on the one side, the Ministry of Climate and Environment, the Ministry of Agriculture and Food, the Ministry of Children and Family Affairs, the Ministry of Health and Care Services, and the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Fisheries, and, on the other side, the Norwegian food industry, seeks to promote a better use of resources and raw materials through the prevention of food waste throughout the food chain and to contribute to reducing the environmental consequences associated with food production and consumption in Norway. Based on the United Nations' sustainability target 12.3, an overall target of a 50% reduction in food waste in Norway is set by 2030. The reduction target of 50% by 2030 will be accomplished in two sub-targets of 15% reduction by 2020 and 30% by 2025.  For these purposes, the Agreement lays down a working definition of food waste. The Agreement is open for other relevant industry organizations to join at a later date, and progress shall be evaluated in 2020, 2025 and 2030.

Policy: Law No.  2118-VIII "On energy efficiency of buildings".
Policy_Content: This Law defines legal, socio-economic and organizational principles for activities in the field of energy efficiency of buildings and aims at reducing energy consumption in buildings. This Law regulates relations originating in the field of energy efficiency of buildings in order to increase the energy efficiency of buildings taking into account local climatic conditions and ensuring adequate living conditions and/ or vital activity of people in such buildings. State policy in the field of energy efficiency of buildings is based on the following principles: (a) ensuring an adequate level of energy efficiency of buildings in accordance with technical regulations, national standards, norms and rules; (b) stimulating the reduction of energy consumption in buildings; (c) ensuring the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions into the atmosphere; (d) creation of conditions for attraction of investments in order to implement measures to ensure (increase) the level of energy efficiency of buildings; (e) provision of thermo-modernization of buildings, stimulation of the use of renewable energy sources; and (f) the development and implementation of a national plan to increase the number of buildings with near-zero energy consumption. Energy efficiency of buildings shall be determined in accordance with the methodology developed with the consideration of the requirements of the legislation of the European Union, the Energy Community, harmonized European standards in the field of energy efficiency of buildings and approved by the central executive body, which ensures the formation of state policy in the field of construction. Certification of energy efficiency shall be mandatory for: (a) objects of construction (new construction, reconstruction, overhaul), which according to the class of consequences (liability) belong to objects with average (CC2) and significant (СС3) consequences, determined in accordance with the Law of Ukraine "On regulation of urban development activity "; (b) state-owned buildings with a heated area of more than 250 square meters, which are often visited by citizens and in all premises of which are located state authorities; (c) buildings with a heated area of more than 250 square meters, in all premises of which are located local government (in case of thermo-modernization of such buildings); and (d) buildings in which the thermo-modernization is carried out, for which is granted state support and which results in the achievement of the class of energy efficiency of the building not lower than the minimum requirements for the energy efficiency of the building.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Energy, Environment gen.

Policy: Climate Law (2017: 720).
Policy_Content: This Law contains provisions on the Government's climate policy work, and specifies what this work should be aimed at and how it should be conducted.  The Government shall pursue climate policy that 1. aims to prevent harmful interference in the climate system, 2. helps to protect the ecosystems and present and future generations against harmful effects of climate change, 3. focuses on reducing emissions of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases and preserving and creating processes in the environment that counteract climate change and its harmful effects, and 4. is based on a scientific approach and on relevant technical, social, economic and environmental considerations. The Law concerns, among other things, the setting and meeting of emission targets and specific duties of the Government such as yearly budgeting for climate change action, preparing a four-year climate change action plan and submitting such plan to the Parliament. the Law sets out the contents of such a plan.

Policy: Order No. 314 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on forest management for agricultural purposes.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the rules of forest management for agricultural purposes and regulates relations in this sphere. Agro-forestry shall be prohibited in the following categories of forests: (a) in forests located in water protection zones, except for haymaking and beekeeping; (b) in forest park areas; (c) in green areas, except for haymaking and beekeeping and also in green areas, it is prohibited to erect fences for haymaking and beekeeping purposes; (c) in urban forests; (d) in protected forest plots; (e) in plots of forest areas under particular surveillance, except for haymaking and beekeeping; and (f) within the boundaries of coastal protective strips shall be prohibited ploughing of land, grazing of agricultural animals and organization of summer camps and baths. Forests can be used for agriculture (haymaking, grazing of agricultural animals, beekeeping, reindeer ranching, cultivation of crops and other agricultural activities). Citizens and legal entities shall be authorized to use forests for agriculture in accordance with forest lease contracts.

Policy: Government Decree No. 455 on the allocation of funds of the National Fund for Agricultural and Rural Development.
Policy_Content: This Government Decree validates the Regulation on terms and conditions for allocation of funds of the National Fund for Agricultural and Rural Development (Annex 1); the List of risks for which insurance premiums in crop production, horticulture, viticulture and animal husbandry are subsidized from the National Fund for Agricultural and Rural Development (Annex 2); and the List of agricultural crops and livestock and poultry species, for which insurance premiums are subsidized from the National Fund for Agricultural and Rural Development (Annex 3). This Regulation establishes support measures, as well as the terms, conditions and procedure for the provision of the Fund's resources, including mandatory conditions necessary for obtaining funds, eligibility criteria for recipients, maximum annual amount of allocated financial support, and procedure for obtaining, verifying, authorizing, recording payments. Activities to provide subsidies in agriculture and rural areas shall be performed on the following principles: (a) predictability and stability of legal regulation; (b) transparency of the decision-making process; (c) equal treatment; (f) efficiency based on financial and economic reasoning; (g) continuity of support processes for agricultural producers; (h) responsibility of recipients of subsidies as a prerequisite for obtaining financial assistance; and (i) reasonable costs. The requirements of this Regulation apply to all agricultural producers operating in the territory controlled by the bodies of the Republic of Moldova, including the territory of the district of Dubasari, located beyond the Rybnitsa-Tiraspol route, which are not in the process of insolvency/liquidation. Recipients of subsidies must not perform alienation/transfer in any form the objects of investments for which a subsidy has been received, as well as writing-off, uprooting of perennial plantations, slaughtering and loss of livestock for the time periods that vary from one to five years, depending upon plant and livestock species.

Policy: Regulations on impact assessments (No. 854 of 2017).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, established by Royal Decree pursuant to Act No. 71 of 2008 and the EEA Agreement Annex XX No. 1 letter a (Directive 2014/52/EU) and no. 1 letter g (Directive 2001/42/EC), seek to ensure that consideration for the environment and society is taken into account during the preparation of plans and initiatives, and when considering and on what conditions plans or initiatives may be implemented. The Regulation set out procedures and requirements for assessment of plans and initiatives that shall always have an impact assessment and a planning programme or notification, plans and initiatives in accordance with other legislation that shall always have an impact assessment, but not a notification, and plans and initiatives that shall have an impact assessment if they can have significant impact on the environment or society. In the assessment of whether a plan or initiative may have a significant impact on the environment or society, the characteristics of the plan or initiative, the location and environmental impact of the plan or initiative, and the intensity etc., must be taken into consideration. The location and impact on the environment including an assessment of whether the plan or initiative may lead to or come in conflict with, among other things, protected areas, endangered species or natural habitats, major redistribution of agricultural, natural, outdoor areas as well as reindeer husbandry, or areas regulated for agriculture and that are of great importance to agricultural activities, or may lead to risk of flooding or significant contamination or greenhouse gas emissions. The competent authority for purposes of these Regulations is the planning authority for the relevant plan under the Planning and Building Act, and the decision-making authority for initiatives under other legislation. Initiatives set out in Annex II, which are dealt with in accordance with the Energy, Water Resources or Watercourse Regulation Act always require an impact assessment, but not a notification. The impact assessment shall identify and describe the factors that may have a significant impact on the environment and society, including, among other things, the water environment.

Policy: Health Act, 2017 (No. 21 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns human health in Kenya involving also issues regarding animal health, water and the environment and food. It establishes the Kenya Health Professions Oversight Authority, the National Research for Health Committee and the Health Sector Inter-Governmental Consultative Forum. The objects of this Act are to— Objects of the Act include, amongst others, protection, promotion and fulfilment of the rights of children to basic nutrition and health care services contemplated in Articles 43(1) (c) and 53(1) (c) of the Constitution. The national health system shall ensure that measures for managing environmental risk factors to curtail occurrence and distribution of diseases are put in place and implemented. In particular such measures shall target, amongst other: (a) the reduction of disease burden arising from poor environmental hygiene, sanitation, occupational exposure and environmental pollution; the reduction of morbidity and mortality of waterborne, foodborne and vector transmitted diseases, and mitigate the health effects of climate change. The national government department of health shall formulate national strategic and operation policies that shall provide for equal opportunities measures that shall ensure that food and water available for human consumption are hygienic and safe and develop risk-based, sustainable, integrated food safety systems, occupational health practices, water safety systems, appropriate housing, and vector and vermin control. They shall also concern other hygiene and environmental safety issues.

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 353 of 2017 on Requirements for Green Public Procurement and Procedures for Application
Policy_Content: This Regulation prescribes the principles, requirements, and procedures for the application of the green public procurement, groups of products, services, and works subject to the application of the green procurement requirements, tender evaluation criteria, conditions for the execution of a procurement contract, and control procedures; the requirements and criteria for green procurement applied in the public procurement of such products and services subject to mandatory application of the green procurement (Annex 1); the requirements and criteria of the green procurement which can be applied in the public procurement of works, as well as other priority product and service groups (Annex 2); and the methodology of life cycle costs for energy consuming products (Annex 3). The requirements and criteria of the green procurement contained in the public procurement documentation shall be applied to the set forth environmental requirements and criteria for a specific product and service group or works to ensure the compliance of the public procurement with the principles of the green procurement. The objective of promoting the green procurement is to reduce the environmental impact of products, services, and works that are purchased in public procurements throughout the entire life cycle thereof, at the same time contributing to environmentally friendly development of product and service market and increasing the competitive capacity of the local economy. The Ministry of Environmental Protection and Regional Development shall be the institution responsible for the procedures for the application of the green procurement, implementation, supervision, and evaluation thereof.

Policy_Content: This Act lays down some amendments and addenda to the Act on the promotion of renewable energy sources and high efficiency cogeneration. In particular, the present Act lays down provisions concerning marketing of biofuels and bioliquids (supplemented art. 14c). A legal entity or natural person who places biofuels or bioliquids on the market in the Slovak Republic is obliged to: (a) issue a certificate of origin of biofuel or bioliquids; (b) ensure that the certificate of origin of a biofuel or bioliquid is verified by a qualified person; (c) send a copy of the certificate of origin of biofuel or bioliquids to the Slovak Hydrometeorological Institute; (d) use the mass balance system for biofuels and bioliquids when demonstrating compliance with the sustainability criteria. Furthermore, the Act regulates provisions concerning advanced biofules. Advanced biofuels are biofuels made from raw materials or fuels listed in Annex 1a.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Decree of 20 June 2007 of approval of the Regulation on the management of meat waste.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree is to regulate the management of meat waste and animal corpses generated by livestock activities derived from the management of wildlife, veterinary, slaughtering industries and establishments carrying out meat production and transformation activities and other activities that can generate similar waste. This Decree aims at guaranteeing the protection of both directly exposed people and public health, the protection of the environment and the preservation of natural resources. This Regulation applies to: a) farms, facilities and equipment intended for animal breeding; b) hospitals, clinics and consultations that carry out veterinary services of welfare services; c) establishments and centres carrying out production activities, manufacture, processing of meat and meat products; d) other activities from which waste can be generated that, due to its typology and management, can be assimilated to meat waste, including the possession by private individuals of domestic animals or parts of animals originating from hunting species. The management of meat residues in the production centres must be carried out  according to segregation, safety and economic criteria.

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 169 validating the Regulation on protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Salt Lake”.
Policy_Content: The scope of creation of protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Salt Lake” shall be prevention of adverse anthropogenic effects thereon. The protection zone shall be located on land of state forest fund includes forest plantations represented by soft-leaved and coniferous species. The boundaries of protection zone are indicated on site around the perimeter by special warning signs and notice boards. Any activities causing negative (adverse) impact on natural complexes of nature monument shall be prohibited, in particular: (a) placement of cemeteries, cattle burial grounds, domestic and non-domestic waste disposal, radioactive, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances disposal; (b) aerial measures for combating pests and plant diseases; (c) placement of gas stations, fuel and lubricant warehouses, service stations used for technical inspection and repair of vehicles, and washing of motor vehicles; (d) placement of special storage points for pesticides and agrochemicals and application thereof; (e) discharge of effluent and drainage water; (f) exploration and mining of widespread minerals; (g) clear cutting of forest species; (h) damaging forest plantations, vegetation and soil cover; and (i) making fires, organization of rest areas, bivouacs, tourist stations, camps (except for specially equipped areas) and staging points. The following activities shall be authorized within the boundaries of protection zone: (a) forest management, care of forests and sanitary rehabilitation arrangements performed in accordance with forest management regulations; (b) recreational development; (c) scientific research; (d) ecological education; (e) collection of berries, mushrooms, fruits, edible nuts by citizens for individual personal needs without disturbance of natural growing conditions thereof and within authorized time periods; and (f) performance of the arrangements for conservation and reproduction of wild fauna and wild flora species, rare and endangered species of mushrooms, wild fauna and wild flora.

El SUIA es la herramienta informática de uso obligatorio para las entidades que conforman el Sistema Nacional Descentralizado de Gestión Ambiental, administrado por la Autoridad Ambiental Nacional, y será el único medio en línea empleado para realizar todo el proceso de regularización ambiental, de acuerdo a los principios de celeridad, simplificación de trámites y transparencia. El objetivo general del Módulo de Regularización y Control Ambiental mediante el sistema SUIA, es el de prestar un servicio informático ambiental de calidad a los promotores de proyectos, obras o actividades, para los procesos de regularización, control y seguimiento ambiental de una manera eficiente, así como la recopilación, evaluación y uso de la información institucional.

Se dispone que en ningún caso las personas físicas y su grupo familiar, entendido este como relaciones de primer grado (cónyuge, hijos e hijas), las personas jurídicas y sus empresas relacionadas operando como un grupo de interés económico, podrán mantener vigentes más de 600 hectáreas bajo contrato en la modalidad de protección de bosque y 750 hectáreas bajo contrato en la modalidad de reforestación bajo el Programa de Pago por Servicios Ambientales. Policy: Decree No. 375 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on collection and use of the moneys of the Special Fund of ecology, environmental protection and waste management.
Policy_Content: The Government decrees to validate the Regulation on formation and use of the finances of Special Fund of ecology, environmental protection and waste management. The Fund shall not be considered legal entity and shall perform financing of environmental projects and activities aimed at preserving and reproducing biological resources, carrying out research activities in the field of ecology, environmental protection and waste management, environmental monitoring, organizational work on environmental advocacy and education, training, retraining and improvement of the qualifications of specialists. Policy: Decree No. 377 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on Centre for specialized analytical control in the field of environmental protection under the jurisdiction of the State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources.
Policy_Content: The Regulation defines the main tasks, functions, rights and responsibilities, as well as the organization of activities, in particular ensuring analytical (laboratory) control in the sphere of environmental protection of the Centre for specialized analytical control in the field of environmental protection. The main tasks of the Centre shall be as follows: (a) systematization and generalization of the results of analytical control, information on sources of air pollution, surface water, soil, fauna and flora; (b) organization of analytical control over observance of environmental safety requirements for waste disposal, ensuring radiation safety; (c) management and provision of organizational, methodological and practical assistance to the territorial offices of the State Committee on Geology and Mineral Resources in performance of work on monitoring of pollution sources, analytical control over compliance with the requirements of environmental legislation; (d) development, improvement, completion and implementation of progressive sampling methods and physical and chemical analyses of emissions, discharges and soil contamination; and (e) ensuring the implementation of control and arbitration measurements of emissions into the atmosphere, analyzing the quality of discharged sewage and environmental pollution.

Policy: Decreto N° 47 - Que adopta el Plan "Panamá: El País de Todos – Cero Pobreza”.
Policy_Content: El Plan “Panamá: El País de Todos – Cero Pobreza” es un documento estratégico de alcance nacional, cuyo objetivo principal es la reducción la pobreza en el país, estableciendo como horizonte temporal el 2030. Más precisamente, el documento se enmarca dentro del compromiso asumido por la República de Panamá ante los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible. En este contexto, el objetivo es contribuir a erradicar la pobreza extrema; reducir a la mitad la pobreza multidimensional; garantizar un sistema de protección social integral de acuerdo al ciclo de vida, con énfasis en personas en situación de pobreza y vulnerabilidad. Para alcanzar estos objetivos se prevé el desarrollo y la implementación de políticas y programas que prioricen a la población con mayores carencias y le faciliten el acceso a la asistencia social, la satisfacción de sus necesidades básicas y el vínculo con oportunidades productivas. Se hace especial hincapié en las poblaciones más vulnerables ubicadas en ciertos distritos, y localizadas principalmente en comarcas indígenas.

Policy: Order No. 302 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology of the Russian Federation validating the Regulation on the state nature biosphere reserve “Pechora-Ilych”.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the state nature biosphere reserve “Pechora-Ilych” shall be located in the Republic of Komi. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) the protection of natural areas in order to conserve biological diversity and maintain in a natural state protected natural complexes and objects; (b) the organization and performance of scientific research, including keeping and updating of the Annals of Nature; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) environmental education and development of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in the training of scientific personnel and specialists in the field of environmental protection. On the territory of the state nature biosphere reserve “Pechora-Ilych” shall be prohibited the following activities: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (b) commercial fisheries, and artisanal and sport fishing except for some exceptional cases; (c) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, and hunting gear; (d) exploration of minerals and mining; (e) soil disturbance; (f) activities that entail changes in the hydrological regime of land; (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) clear cutting of forests; (i) timber extraction and harvesting of non-timber products; (j) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (k) plowing of land, with the exception of measures for forest firefighting; (l) haymaking, except for ensuring fire safety; (m) explosive works; (n) burning of vegetation and grassland fires, except for case of extinguishing forest fires; (o) water logging; (p) introduction of alien species; (q) transit and stay of motor vehicles; (r) stay with dogs, except for service dogs; (s) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; and (t) disturbance and feeding of wild fauna species by the visitors.

Policy: Public Procurement Act (2017)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to ensure the transparent, purposeful and economical use of the financial resources of the contracting authority, the equal treatment of persons and the effective use of existing competition in public procurement. Policy: Ley de Cambio Climático para el Estado de Tamaulipas.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce el derecho a un medio ambiente adecuado para el desarrollo y bienestar y, en este marco, establece disposiciones en tema de adaptación y mitigación del cambio climático.   Una vez establecidas las autoridades competentes en la materia y sus relativas atribuciones, la Ley regula el sistema estatal de cambio climático, el cual funge como un mecanismo permanente de concurrencia, comunicación, colaboración y coordinación sobre la Política Estatal de Cambio Climático. En la formulación, ejecución y evaluación de la Política Estatal de Cambio Climático, el Ejecutivo del Estado y los ayuntamientos observarán, entre otros, los siguientes principios: a) sustentabilidad en el aprovechamiento o uso de los ecosistemas y los elementos naturales que los integran; b) corresponsabilidad entre el Estado y la sociedad en general, en la realización de acciones para la mitigación y adaptación a los efectos adversos del cambio climático; c) precaución, cuando haya amenaza de daño grave o irreversible, la falta de total certidumbre científica no deberá utilizarse como razón para posponer las medidas de mitigación y adaptación para hacer frente a los efectos adversos del cambio climático; d) prevención; e) adopción de patrones de producción y consumo por parte de los sectores público, social y privado para transitar hacia una economía de bajas emisiones en carbono; f) integralidad y transversalidad, adoptando un enfoque de coordinación y cooperación entre órdenes de gobierno, así como con los sectores social y privado para asegurar la instrumentación de la política nacional de cambio climático; g) participación ciudadana; h) responsabilidad ambiental: quien realice obras o actividades que afecten o puedan afectar al medio ambiente, estará obligado a prevenir, minimizar, mitigar, reparar, restaurar y, en última instancia, a la compensación de los daños que cause.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 527 validating the Regulation on the procedure for granting subsidies for seed production.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for granting subsidies for seed production, sets forth eligible categories and the criteria for selection of legal entities (except for state (municipal) institutions) and individual entrepreneurs for allocation of subsidies, and the procedure for return of subsidies to the regional budget in case of violation of the conditions established for their allocation, reporting requirements, requirements for monitoring of compliance with the terms, objectives and procedures for granting subsidies and responsibility for their violation. Subsidies are provided to reimburse part of the costs associated with the production or purchase of seeds of crops, as well as agrochemical works, within regional budgetary funds envisaged to the current fiscal year. The amount of subsidies cannot exceed 99% of the actual costs associated with the production or purchase of seeds of crops and agrochemical activities. Recipient of the subsidies must comply with the following requirements: (a) the applicant must have no unfulfilled obligation to pay taxes, duties, insurance premiums, fines, penalties, interest payable in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation on taxes and duties; (b) the applicant must have no overdue debts on return to the regional budget of subsidies, budget investments granted also in accordance with other legal acts, or any other overdue indebtedness to the regional budget; (c) during the subsidized period the recipients - legal entities must not be in the process of reorganization, liquidation or bankruptcy proceedings, the activities of the recipient have not been suspended in accordance with the procedure stipulated by the legislation of the Russian Federation, and the recipients who are individual entrepreneurs have not ceased their activities as an individual entrepreneur; (d) the recipient is not a foreign legal entity, as well as a Russian legal entity, in the authorized (share) capital of which the share of participation of foreign legal entities, the place of registration of which is a state or territory included in the list of states or territories approved by the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation, providing preferential tax treatment and (or) which do not stipulate the disclosure or presentation of information related to financial transactions (offshore zones) with regard to such legal entities exceeds 50 percent in the aggregate; and (e) recipients should not receive other funds from the regional budget.

On the territory of the reserve, any activity shall be prohibited any activity that contradicts the objectives of the state nature reserve and the regime for its special protection, including: (a) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (b) commercial fisheries; (c) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, and hunting gear; (d) exploration of minerals and mining; (e) soil disturbance; (f) activities that entail changes in the hydrological regime of land; (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) clear cutting of forests; (i) timber extraction and harvesting of non-timber products; (j) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (k) plowing of land, with the exception of measures for forest firefighting; (l) haymaking, except for ensuring fire safety; (m) explosive works; (n) burning of vegetation and grassland fires, except for case of extinguishing forest fires; (o) water logging; (p) introduction of alien species; (q) transit and stay of motor vehicles; (r) stay with dogs, except for service dogs; (s) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; and (t) disturbance and feeding of wild fauna species by the visitors.
