Policy: Arrêté n° 627/MIDEC du 13 Juin 2017 portant Réorganisation des Délégations Régionales de la Décentralisation et du Développement Local.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté fixe la réorganisation des Délégations Régionales de la Décentralisation et du Développement Local La Délégation Régionale a pour mission générale d’animer le développement territorial et d’accompagner les collectivités territoriales dans la mise en œuvre des missions qui leur sont dévolues. Elle est chargée notamment de :  la planification régionale et de l’étude d’impact des projets régionaux de développement local conformément à l’article 44 du décret n° 086-2012/PM du 28 mai 2012, modifié, fixant les attributions du Ministre de l’Intérieur et de la décentralisation et l’organisation centrale de son département ; appuyer les collectivités territoriales et de veiller à la cohérence de l’approche conseil menée au niveau local avec les politiques nationales ; du contrôle de légalité et du secrétariat des commissions régionales de tutelle ;suivi des outils et projets de développement local ; aider à l’amélioration de la gestion des finances locales ; suivi des plans communaux de développement (PDC) en veillant à leur cohérence avec les politiques nationales d’une part et, le cas échéant, avec les programmes régionaux de développement ; contribuer à la mise en œuvre de la stratégie nationale de formation des acteurs de la décentralisation ; la collecte des informations pertinentes pour l’alimentation de la base de données sur les collectivités territoriales.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 29 articles, regulates the Deliberative Council for the Forest Development Fund (FUNDEFLOR), created by Law No. 14.961 of 13 December 2016. It regulates the above mentioned Council of FUNDEFLOR, which will decide on the use of the resources of the fund, through a budget and an annual and multi-annual application plan, within the purpose of the State agricultural policy for planted forests and their products. Policy: Decree-Law No. 64/2017 defining a special and extraordinary regime for the installation and operation of new biomass valorisation centres.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 8 articles, defines a special and extraordinary regime for the installation and operation, by municipalities or by inter-municipal communities or by associations of new biomass valorisation centres. In addition, it defines support and incentive measures to ensure their implementation, with the fundamental objective of forest protection, forest management and preservation, and fire-fighting. The power in the public utility grid to be allocated under this Decree-Law is limited and cannot exceed 60 MW on the mainland and a maximum of 15 MW per power plant.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 66/2017 establishing the legal regime for the recognition of forest management entities (EGF).
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, consisting of 15 articles, establishes the legal regime for the recognition of forest management entities (EGF), which are private companies incorporated under the terms of the Cooperative Code or under the Commercial Companies Code, whose corporate purpose is forestry management and exploitation. The EGF aims at promoting and facilitating the joint management of forest areas, preferably in the small parcels, according to the principles of sustainable forest management, through the constitution of exploration areas that allow the valuation and adequate profitability of the related assets. Recognized EGFs have a maximum period of two years from the date of their recognition to start the forest certification process, within the framework of internationally accepted certification systems, namely the Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification (PEFC) or the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC), and must obtain their certificate by the end of the third year of recognition.

Policy: Law No. 04/2017/QH14 on Support for Small- and Medium-sized Enterprises.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 35 articles divided into four Chapters, prescribes principles, contents and resources of support for small- and medium-sized enterprises, in particular for those owned by women; and responsibilities of agencies, organizations and individuals involved in supporting micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises identified in the following sectors: agriculture, forestry, fisheries; industry, construction; trade and service. Policy: National Employment Strategy 2017-2030.
Policy_Content: The vision of the Timor-Leste National Employment Strategy is to generate productive employment opportunities for the Timorese population, reducing unemployment and transitioning to formal employment opportunities, as a central means of nation building and wealth creation. The Timor-Leste 2017-2030 NES is inspired by and aligned with the 2011-2030 SDP and aims to strengthen and facilitate the operationalisation of the employment dimensions of the SDP, providing a framework for a strengthened and cohesive focus on employment. Therefore the objectives of the NES are: To provide a strategy for GOTL and civil society to have a stronger and more cohesive focus on employment. To operationalise the employment dimensions of the SDP ensuring that employment is incorporated into macroeconomic and sectoral policies, as well as labour market strategies in particular in rural areas, and between people with and without disabilities.

Policy: Program of the Government of the Republic of Armenia 2017-2022.
Policy_Content: The Republic of Armenia (RA) Government presents a multi-sectoral programme for activities that will guarantee the country’s sustainable development in the period between 2017 and 2022 with a focus on large-scale reforms. The vision of the program is to have a safe, fair, free and smart Armenia. The Programme is focused on achieving peace bolstered with strong defense, inclusive growth for all segments of the society and active engagement of all Armenian citizens in the public life. Through the implementation of this Programme, during 2017-2022, the RA Government sets the following goals: (i) To ensure faster economic growth as compared to developed countries by achieving approximately an average of 5 percent GDP growth; (ii) To achieve a significant growth in exports with the exports of goods and services reaching 40-45 percent as a share of GDP; (iii) To achieve poverty reduction by lowering it by 12 percentage points; (iv) To achieve 25 percent increase in nominal minimum salaries by optimally combining employment growth and compensation for dignified jobs and, taking into account structural unemployment and risks of reduction in the country’s competitiveness, the proportion of the mitigating minimum wage and median wage.

Policy: Trade, Commerce & Manufacturing Sector 2017/18 – 2020/21 Plan.
Policy_Content: The Trade, Commerce and Manufacturing Strategy is a national policy with a multi-sectoral approach. Its vision is  to provide trade, commerce and manufacturing for enhanced growth and development. The TCM-SP has been an integral part of the Samoa Strategy for Development 2012-2016 to ensure “Boosting of Productivity for Sustainable Development” and features measures to revitalise exports and support the agriculture and manufacturing sectors. The TCM SP is also linked to relevant regional and international policies and regulatory frameworks and obligations. The value chain approach streamlined the activities of the TCM-SP to be more direct and precise in implementation. In light of this, the TCM-SP eventuated to encompass four pillars: Pillar 1. Industrial Supply and Productivity; Pillar 2. Processing and Value Addition; Pillar 3. Market Access; and Pillar 4. Sector Support and Planning Framework. The MTEF for the Trade, Commerce & Manufacturing Sector Plan 2017/18-2020/21 (TCMSP) has brought together financial and expenditure planning data and attempted to estimate total planned expenditures from all sources of finance available, primarily the TCMSP, annual budget estimates, corporate plans and feedback key stakeholders. These inputs have been used to generate the first estimates of expenditure over the period Financial Year 2017/18 – 2020/21.

Policy: Agricultural Policy and Strategic Framework, June 2017.
Policy_Content: This revised agricultural policy and strategic framework provides a coherent policy framework to address the key challenges in Timor-Leste. The Government recognizes that there is no simple "solution by technology". The Government will therefore re-orient agricultural and rural development policies that will redefine incentives and reduce barriers to food and agricultural systems transformation. Particular attention will be given to supporting small-scale, low-income farmers in strengthening their capacity to manage risks and adopt effective strategies to adapt to climate change. A key feature of this agricultural policy is a fundamental shift from a 'technology solution' to an integrated approach to the food and agriculture system. Central to achieving food security and sector growth is a shift towards diversification of agriculture with alternative, nutrient and climate-resilient crops with the potential to generate income, as well as the need for self-sufficiency in food (not just rice).

Policy: Federal Law No. 9 of 2017 on Veterinary Products.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 36 articles aims at regulating the handling, trading, marketing and circulation of veterinary products in the Emirates. The Law establishes that the Ministry of Climate Change and Environment is mandated to (i) facilitate the licensing and registration of companies and factories, as well as veterinary products; (ii) review technical reports received from international organizations or bodies on veterinary products and companies; (iii) monitor markets of veterinary products and prohibit the import or prevent the circulation, withdraw or retrieve the veterinary product, suspend or cancel the registration in case modifications or if reports on the toxicity or serious side effects or existence of a defect in its quality or effectiveness are not submitted; (iv) receive reports from hospitals or veterinary clinics; (v) publish lists of prohibited veterinary products; (vi) approve the advertisement of veterinary products; and (vii) agree to import veterinary products for research or marketing purposes. The Law provides also for (i) the establishment of a Registration Committee of Veterinary Products and their Companies that shall, among others, ensure that the Veterinary Products Plants apply the principles of good practice of pharmaceutical manufacturing upon registration; and (ii) the disposal of the destroyed or expired veterinary products in a way that respects public safety conditions and does not lead to the pollution of environment; (iii) the obligation for companies, factories and warehouses of veterinary products to obtain the required license from the Ministry prior to commencing the practice of any activity; (iv) notification by veterinary companies, factories and warehouses to the ministry of any change in the veterinary product or manufacturer.

Policy_Content: La Política Nacional de Semillas de Costa Rica 2017-2030, tiene como objetivo promover el desarrollo del sector semillerista costarricense con un enfoque articulador de los intereses y recursos de sus integrantes, para mejorar la eficiencia productiva del sector agropecuario, en función de los retos que plantean la seguridad alimentaria y nutricional, la preservación de la biodiversidad, el cambio climático, la globalización de mercados y la garantía de la calidad de las semillas. Policy: Federal Law No.14 of 2017 on trading in Petroleum Products.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 23 articles aims at (i) organising the trade of petroleum products; (ii) determining the conditions and procedures of trade of petroleum products; and (iii) combating the practices intended to harm the national economy, the security and the environmental safety related to the present Law. The application of the provisions of this Law includes free zones, special development zones and investment zones. The Law establishes that to trade petroleum products in the territory of the State must be authorized by a license issued on the Trading Authorization whose rules are established by the Minister of Energy. A register shall be created at the Ministry, in which the data of the authorized persons and the facilities and means of transportation through which the trading is made shall be recorded. A Committee for the Organisation of Trading of Petroleum Products shall be formed in each Emirate with the following main tasks (i) study the applications for issuance of the Trading Authorizations referred to it by the Competent Authority; and (ii) verify the fulfillment of the adopted security and environmental safety requirements by the means of transport, the means of manufacture and storage, and the establishments through which the trading will be done. Powers of the Competent Authority are provided for at art.7, while the Obligations of the licensee are provided for at art.13.

Policy: Access to Biological and Genetic Resources and Associated Traditional Knowledge Act (No. 2 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the conservation, evaluation and sustainable use of biological and genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge. Its objects are, among other things, to - (a) maintain and improve the diversity of biological and genetic resources as means of sustaining life support systems; (b) recognise, protect and support the inalienable rights of local communities over their genetic resources and associated traditional knowledge; (c) provide arrangements and procedures for access to resources and knowledge subject to prior informed consent of the rights holders and mutually agreed terms; (d) develop and promote appropriate mechanisms for a fair and equitable sharing of benefits; (e) ensure the effective participation of concerned local communities.

Policy: Loi n° 24-2017 du 9 juin 2017 relative à la création des zones économiques spéciales, à la détermination de leur régime et de leur organisation.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée des zones économiques spéciales (espace géographique délimité au sein du territoire national constituant une zone de développement prioritaire, administré par un organe spécifique de planification et de développement), et détermine leur régime et leur organisation. Les organes d'orientation et de gestion des zones économiques spéciales sont : le comité national d'orientation des zones économiques spéciales ; l'autorité de régulation des zones économiques spéciales; l’agence de planification, de promotion et de développement des zones économiques spéciales.

Policy: Loin° 25 -2017 du 9 juin 2017 portant création de l'Agence de planification, de promotion et de développement des zones économiques spéciales.
Policy_Content: La présente loi crée l’Agence de planification, de promotion et de développement des zones économiques spéciales. L’Agence de planification de promotion et de développement des zones économiques spéciales planifie, développe et supervise les zones économiques spéciales. A ce titre, elle a pour missions d'élaborer l’ensemble des études, des plans généraux, techniques, économiques et, financiers se rapportant à la conception, à l'aménagement et à la réalisation des zones économiques spéciales; réaliser et entretenir les infrastructures, les bâtiments, les entrepôts et les espaces dons les zones économiques spéciales ; louer ou sous-louer aux entreprises, des bâtiments, des entrepôts et espaces aménagés dans les zones économiques spéciales ; recevoir et instruire les demandes d'agrément des investisseurs au régime des zones économiques spéciales ; recevoir des parties publiques ou privées des prêts et émettre des titres d'emprunt pour financer le développement des zones économiques spéciales ; assurer la gestion du guichet unique charge de centraliser l’ensemble des formalités administratives et la promotion commerciale et industrielle des zones économiques spéciales ; assurer, de concert avec les administrations concernées, la promotion des zones économiques spéciales ; veiller au développement harmonieux des zones économiques spéciales; conclure avec les investisseurs les conventions d'investissement ; accomplir, d'une manière générale, toutes opérations commerciales, industrielles ou financières en rapport avec son objet.

Policy: Nature Conservation Amendment Act, 2017 (No. 3 of 2017).
Policy_Content: This Act amends various sections of the Nature Conservation Ordinance, 1975 and inserts new provisions on the granting of concessions by the Minister relating to sustainable tourism activities in game parks, nature reserves and other protected areas. The Minister may also establish a renewable electricity source for the purposes of the management of game parks, nature reserves and other protected areas or protection of the environment or the combating of climate change. The objectives of granting such concessions shall be, among other things, to - (a) enhance the conservation of biodiversity and the maintenance of the ecological integrity of protected areas and other State land; (b) enhance the ability of the Ministry to effectively manage protected areas and wildlife resources on other State land where applicable and to control and monitor tourism operations and other commercial use of wild animal or plant resources; (d) enhance through concessions the economic empowerment of formerly disadvantaged Namibians and rural communities living in and around protected areas and their entrance into the tourism and other wildlife-based industries. In case of concessions awarded on State land that is not a protected area, a right of leasehold from the communal land board concerned is required in terms of Part 2 of the Communal Land Reform Act, 2002. The Minister shall grant a concession that is in line with the management objectives and management plan of the protected area for which an application for concessions has been made. Other amendments of the Act concern offences and penalties.

Policy: Law No. 2095-VIII "On Energy Efficiency Fund".
Policy_Content: This Law defines legal, economic and organizational grounds for the establishment and operation of Energy Efficiency Fund established to support energy efficiency initiatives, the introduction of incentive and support measures for improving energy efficiency of buildings and energy conservation, in particular in the residential sector, taking into account the national energy efficiency plan , reduction of carbon dioxide emissions in order to implement the Paris Agreement, implementation of the acquis communautaire of the European Union and the Treaty establishing the Energy Community, compliance with Ukraine's international obligations in the field of energy efficiency. The Fund is public institution, a legal entity of public law set up by the Cabinet of Ministers. The Fund is constituted to promote the achievement of overall energy saving in final consumption taking into account Ukraine's national targets for energy efficiency, as well as to implement measures aimed at their achievement as determined in national energy efficiency strategy and energy efficiency plans approved by the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine. Method of сalculation of energy savings is approved by the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine in accordance with the acquis communautaire of the European Union and the Treaty on the Establishment of Energy Community. Supervisory Council shall be set up to oversee operation of the Fund. Procedure for examination and decision-making related to application on partial recovery of costs of energy efficiency measures shall include: (a) performance of the preliminary energy audit and registration of the application and supporting documents; (b) submitting an application by the final beneficiary or his authorized representative to the representative to the Fund; (c) consideration of the application for compliance with the Fund's programs; (d) decision-making on the compliance of the application with the Fund's programs and determining the size of the grant or the rejection of the application; (e) Fund's confirmation to the final beneficiary of the intention to provide partial reimbursement of the cost of the energy efficiency measures indicated in application, provided that they are implemented in accordance with the submitted application and the Fund's program; (f) partial reimbursement of the cost of energy audit, subject to fulfillment of the conditions of the Fund's programs; (g) involvement of the final beneficiary of partner banks in financing energy efficiency measures on demand; (h) implementation of energy efficiency measures in accordance with the application and Fund's programs; (i) verification of implemented energy efficiency measures - installation (confirmation) of the compliance of the undertaken measures with the terms of the application and the Fund's programs; and (j) partial reimbursement of the cost of the undertaken measures related to energy efficiency (grant payment).  Final beneficiary of the grant shall be owner (co-owner) of the building.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA
Entry into force notes: This Law enters into force the day after the date of its official publication.

Policy: Order No. 283 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the particulars of performance of preventive and rehabilitation measures in areas of radioactive contamination of forests”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that in order to plan preventive and rehabilitation measures in areas of radioactive contamination of forests, radiation surveys shall be conducted. For the purpose of application of preventive and rehabilitation measures in zones of radioactive forest contamination on the basis of radiation survey data, forests contaminated with radionuclides shall be subdivided into zones of radioactive contamination. The objectives of the implementation of preventive and rehabilitation measures in the areas of radioactive contamination of forests shall be as follows: (a) preventing secondary contamination of forests with radionuclides; (b) preservation of environment-forming forest functions; (c) return to the economic activities of forest areas contaminated with radionuclides; and (d) timber extraction and procurement of other radiation free forest resources, as well as products of their processing. Forestry protection measures against fires, protection, reforestation, as well as in the forest management, envisaging felling of forest plantations, in zones of radioactive contamination of forests must be carried out before or after the fire season.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring (ROSHYDROMET) and the Government of Bashkortostan on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: The Agreement defines the main directions of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of the Republic of Bashkortostan of the Russian Federation and the constituent entities of the Russian Federation, requiring coordinated and joint decisions within the framework of fulfillment of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related areas, the implementation of state monitoring of the state of environment and pollution of the environment on the territory of the Republic of Bashkortostan, assessment of forecasts of its condition under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation in the field of state monitoring of the condition and pollution of the environment, the adoption and implementation of regional programs in the field of environmental monitoring, provision of governmental bodies and population of the Republic of Bashkortostan with information on the condition and pollution of environment. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Republic of Bashkortostan.

Policy: Resolution CNPE n. 14 establishing strategic guidelines for the biofuels policy to be proposed by the Executive Branch, creating the Ethanol and the Biodiesel Supply Monitoring Committees.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 9 articles, establishes strategic guidelines for the biofuels policy to be proposed by the Executive Branch, and creates the Ethanol and the Biodiesel Supply Monitoring Committees. The guidelines define the role of biofuels in the Brazilian energy context and the definition of public policies for the markets in which biofuels. Their objectives aim to perform the following activities: ensure the participation of the various biofuels stakeholders in the energy sector, with an emphasis on security of supply; guarantee an adequate ratio of efficiency and emissions in the production, distribution and use of biofuels, with the improvement of models already adopted in Brazil or in other countries, including mechanisms for evaluating emissions through life cycle analysis; recognize the capacity of biofuels to promote the decarbonization of the fuel market; respect the specific regulations for adding minimum anhydrous ethanol to the market; and The aim is to establish a policy for fuels jointly, with emphasis on the recognition of biofuels for competitive equality in the medium and long term; define instruments that contribute to attracting investments in the expansion of biofuel production and/or that induce the contracting of production in agreements with medium and long term validity; stimulate efficiency and healthy competition among biofuels as a mechanism to ensure balance in the energy matrix in the future; improve marketing rules to better take into account regional characteristics and synergies; etc.

Policy: Decree No. 360 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Regulation on the procedure for authorization of subsoil management, dangerous works, manufacturing, turnover of hazardous commodities, explosives and similar.
Policy_Content: The Regulation in Annex 1 establishes the procedure for issuance of authorization by State Inspection on Supervision over Geological Exploration, Safe Work Practices in Industry, Mining and Domestic Household Sector subordinated to the Cabinet of Ministers. The scope of the issuance of authorization shall be as follows: (a) in the field of subsoil management - the improvement of unified requirements for the rational, integrated use of mineral deposits and protection of mineral resources, as well as the implementation of state registration of stock movement and control over the safe conduct of mining operations; (b) in the sphere of dangerous work - control of safe operation of explosive technical devices and electrical installations at hazardous production facilities; (c) in the field of manufacturing - ensuring control over compliance with the rules for the work practices on the chemical protection of equipment, pipelines, tanks and other containers in which explosive, flammable, toxic, noxious substances are stored and (or) used; and (d) in the sphere of turnover of dangerous commodities and hazardous substances - the establishment and implementation of permanent state control in the transit of explosives and commodities, ensuring security in their transportation. The issuance of authorization shall be performed in accordance with the scheme contained in the Annex 1 and in accordance with the forms contained in the Annexes 2-4. Regulation of the procedure for authorization of turnover of explosives (Annex 2) establishes the procedure for issuance of authorization for activities related to manufacturing, purchase, storage, transportation and management of explosives, and it shall be applicable exclusively to legal persona operating in this sphere. The issuance of authorization shall be performed in accordance with the scheme contained in the Annex 2 and in accordance with the forms contained in the Annexes 3-9.

Policy: Tana River County Sand Harvesting Act, 2017 (No. 9 of 2017).
Policy_Content: The object and purpose of this Act is to provide a legal framework in the Tana River County for sand harvesting, i.e. the removal, extraction, harvesting or scooping of sand from a designated areas. In particular the Act provides, among other things, for the regulation of sustainable exploitation and utilisation of sand resource and other excavated material, registration of sand dealers and sand harvesting associations, environmental impact assessment and the rehabilitation and protection of the environment from harmful effects of sand harvesting and related activities. It also enables communities to participate in the management of sand harvesting. Sand harvesting from any riverbed shall be undertaken in a manner that allows adequate reserve of the sand to be retained to ensure water retention. Sand harvesting shall not be undertaken on any riverbank.

Policy: Law “On environmental security”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations in the field of environmental security in the process of performance of economic and other activities by legal and natural persons and is aimed at ensuring the vital interests of man and society, protecting the environment from the danger arising from anthropogenic and natural impact on it. Environmental security shall be based upon the following principles: (a) the supremacy of constitutional human rights to environmental security; (b) the creation and maintenance of the national system of environmental security as mandatory condition for the implementation of state strategy for sustainable social and economic development; (c) responsibility of public authorities and local self-government bodies, public associations, other legal entities and individuals for ensuring environmental safety in the relevant territory; (d) insurance of environmental risks; (e) compulsory insurance of civil liability of enterprises and industries that are a source of increased environmental risks; (f) independence of the environmental audit from economic and other activities; (g) location of economic and other activities (anthropogenic objects and natural-anthropogenic objects) on the basis of the results of the state environmental audit; (h) compulsory compensation for damage caused to the environment, public health, property of natural and legal persons; (i) restrictions on the performance of any type of activity and (or) suspension of activities that represent risks to environmental security; (j) access information in the field of environmental security; (k) liability of legal and natural persons for risks to environmental security; (l) public participation in elaboration and implementation of decisions affecting their rights to a favorable environment and ensuring environmental security; and (m) development of international cooperation in the field of environmental security.

Policy: Law amending Law No. 53-IV “On protection of ozone layer”.
Policy_Content: Article 5 shall be amended to add the following wording: “This Article establishes the competence of the authorized state body as follows: “The authorized state body for the protection of the ozone layer shall be responsible for: (a) organization and coordination the development and implementation of state programs for the protection of the ozone layer; (b) in the presence of a license, with the exception of cases envisaged for by the acting national legislation, issues one-time permits for the export and import of ozone-depleting substances and (or) products containing ozone-depleting substances; (c) performance of state control over the protection of the ozone layer, including consumption of ozone-depleting substances, as well as control over the development and implementation of measures for the timely collection and storage of residual amounts of ozone-depleting substances for recycling or disposal purposes; (d) issuance to legal persons- entrepreneurs, and individual entrepreneurs mandatory instructions for eliminating the identified violations of the national legislation related to protection of the ozone layer; (e)  decision-making on limiting or suspending the operation of separate plants, workshops and other facilities, if their operation is performed in violation of the national legislation on the protection of the ozone layer; (f) submittal of proposals to the relevant state bodies, local self-government bodies and (or) to the court to terminate the activities of business entities, regardless of their forms of ownership, and individual entrepreneurs in case of repeated and flagrant violations of the national legislation on the protection of the ozone layer; (g) determination of the procedure for the performance of business practices in relation to accounting for the consumption of ozone-depleting substances and their reporting on the handling of ozone-depleting substances; (h) keeping records of residual amounts of ozone-depleting substances in Turkmenistan until their final withdrawal from circulation; (i) performance of international cooperation in the field of protection of the ozone layer; and (j) performance of other plenary powers in the field of protection of the ozone layer in accordance with the national legislation”.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Law “On consumer cooperation”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the legal, organizational, economic and social basis for the establishment and operation of consumer cooperative societies and their unions. Consumer cooperative society is a voluntary association of individuals and (or) legal entities established on the basis of membership by means of association of its founders of property contributions for the implementation of trade and procurement activities, production and sale of products and other activities in order to meet the needs of their members, population and other consumers for various commodities and services, mainly in the territory of location. The main objectives of consumer societies are: (a) organization of wholesale and retail trade, public catering; (b) implementation of procurement activities, including through the purchase of agricultural commodities and raw materials from the population, individual entrepreneurs and legal entities, products of private farms and crafts, wild fruits, berries and mushrooms, medicinal plants and technical raw materials; (c) manufacturing of agricultural commodities, food and non-food products, products of industrial and technical purposes; (d) production of consumer goods, creation of jobs, development of national handicrafts and craftsmanship; (e) introduction of best practices in the system of trade and services; (f) modernization of consumer societies, development and implementation of proposals for the creation of their new structures; (g) provision of paid services to the population; and (h) participation in the international cooperative movement and promotion among shareholders of the foundations and objectives of international societies. Consumer cooperative societies shall be granted the right of purchase of land plots and land shares in accordance with the modalities envisaged by acting legislation.

Policy: Efficiency Manitoba Act (S.M. 2017, c. 18).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to: a) establish Efficiency Manitoba as a corporation with the mandate set out in section 4; b) establish savings targets Efficiency Manitoba is to meet in respect of the consumption of electrical energy and natural gas in Manitoba; and c) establish a funding and regulatory oversight framework for Efficiency Manitoba. Section 4 establishes that the mandate of Efficiency Manitoba is to: a) implement and support demand-side management initiatives to meet the savings targets and achieve any resulting reductions in greenhouse gas emissions in Manitoba; b) achieve additional reductions in the consumption of electrical energy or natural gas — including resulting reductions in the demand for electrical power — if the reductions can be achieved in a cost-effective manner; c) mitigate the impact of rate increases and delay the point at which capital investments in major new generation and transmission projects will be required by Manitoba Hydro to serve the needs of Manitobans; d) if any of the following are prescribed as being subject to demand-side management under this Act, carry out the prescribed duties in respect of them: i) demand for electrical power in Manitoba, (ii) potable water consumed in Manitoba, (iii) fossil fuels consumed in the transportation sector in Manitoba; and (e) promote and encourage the involvement of the private sector and other non-governmental entities in the delivery of its demand-side management initiatives. The text consists of 51 sections divided into 7 Parts.

Policy: Resolución Nº 080-2017-OSINFOR ─ Metodología de cálculo del monto de las multas a imponer por el Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba la Metodología de cálculo del monto de las multas a imponer por el Organismo de Supervisión de los Recursos Forestales y de Fauna Silvestre (OSINFOR), por infracción a la legislación forestal y de fauna silvestre, que tiene por objetivo establecer la actualización de la metodología para el cálculo de las multas que impone el OSINFOR a los titulares de títulos habilitantes por incurrir en las infracciones tipificadas en los artículos correspondientes del Reglamento para la Gestión Forestal, del Reglamento para la Gestión de Fauna Silvestre, del Reglamento para la Gestión de las Plantaciones Forestales y los Sistemas Agroforestales y del Reglamento para la Gestión Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre en Comunidades Nativas y Comunidades Campesinas. La finalidad de la Metodología es determinar la cuantía de la multa a aplicar por la comisión de infracciones a Ley forestal y de fauna silvestre, observando los criterios de gradualidad (proporcionalidad) que dispone la norma, a fin de establecer una sanción razonable.

Policy: Loi n° 2017-378 du 2 juin 2017 relative à l’aménagement, à la protection et à la gestion intégrée du littoral.
Policy_Content: La présente loi régit l’aménagement, à la protection et à la gestion intégrée du littoral. Le chapitre I fixe les dispositions générales et les définitions. Ce texte fixe les principes et les règles relatifs à: la protection, l’aménagement, et la gestion intégrée du littoral. II vise à: déterminer les principes qui gouvernent les conditions d'utilisation durable des ressources naturelles du littoral; élaborer les instruments de protection du littoral; mettre en place un cadre de gestion intégrée pour l'aménagement durable du littoral; encadrer les activités anthropiques dans les limites géographiques des espaces littoraux; maintenir les équilibrés environnementaux; lutter contre l'érosion côtière; préservera l'intégrité des sites, des paysages, des écosystèmes côtiers et du patrimoine marin. Ce texte s'applique aux espaces littoraux ci-après: le secteur Tabou-Sassandra-Fresco; le secteur Fresco-Vridi-Port-Bouet; le secteur Port-Bouet (borne frontalière BP 55). La présente loi s'applique également aux: unités géologiques du littoral; proche plateau continental; entités hydrologiques et hydrogéologiques; milieu marin côtier; diversité biologique marine du littoral; infrastructures économiques du littoral; écosystèmes lagunaires.

Policy: Arrêté n°2017-016 MEPS/CAB du 02 Juin 2017 déterminant la liste des travaux légers autorisés aux enfants dont l’âge est compris entre treize (13) et seize (16) ans.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté a pour objet de déterminer la liste des travaux légers autorisés aux enfants de l'un ou de l’autre sexe dont l’âge est compris entre treize (13) et seize (16) ans. Sont considérés comme travaux légers, ceux qui de par leur nature et de par les conditions dans lesquelles ils s’exercent : (a) ne sont pas susceptibles de porter préjudice à la santé ou au développement physique, mental, moral ou social des enfants; (b) ne sont pas de nature à porter préjudice à leur assiduité scolaire, à leur participation a des programmes d'orientation ou de formation professionnelle ou a leur aptitude à bénéficier de l‘instruction reçue.

Policy: Decreto Nº 20 - Modifica el Decreto Nº 677, que crea el banco público denominado BANECUADOR B.P.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto modifica el Decreto que crea el banco público denominado BANECUADOR B.P., respecto a su Objeto. Establece que el objeto del Banco será el ejercicio de actividades financieras previamente autorizadas por la Superintendencia de Bancos, y la prestación de servicios financieros de crédito, ahorro e inversión, bajo el criterio de intermediación financiera de recursos públicos y privados, atendiendo a la mediana empresa y empresas asociativas en sectores de producción, principalmente de agronegocios, comercio y servicios, con claro enfoque de desarrollo local y con preferencias en áreas urbano marginales, coadyuvando al fortalecimiento del “Plan Nacional del Buen Vivir”, a través de mecanismos de banca de primer y segundo piso. El BANECUADOR B.P. establecerá dentro de sus operaciones financieras el Banco del Pueblo, a través de las cuales se desarrollará productos y servicios financieros especiales y específicos para cubrir las necesidades de fi nanciamiento de los sectores de la micro y pequeña empresa, en condiciones fi nancieras preferentes.

Policy: Ley Orgánica de Agrobiodiversidad, Semillas y Fomento de la Agricultura Sustentable.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley Orgánica de Agrobiodiversidad, Semillas y Fomento de la Agricultura Sustentable, tiene por objeto proteger, revitalizar, multiplicar y dinamizar agrobiodiversidad en lo relativo a los recursos fitogenéticos para la alimentación y la agricultura; asegurar la producción, acceso libre y permanente a semillas de calidad y variedad, mediante el fomento e investigación científica y la regulación de modelos de agricultura sustentable; respetando las diversas identidades, saberes y tradiciones a fin de garantizar la autosuficiencia de alimentos sanos, diversos, nutritivos y culturalmente apropiados para alcanzar la soberanía alimentaria y contribuir al Buen Vivir o Sumak Kawsay. Asimismo, Garantiza el uso, producción, fomento, conservación e intercambio libre de la semilla campesina que comprende las semillas nativa y tradicional; y la producción, certificación, comercialización, importación, exportación y acceso a la semilla certificada, mediante la investigación y el fomento de la agricultura sustentable.

Policy: Presidential Decree PF-5066 “On measures for radical improvement of the efficiency of early warning system for the prevention of emergency situations and liquidation of the consequences thereof”.
Policy_Content: The President, with a view of further improvement of the efficiency of arrangements for the prevention of emergency situations and liquidation of the consequences thereof, assigns the following main tasks to the Ministry on Emergency Situations: (a) development and implementation of a unified state policy in the field of prevention and elimination of emergency situations of natural and man-made nature in peacetime and wartime, hydrometeorology, sustainable operation of waterworks, seismic observations, safe navigation of small vessels, protection of life and health of citizens in waterbodies; (b) early identification of risk factors and threats of emergencies, ensuring early prevention thereof; (c) providing comprehensive assistance to the population in the event of a risks to the life, health or property of citizens, strengthening and expanding public participation and interaction with local government, other civil society institutions in this area, ensuring timely notification and informing the public of existing risks; (d) development and management of the State system of prevention and action in emergency situations and civil protection of the Republic of Uzbekistan; (e) providing comprehensive monitoring and forecasting of risks of emergencies, performance of hydrometeorological and seismic observations in this field; (f) coordination of activities and organization of effective interaction of state and economic management bodies, local government and other organizations to ensure protection of the population and territories against emergency situations of natural and man-made nature, creating for these purposes state reserve funds for financial, food, medical, material and technical resources; (g) organization of the development and implementation of a set of measures and targeted scientific and technical programs for the preparation, performance and coordination of activities aimed at preventing emergencies, protecting the population and the national territory, supervising and effectively monitoring the safety of operation of waterworks, small vessels, waterbodies, as well as increasing the stability of the functioning of economic entities in the event of emergency situations; (h) organization and implementation of systematic training of the population, officials and formations of the State System on Emergency Situations for emergency response with a wide use of modern information and communication technologies and mass media; and (i) training of highly qualified professional staff and raising their qualifications.

Policy_Content: El presente Decreto aprueba el Reglamento a la Ley que crea el Sistema Nacional de Información y Registro Único de Beneficiarios del Estado (SINIRUBE), adscrito al Instituto Mixto de Ayuda Social (IMAS), con el objeto de regular el funcionamiento del SINIRUBE, su relación administrativa con otras instituciones del Estado y con las personas que requieren servicios, asistencias, subsidios o auxilios económicos estatales, por encontrarse en situaciones de pobreza o necesidad. El SINIRUBE se compone de una base de datos actualizada de cobertura nacional que contiene información de todas las personas físicas que requieren o podrían requerir servicios, asistencias, subsidios o auxilios económicos estatales, por encontrarse en condiciones de pobreza extrema o pobreza. Policy: Order No. 221 of the Minister of Agriculture validating the Regulation on the Committee on state inspection in the agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the Committee on state inspection in the agro-industrial complex shall be state body and institution subordinated to the Ministry of Agriculture performing regulatory, implementation and control functions in the field agro-industrial complex, in relation to plant protection and quarantine, grain market regulation, livestock breeding, crop production, and participation in strategic functions in the field of plant protection and quarantine. The Committee shall perform the following tasks: (a) implementation of state policy in the field of plant quarantine; (b) establishes qualification requirements for the appointment of Chief state plant quarantine inspector and state plant quarantine inspectors; (c) establishes the conditions for transit of produce subject to quarantine inspection; (d) ensures compliance with international standards and requirements in accordance with concluded agreements in the field of plant quarantine; (e) distributes pesticides (toxic chemicals) across the national territory, purchased with budgetary funds to carry out plant quarantine activities; (f) creates database on the presence and spreading of pests and diseases; (g) performs state purchase of pesticides; (h) organizes stocks of pesticides; (i) issues phytosanitary and quarantine certificates; (j) performs state quarantine phytosanitary supervision; and (k) performs constant inspection of produce subject to quarantine inspection. In the field of pedigree stockbreeding the Committee shall perform the following functions: (a) implementation of state policy; (b) keeps state register of selection achievements; (c) testing and approval of selection achievement; and (d) enforcement of legislation of pedigree stockbreeding.

Policy: Executive Order No. 27 s. 2017 directing all Government Agencies and Instrumentalities, including Local Government Units, to Implement the Philippine Development Plan and Public Investment Program for the Period 2017-2022.
Policy_Content: This Executive Order guides all Government Agencies and Instrumentalities, including Local Government Units, to Implement the Philippine Development Plan (PDP) and the Public Investment Program (PIP) for the Period 2017-2022. All departments, offices and instrumentalities of the national government, including government-owned or -controlled corporations (GOCCs), and the local government units, whether or not they receive funding support through the General Appropriations Act, are hereby directed to adopt and disseminate the PDP 2017-2022 and undertake efforts leading to its full implementation. All heads of departments, offices and instrumentalities of the national government, including GOCCs, are hereby directed to align their budgetary and departmental/corporate programs with the strategies and activities identified in the PDP 2017-2022. The Public Investment Program (PIP) 2017-2022 shall contain the priority programs and projects to be implemented by the national government based on the submissions of national government agencies and instrumentalities, including GOCCs, which must all adhere to the PIP formulation guidelines issued by the National Economic and Development Authority (NEDA) on 20 January 2017. The formulation of the PIP 2017-2022 shall be completed by July 2017 and updated annually and simultaneously with the preparations for the annual National Government budget, or as may be determined by NEDA.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Fisheries, Forestry, Water
Geographical_area: Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, East Asian Seas, North Pacific, South-Eastern Asia
Entry into force notes: This Executive Order enters into force effect immediately.

Policy: Planning Regulation 2017.
Policy_Content: The objective of the Planning Regulation 2017 is to prescribe instruments and address matters provided for under the Planning Act 2016, and provide the mechanics for the operation and implementation of the Act. The Regulation has been developed following an extensive review of State interests and ensures that matters requiring regulation or assessment are consistent with the principles for the review of state interests, as follows: a) State interests are managed through the most appropriate and effective planning tool for delivery; b) the state is accountable for state issues, local issues are a local government matter; c) state involvement in land use planning and development assessment occurs only where it is essential i.e. where a matter is of particular importance, has an unacceptable level of risk, or requires state expertise; d) amendments align with the Planning Act 2016, including a performance based planning focus; e) issues that are beyond the scope of the land use planning and development system under the Planning Act 2016 are addressed by other means. The objectives of the Regulation are to: support the operation and implementation of the Planning Act 2016 by prescribing matters dealt with, and instruments made, under the Act; support key government priorities; transition regulatory provisions from the State Planning Regulatory Provisions made under the repealed Sustainable Planning Act 2009, which are not continued as separate instruments under the Planning Act 2016.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Australia and New Zealand, Indian Ocean, Oceania, South Pacific

Policy: Code du Développement Territorial.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte le Code du Développement territorial de Wallonie. L’objectif du Code du Développement territorial est d’assurer un développement durable et attractif du territoire. Ce développement rencontre ou anticipe de façon équilibrée les besoins sociaux, économiques, démographiques, énergétiques, patrimoniaux, environnementaux et de mobilité de la collectivité, en tenant compte, sans discrimination, des dynamiques et des spécificités territoriales, ainsi que de la cohésion sociale. La Région, les communes et les autres autorités publiques, chacune, dans le cadre de ses compétences et en coordination avec la Région, sont acteurs, gestionnaires et garantes de ce développement. À cette fin, elles élaborent des outils d’aménagement du territoire et d’urbanisme qui sont les suivants: le plan de secteur; les schémas; le guide régional d’urbanisme; le guide communal d’urbanisme; et les outils de politique foncière. Les habitants et les acteurs publics et privés contribuent au développement durable et attractif du territoire, par leur participation à l’élaboration de ces outils, par le développement de projets et par les avis qu’ils émettent.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. UP-5066 “On radical improvement of efficiency of the system of prevention and liquidation of emergency situations”.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Decree establishes that emergency prevention, minimization and effective elimination of their consequences play an important role in ensuring a calm and safe life of the population, as well as the achievement of strategic goals of development of the country. It identifies the most important areas for improvement of the functioning of the system for prevention and liquidation of emergency situations and sets the tasks of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Republic of Uzbekistan. The tasks of the Ministry of Emergency Situations include: (a) development and implementation of a unified state policy in the field of prevention and liquidation of emergency situations of natural and technogenic nature in peacetime and wartime, hydrometeorology, sustainable functioning of hydraulic structures (waterworks), seismic observations, safe operation of small-size vessels, protection of life and health of citizens at waterbodies; and (b) early identification of risk factors and threats of emergencies, ensuring early prevention and warning of their occurrence and other tasks. The main tasks of the government commission for the prevention and emergency response are: (a) identification of the main directions for improvement and further development of the State system of warning and action in emergency situations; (b) definition of tasks of ministries, departments, Council of Ministers of the Republic of Karakalpakstan, khokimiyats (local government) of regions, districts (cities) and preparation of proposals for their solution; (b) organization and annual holding of months of civil protection (in spring period) and protection of the population and territories from emergencies (in the autumn period), aimed at improving the efficiency of preventive measures to prevent emergency situations; (c) coordination of activities of state authorities in the field, bodies of state and economic management, bodies of self-government of citizens on issues of socio-economic and legal protection, medical rehabilitation of citizens affected by accidents, catastrophes, natural and other disasters, as well as persons who participated in the liquidation of emergency situations.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Asia, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Guide Opérationnel, Plan d'Aménagement nº4 - Modalités de prise en compte de la faune dans les Plans d'Aménagement.
Policy_Content: Le but de ce document est de permettre au secteur privé forestier congolais de jouer le rôle qui est le sien dans la gestion durable d’une faune aujourd’hui globalement menacée. Ce Guide Opérationnel présente l’itinéraire technique visant à intégrer la problématique de la faune dans le processus d’aménagement forestier d‘une concession en RDC : l’élaboration des stratégies et de programmes de gestion à long terme, assis sur l’évaluation du statut de la faune dans la concession, sont tout d’abord présentés, dans le cadre de l’élaboration du plan d’aménagement. Puis les modalités de mise en oeuvre de ces programmes de gestion, spécifiques à chaque concession, sont traitées avant d’évoquer les modalités de suivi de l’impact de ces programmes sur la faune.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Guide Opérationnel, Plan de Gestions nº3 - Protocole de suivi de la mise en oeuvre des Plans de Gestion Provisoires et Quinquennaux.
Policy_Content: Conformément à ce guide, avant la validation du Plan d’Aménagement Forestier, la mise en oeuvre du Plan de Gestion Provisoire peut impliquer des changements importants dans l’organisation des entreprises. Elle nécessitera ainsi une phase d’apprentissage de la part des entreprises, que le Ministère se doit d’accompagner. Il est proposé à cet effet qu’un diagnostic technique et organisationnel soit établi au sein des concessions visitées à travers deux documents principaux : la fiche de suivi de la mise en oeuvre des plans de gestion ; et la feuille de route. La feuille de suivi de la mise en oeuvre est une fiche de terrain qui doit permettre à l’équipe en mission d’apprécier les différents critères évalués suivant les observations qui auront pu être effectuées sur le terrain. Sur base de cette fiche de suivi, l’équipe en mission doit établir la feuille de route qui sera transmise à la société afin de l’orienter dans la mise en oeuvre de son plan de gestion.
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, Least Developed Countries, South Atlantic

Policy: Guide Opérationnel, Plan Annuel d'Opérations nº1 - Principes d'Inventaire d'Exploitation.
Policy_Content: L’inventaire d’exploitation est un inventaire en plein servant à la planification et au suivi des opérations d’exploitation, ainsi qu’à l’évaluation des volumes extractibles. C’est une opération essentielle dans l’élaboration du Plan Annuel d’Opérations, qui permet la délivrance d’un permis de coupe pour l’Assiette Annuelle de Coupe concernée. Les normes d’inventaire d’exploitation en RDC visent à donner un cadre homogène pour l’ensemble des concessionnaires forestiers. Mais elles prennent aussi acte que chaque concessionnaire peut mettre en oeuvre de manière spécifique son dispositif, tant que les exigences de base sont respectées.

Policy: Regional Legislative Decree No. 15/2017/M approving the Tourism Planning Programme (POT) of the Autonomous Region of Madeira.
Policy_Content: This Regional Legislative Decree approves the Tourism Planning Programme (POT) of the Autonomous Region of Madeira. This Plan consists of 22 Norms divided into three Annexes specifying authorized tourism activities in wildlife, rural and urban areas, as follows: strategy for locating, settling and developing tourism areas, making the urban balance and environmental quality compatible, in the Territorial Models for the Islands of Madeira and Porto Santo, related to the land use, beaches, walking, riding and cycling, nature heritage, activities and outdoor sports compatible with the environment. In this context, the remaining IGT, namely POTRAM and PDM, will be responsible to specify the requirements for related territorial uses. Norm 18 applies to Natural Areas and Protected Areas. Tourism in the Marine Areas: POT identifies the Sea as one of the main strategic resources for the development of Tourism in the Region. The general guidelines for the planning and use of the Marine Areas, such as recreational and cruising, diving, surfing, maritime tourism activities and sport fishing are explained in the territorial models of the Islands of Madeira and Porto Santo and in the 'Plan for Cruise Zones and Sub-areas in the Maritime Area of ​​the RAM' (Annex III). Tourism Activities in the Coastal Zone: The tourism activities related to the recreation and the leisure and the nautical sports depend on equipment and dedicated infrastructures, located in Coastal areas. The Territorial Model of the POT, its development and implementation in relation to the beaches and the marine infrastructures in Norm 20 should be compatible with the POCs and related Plans.

Policy: Decree No. 9.066 regulating Law 8.629 on the settlement credits within the agrarian reform programme.

Policy: Decree No. 328 of the Cabinet of Ministers validating selection criteria and the list of perspective areas and deposits of strategically important type of solid mineral resources for geological exploration and industrial development with the involvement of foreign investments.
Policy_Content: The Government validates selection criteria of perspective areas and deposits of strategically important type of solid mineral resources for geological exploration and industrial development with the involvement of foreign investments (Annex 1), the list of perspective areas and deposits of strategically important type of solid mineral resources for geological exploration and industrial development with the involvement of foreign investments (Annex 2) and the list of strategically important type of solid mineral resources for geological exploration and industrial development with the involvement of foreign investments (Annex 3). Selection criteria for perspective areas shall be set forth as follows: (a) the absence of approved long-term state development and reproduction programs of the mineral deposits; (b) location - the territory within which there are indicators for conduct of geological exploration and geological prerequisites for the prospecting of minerals (with the exception of protected natural areas, border zones, zones of manifestations of dangerous geological processes and urban development and land-use planning); (c) the extension of the area - no more than 1500 sq. km; (d) the depth of the exploration area - within the perspective mineralization zones; (e) the presence of manifestations of other minerals within the prospective area is not limited; and (f) the presence of associated components (in ores) is not limited. Selection criteria for mineral deposits shall be set forth as follows: (a) absence of the validated long-term programs of metal manufacturing and perspective plans for the development of mining and extraction activities; (b) location outside protected areas, border zones and zones of manifestation of dangerous geological processes; (c) the depth of mineral deposits must be economically substantiated for mining and extraction of minerals; (d) the presence of manifestations of other minerals within the prospective area is not limited; and (e) environmental impact, including impact on potable water quality, and other technological emergency situations shall be excluded.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Liberian Code of Forest Harvesting Practices of 2017.
Policy_Content: This Code of Forest Harvesting Practices seeks to provide a set of guidelines to forest operators for carrying out sustainable and improved harvesting operations. It applies to all harvesting operations within Liberia’s natural forests. It includes among other things, social environmental and social performance requirements for timber logging and post-harvesting activities. Environmental requirements concern, among other things, operations respecting protected areas (including indigenous cultural tenure areas), soil, water resources, protected animal and plant species, the ecosystem and biodiversity generally. Particular attention is given to the protection of water resources. Broad-scale planning or land use validation is carried out by the FDA in consultation with concerned stakeholders prior to forest resource allocation in order to determine forest areas which may be designated as commercial forest areas, protected areas or multiple use forest areas. All these planning activities shall be made in accordance with this Code.

Policy: Resolution No. 616-r of the Cabinet of Ministers validating the Concept of reform of the state supervision system in the sphere of environmental protection.
Policy_Content: The Cabinet of Ministers defines the scope and the goals of the Concept of reform of the state supervision system in the sphere of environmental protection as follows: (a) creation of an effective system of prevention of the environmental offences and environmental monitoring; (b) reduction of pressure on the business environment, large-scale involvement of the public in supervision (control); (c) creation of unified integrated state body on nature protection, monitoring and supervision (control) – State Service. Implementation of the Concept shall be performed in three stages during 2017-2020. During the first phase (2017) it is envisaged: (a) approval by the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine of a plan of measures for implementation of the Concept; (b) setting up the State Service and validating its statute; (c) liquidation of the State Ecological Inspection and its territorial bodies; (d) run competition to fill the vacancies in the State Service and its interregional territorial offices; and transfer all the authority and competence from the State Ecological Inspection to the State Service. During the second phase (2018) it is envisaged: (a) amendment of the legislation to improve the supervisory system; (b) organization of monitoring and assessment of the state of the environment, ensuring functioning of the national environmental automated information-analytical system, and access to environmental information; (c) ensuring the adaptation of legislation in the field of environmental monitoring and supervision to the European norms; (c) formation of logistical and laboratory base for environmental monitoring and supervision by the State Service. During the third stage (2019-2020) it is envisaged: (a) creation and implementation an updated system of state environmental monitoring; (b) development and implementation of a new environmental standards and norms; and (c) introduce financial guarantee for environmental liability.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Investment Law No.72 of 2017.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 94 articles divided in VII Sections aims at governing the investment within the Arab Republic of Egypt and its provisions apply to local and foreign investment, regardless of its size, and investment shall be placed in accordance with the provisions of this Law, either under the regime of the Inland Investment, Investment Zones, Technological Zones, or Free Zones. Article 2 lists the principles governing both, the investor and the government in relation to investment in Egypt. Among these principles are the following (i) promoting fair competition, combating antitrust practices, and supporting entrepreneurship and SMEs; (ii) due consideration of social –related aspects, environment protection and public health; (iii) following the governance, transparency, and no-conflict of interest rules; (iv) assuring stability of investment policies; (v) facilitating and streamlining investment procedures; and (vi) the Government’s right to preserve national security and public interests. Section II deals with Investment guarantees and Incentives and the Law assures the following guarantees to all types of investments (i) fair and equitable treatment to both foreig n and Egyptian investors (the Cabinet has the authority, subject to reciprocity, to grant foreign investment, a more favorable treatment); (ii) prohibits coercive or discriminatory measures on invested money; (iii) foreign investors will be given a residence permit throughout the term of their investment project; (iv) investment is protected against nationalization (expropriation is allowed only for public interest and against fair market value compensation); (v) seizure of money is only allowed by virtue of a court judgment, except for tax and social insurance contribution dues; (vi) licenses given and state-owned land or property allocated to an investment project may not be withdrawn unless the following pre-steps are taken (1) giving the investor a prior notice, (2) giving the investor a grace period to cure the defect, and (3) obtaining the approval of the General Authority for Investment and Free Zones (GAFI); (vii) the right to repatriate profits outside Egypt and receive foreign funds to finance the project without restriction; (viii) facilitating liquidation procedures; (ix) import of machines, equipment, raw materials needed for the purpose of establishing, expanding, or operating the investment project without an importation license. As for incentives, the Law distinguishes between three types of them (i) general incentives, enjoyed by all investment projects, except free zone projects; (ii) special incentives, provided for in art.11 which introduces a new tax reduction system for a period of 3 years for projects established after the issuance of the Law; and (iii) additional incentives, which can be granted to investment projects listed under Article 11. An investment project can allocate up to 10% of its net income profit to participate in one of the following fields, to be deductible from its annual corporate tax (i) environment protection and enhancement; (ii) health, social, cultural services, or any other development areas; (iii) vocational education, research funding, awareness campaign in collaboration with universities or scientific institutions aiming at developing and enhancing production; and (iv) scientific training and research (art. 15).

Policy: Law No. 1413 “Sanitary Code”.
Policy_Content: This Sanitary Code regulates social relations in the field of healthcare and is aimed at the realization of the constitutional rights of citizens and protection of public health. Sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population shall be intended the state of public health and the human environment, in which there is no harmful effect of environmental factors on individual and favorable conditions for his activities are provided. State regulation in the sphere of sanitary protection of environment and human health shall include protection of mother and child, ensuring sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population, promotion of healthy nutrition and public participation on the issues of protection of public health. Use of hazardous chemical and biological agents (officially listed) harmful for public health of the present and the future generations shall be prohibited on the national territory. State Sanitary and Epidemiological Supervision Service shall be responsible for complex evaluation of environmental factors impact on sanitary and epidemiological situation, setting requirements for manufacturing, storage and transportation of foodstuffs, including infant food and food additives, and potable water. Citizens shall be granted the right to ecological, sanitary and epidemiological well-being and radiation safety. The state control in the sphere of circulation of infant food and designated infant food products is organized and performed by the authorized state body in the field of health care, other state bodies within the authority defined by the regulatory legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan. Infant food products must pass mandatory state certification. Label of infant food must contain the following information in state language: (a) priority and benefits of breastfeeding (breast milk) for child health; (b) the need for medical advice prior to the se of additional infant food; and (c) method of preparation, feeding schedule, observance of hygiene and disposal of residues of the prepared mixture.

Policy: Law No. 1416 “On seismic security”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines the organizational, legal, economic and social bases for ensuring seismic safety in the Republic of Tajikistan. Seismic security - safety of life of people, infrastructure, objects of national economy and the environment from the dangers arising from the earthquake. Early warning system of earthquake - the organizational and technical integration of forces and specialized technical means of notification and communication systems, as well as channels of territorial and departmental communication networks that provide the transmission of warning signals and information about earthquakes. Seismic security of buildings and structures shall be ensured in compliance with current norms and rules of earthquake-resistant construction, as well as technical regulations, land-use planning schemes and master plans. The main objectives of seismic security shall be as follows: (a) implementation of the state seismic security policy by the authorized state body on seismic security; (b) ensuring the priority of the principles of preparedness, early warning and mitigation of consequences in the national and international policy on seismic safety; (c) equal priority of all elements of seismic risk reduction; (d) involvement in the implementation of state and intergovernmental programs to reduce seismic risk of state bodies, self-government bodies of villages and villages, and civil society; and (e) involvement of international organizations in the implementation of government programs to reduce seismic risk. This Law consists of 7 Chapters divided into 29 Articles. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards state management of seismic security. Chapter 3 regards seismic risk evaluation. Chapter 4 regards assessment and reduction of seismic risk. Chapter 5 establishes rights and duties of natural and legal persons for ensuring seismic security. Chapter 6 regards international cooperation. Chapter 7 lays down final provisions.

Policy: Order No. 390 of the Ministry of Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the national park “Anyui”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Anyui” shall be Khabarovsk region of the Russian Federation. National park “Anyui” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sports and artisanal hunting, commercial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals; (n) water logging; (o) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (p) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (q) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear, except for indigenous peoples as part of traditional way of life and traditional rights thereof; (r) blasting operations; (s) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (t) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (u) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (v) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; (w) movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places (except for cases related to the functioning of the national park) and flight of aircraft less than 500 meters above the territory of the national park without prior authorization by the Institution; (x) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; and (y) keeping unleashed dogs outside the cages or other structures that limit the zone of their movement, and training of dogs, except for indigenous peoples as part of traditional way of life and traditional rights thereof; (z) ploughing up of the territory, haymaking (except for forest fire fighting purposes); and application of chemicals, fertilizers, nutrients and plant protection means.
